Mrs. Duong Thi N., 38 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children who are still going to school. Her husband is a motorbike-taxi driver and she sells fruits. Every day she sells fruits in 2 different markets, earning 4-5 USD/ day. Her activity takes lots of effort but it helps her covering her children’s school tuition. Her husband also helps her whenever she is in difficulties. Therefore, joining the Fund is very convenient for her. This time, Mrs. N. wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more fruits.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị N., 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chồng chạy xe ôm còn chị N. buôn bán hoa quả. Mỗi ngày chị bán hàng tại 2 chợ khác nhau, thu nhập bình quân 4-5USD/ngày. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng giúp chị N. có điều kiện cho 2 con ăn học tử tế. Chồng chị cũng luôn hỗ trợ vợ mỗi khi có khó khăn nên việc tham gia Quỹ đối với chị rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị N. xin vay 575USD mua thêm hoa quả bán.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Khen Sok Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mrs Khen S. and this group comprises five members in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs Khen S. and her husband, Mr Soeurn Bun, are cake sellers in the local village. Mrs Khen S. now wants to expand her business; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to purchase more cakes to sell. Therefore, Mrs Khen S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs Khen S. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Previously, Mrs Khen S. obtained a loan to buy four pigs for breeding. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To purchase more cakes to sell.

loans.name: Koudjoukalo

texts.fr: At 38, Mrs. Koudjoukalo K. E. A. is married and the mother of 3 children. Ever since she was a little girl, she belonged to choirs in her native village of Bassar, due to her remarkable voice. Today she lives in Lomé and has had the opportunity to excel in the domain of music, indeed, she is a star gospel singer. This year she put out an album and wants to have it reproduced so it can be marketed. She is requesting this first loan which will help her to get the reproduction done. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer A 38 ans, madame K. E. A. koudjoukalo est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Dès son jeune age, elle a fait partie des chorales dans son village natal à Bassar, à cause de sa voix remarquable. Aujourd’hui elle vit à Lomé et elle a eu l’opportunité d’exceller dans le domaine de l’art musical, ce qui fait d’elle une vedette de la chanson gospel. Cette année elle a fait sortir un album et désir faire la multiplication des disques pour la commercialisation. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit qui l’aidera à faire cette multiplication de disque.

loans.use: reproduction of a music albumMultiplication de disque

loans.name: Mrs. Saem Touch Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saem T. is the leader of this 5 member group, located in the Kandal Province of Cambodia. She runs her business selling her home-made Khmer cakes. Her business is going very well and she has a lot of customers. In order to reach her customers’ demand, Mrs. Saem T. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more sticky rice and other goods to make Khmer cakes. Mrs. Saem T. is a 46-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory worker, whilst the other attends school. The remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase more sticky rice and others material to make Khmer cake.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
La señora Lily, pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, como jugos de frutas naturales, tamales, juanes, humitas, arroz chaufa, papa rellena, cutacho, kekes, sándwiches y refrescos. El negocio lo realiza en la casa de su suegra, en el Jr, Libertad Nº 460,  lugar donde acuden sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, colegiales y transeúntes.

Con este crédito recibido de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de potes de un cuarto de kilo, azúcar, leña, maíz, arroz, papa, huevo, frutas naturales, panes, y otros ingredientes que a diario necesita para la preparación de los refrigerios que oferta.

Lily es natural de San Antonio de Cumbaza, lugar donde ella cultiva la uva,  tiene 21 años, es una mujer responsable y emprendedora. Su meta es la de industrializar las uvas en la elaboración de mermeladas y néctares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lily belongs to the "Meanwhile" Credit Group, "Little Pearl" division. She lives in the San Martin providence in the district of Tarapoto. She is a food saleswomen, including fruit juices, tamales, juanes (a typical andean food), sweet corn, a rice and meat dish (arroz chaufa), stuffed potatoes, a plantain and peanut dish (cutacho), pastries (kekes), sandwiches and soft drinks. Lily operates the business out of her mother-in-law's house, which is located at 460 Jr. Libertado street. The majority of her clients are neighbors, schoolchildren and passers-by. With the 1,000 soles loan which will be repaid in 6 months, Lily will purchase a 1/4 kilogram pot as well as sugar, wood, corn, rice, potatoes, eggs, fruit, bread and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes. Lily is from San Antonio de Cumbaza, where she also works as a grape-harvester. She is 21 years old and a responsible and enterprising woman. Her goal is to industrialize the process of making grapes into nectars and marmalades.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, wood, corn, rice, potatoes, eggs, fruit, and bread

loans.name: Maryam M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Maryam Baji is the widow of M. Ishaq and lives in a small area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. It is half an hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Maryam Baji has been living in this area for the last 31 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a grocery shop. The next has a shuttering business. Her younger sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her daughter makes thread and sells it in the market. Maryam Baji also helps her daughter in making thread. She is applying for a loan to buy beams to expand her son's shuttering business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Suraiya Baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Zareena Baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her clinic.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy beams for shuttering business

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroen P. was born in 1962 and now lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a fruit seller. 

She is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. With the revenue from her fruit sales, she does not have much money to support her family's needs.

Thus, Mrs. Saroen P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her children to go to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to go to work.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates in seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Daniel A. is a part of the Nonvignon group along with his wife, Elizabeth Houindoedji. They live in a small house near the lake with their four children. Eight years ago he left his job as a chief cook, and has since taken up fishing. Daniel fishes with his trusty net, oar, and basket. Daniel sells Sorabi (Beninese liquor) and assorted items along with his fish.

Daniel has been with Kiva for about four years. With his current loan, he will buy nets, fishing rods, and Sorabi.

loans.use: Purchase of nets, fishing rods, and Sorabi liquor

loans.name: Sheroz

texts.en:
A. Sheroz is a young, energetic man. From the early age of 18, he started his own business in order to support his parents. His business is selling home products in the famous market of Khujand city, “Panjshanbe”. This business allows him not only to support his family household but also to continue his University education.  Sheroz needs to increase the variety of goods he sells and is asking for a loan of $ 800 USD with a term of 9 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business and earn more income. This loan will be an important part in the growth of Sheroz’s business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy various home products for resale

loans.name: Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les huit (08) femmes du groupe Dèmè ont un âge moyen de 39 ans toutes mariées, elles vivent à moitié dans des familles polygamiques avec les beaux parents et d’autres ménages au quartier Bozo Diamarabougou de Markala (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 4 enfants et se sont connues par les liens d’amitié et de voisinage.
Ce groupe fait le commerce des articles divers.
Après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents, le groupe est à son 4ème prêt pour un montant de 1 000 000FCFA qui  sera utilisé pour acheter, 90 paniers de poissons frais, 6 sacs de riz, 1 sac de fonio, 50kgs de graines d’arachide et divers autres articles. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger ; le riz et le fonio sont achetés à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou et à Dougabougou. Le poisson est vendu à Markala et à Ségou a l’état frais frit et /ou fumé. Le riz est revendu tel qu’il est alors que le fonio est transformé en  sur place au Bozo kin Diamarabougou. A côté de ces produits, elles vendent un peu de bois  de chauffe et de condiments achetés respectivement à Fakelen et Diamarabougou où ils sont revendus. Ces produits sont vendus au comptant ou à crédit  à  une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 37 660 FCFA  qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour rembourser les prêts de Soro Yiriwaso et payer les frais scolaires des enfants. Elles ont pour ambition d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et le volume de     leurs activités commerciales afin d’avoir un jour une maison d’habitation qui leur est propre.
texts.en:
The 8 women of the Dèmè group have an average age of 39. They are all married and half of them live in polygamous families with their parents-in-law and the others in households in the Bozo Diamarabougou district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have on average 4 children each and know each other because of friendships and from living in the same neighborhood. This group sells various items.

After having correctly reimbursed their preceding loans, the group is on their 4th loan in the amount of 1,000,000 F CFA which will be used to buy 90 baskets of fresh fish, 6 sacks of rice, 1 sack of "fonio" (a type of millet), 50 kgs of peaunts and various other items. They buy their fish on the banks of the Niger river; the rice and fonio are bought at the weekly markets of Diamarabougou and Dougabougou. The fish is sold in Markala and Ségou, either fried or smoked. The rice is sold as is, whereas the fonio is processed right in Bozo Kin Diamarabougou. Besides these products, they sell a little firewood as well as condiments bought in Fakelen and Diamarabougou where they are re-sold. These products are sold for cash or credit to a clientele composed of women and men.

They expect to make an average profit of 37,660 F CFA which will be used essentially to reimburse the Soro Yiriwaso loan and pay the school fees for their children. Their ambition is to grow their working capital and the volume of their businesses so as to be able to have their own homes one day.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn L. lives in Thmey village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uok Kang, is a farmer who cultivates rice on his plot of land. He has to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow his field, because they have only one ox. To reduce her expenses, Mrs. Thorn L. needs a loan to buy a second ox to help plow the field.  She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: Buy a second ox to help plow a field.

loans.name: Cinthia Isabel,

texts.es:
A pesar de no tener más responsabilidad que la de su propio crecimiento como persona, sobre todo en lo profesional, Cinthia no desaprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan cuando de poner un negocio propio se trata.

Hasta hace medio año estuvo vendiendo útiles escolares ofreciéndolos de casa en casa, a amigos o familiares. En ese entonces, aún seguía cursando sus estudios de educación inicial. Anteriormente, había trabajado como profesora adjunta en un colegio donde estuvo durante dos años y medio. No obstante, hace poco ha conseguido un puesto como profesora en un colegio cerca a su casa. 

Cuando este mas estable y disponga de tiempo para organizarse, le gustaría volver a tener un negocio propio en el cual invierta su dinero y su tiempo libre. Tal vez alquile un local en el cetro de Chosica para abrir un puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Despite not having any further responsibilities besides her own personal growth, above all professionally, Cinthia takes advantage of the opportunities that present themselves when they concern running her own business Up until 6 months ago she was selling school supplies door to door to friends and acquaintances. During this time she continued her studies to be a grade school teacher. Previously she worked as an adjunct teacher in a school for two and a half years. Nevertheless, recently she was able to get a position as a teacher at a school near her house. Once she is more stable and has the time to get organized, she would like to once again have her own business in which she can invest her money and free time. Perhaps she will rent a storefront in the downtown Chosica so that she can open a food stall.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make decoritive handicrafts.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Olivia es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Olivia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verdura, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Olivia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Olivia son surtir su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olivia is a member of the Gratitud Community Bank. She is married, 45 years old, and has 4 children. Olivia has a store in her home where she sells groceries--mainly vegetables and fruit. She works in the store every day with the help of her children. Olivia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Olivia's dreams are to supply her business and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Osarugue

texts.en: Osarugue is 48 years old and is married with 6 children. She sells garri, in retail, to her customers (garri is a food made from cassava tubers). She hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Mrs. Nilda C. is 43 years old and married with four children. She is supported by her husband, who is a hard-working operator of a lumber planer, and by her daughter, who is already working abroad. Mrs. C. is a vendor of food. She started with her own capital but now her business needs a bigger amount from PMPC so she can sell more items. She applied for a loan of PHP 25,000.00.

She want to have her own residential lot with the help and financing from Kiva through Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: This loan will be used for food vending

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy I. sells medicines in retail to her customers. She is 36 years old and married with two children. 

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 (US$350) to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
G. Firuza sells groceries such as tinned products, sweets, soft drinks, and others. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a businessman. Firuza has been selling groceries since 2001. She is responsible for paying for food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her grocery inventory in her store. Firuza hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project she has started with her husband.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’objets plastiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Faisant face à une rupture de stock, elle voudrait s’approvisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des assiettes en plastiques, des gobelets en plastiques, des sceaux en plastiques, des sacs en plastiques et divers autres objets en plastiques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle contribue aux charges de son foyer avec le revenu de son commerce.
texts.en:
This woman sells plasticware to earn a living; she has been in this business since 2004 and buys her inventory at the big open-air market of Lomé. Since she presently is out of stock, she would like to replenish her inventory and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy plastic plates and glasses, plastic buckets, plastic bags, and various other items made of plastic.

She is married and the mother of 2 children. She helps support the family out of the income from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plasticware for resale

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Son P., 27, is the leader of this group loan that is composed of four low-profit people. Son P. is requesting a loan to hire a carpenter to paint her old house that often leaks during heavy rains. Son P. earns a living working as porter in a busy fish market, while her husband is a fish delivery driver. The couple has two teenage children who attend the local school.

There are three other borrowers in this group.

T. is applying for a loan to buy wood in order to build a new house.
R. is a security guard. She will use her loan to buy a motor vehicle to drive to work.
S. will be using a loan to repair her old house that has broken.

loans.use: To hire a carpenter to paint her old house.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es: Lorena Elizabeth M. A. de 26 años de edad reside en Ayuxtuctepeque municipio de  San Salvador. Lorena  vive con sus tres hijos todos menores de edad y estudiantes, Lorena ha logrado sostener a su familia a través de lo que ella sabe hacer confeccionar, profesión con  la cual ha conseguido establecer su propio negocio donde confecciona a la medida y produce todo tipo de ropa para comercializar; el crédito que solicita Lorena es  para compra de materia prima como tela, hilo y elástico que le ayuden a sacar su producción en ropa.
texts.en:
Lorena Elizabeth M. A. is 26 years old and lives in the Ayuxtuctepeque area of the city of San Salvador. She has three dependent children who are students. Lorena has managed to support her family by sewing, a skill that allowed her to start her own business making all types of clothing.

Lorena is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials such as fabric, thread and elastic that are necessary for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Gonzales , Jr

texts.en:
Gonzales Jr B. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old. Gonzales Jr is single. To make a living, Gonzales Jr owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Gonzales Jr has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gonzales Jr joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gonzales Jr is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gonzales Jr from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Marleni es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y espera un bebe, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Santa Maria Av. Circunvalación 2872.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 meses, con un préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana para la elaboración de chompas en tejido a palito y además accesorios por pedido.

Su deseo es tener una empresa de ventar y exportación de artesanías.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Marleni is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucero del Amanecer” (Morning Star), which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and hopes to have a baby. She has a high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Maria Av. Circunvalación 2872.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 5 months. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested into her business of making handicrafts.

Sra. Marleni is currently requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy wool for manufacturing woven sweaters as well as accessories upon request. She hopes to have a business selling and exporting her handicrafts. She enjoys her line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in different colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar Mosquiteros, short de hombres, pescadores de mujer, toallas grandes, pantalón de damas, y pañales.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells cooked foods and drinks.She has been in this business for long.She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers.she is 50 years old and married with 7 children.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years-old and married. Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosalinda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jenry

texts.en:
Jenry L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 30 years old and is single. Jenry owns and operates a specialized "homay" retail store, buying and selling animal feed and rice in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jenry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animal feed products and rice to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice and animal feed products to sell

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Keng K., 49, is married with four children. She lives in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells food from a cart attached to a motorbike. She has new and established customers and earns $5 US per day. Her husband helps with the business. The family is also supported by three of the children who are currently employed in a local garment factory earning $5 US each to help cover the family's expenses.

K. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase more food to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food for a food cart

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 27 years old, is single, and takes care of three dependents aged 10, 13 and 15. She lives in Gasabo district, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Diane has been a tailor for the past two years and she is still going strong! She employs two people from her community and they work from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. everyday except Sunday.

Diane is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase two additional sewing machines so that she may expand her sewing business and create two more jobs. With this additional business, Diane will sew different styles which are highly demanded by young people.

If this strategy is successful, Diane will be able to reinvest a portion of the revenue through the creation of more sources of income in order to ensure the financial stability of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing clothes and and two additional sewing machines

loans.name: Balogun

texts.en:
Balogun is 60 years old and is married with nine children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Balogun sells palm kernel at retail prices to his customers to make a living. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more palm kernel to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Balogun is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel to sell

loans.name: Ruth Evelina

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth Evelina O. M. es conviviente, vive en casa propia en el sector Santa Dominguita distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en edad escolar. Cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual es conducido por ella misma. Su esposo en la actualidad está realizando labores de obrero de campo en parcelas de un vecino de la zona en donde vive. No posee endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. Son personas muy trabajadoras que han construido parte de su vivienda de material noble. Sus excedentes los han derivado en arreglos de su casa y educación de su hijo. Requieren de un financiamiento para inversión en su negocio ya que pretenden comprar una congeladora para aprovechar la temporada de verano porque tienen mayor demanda de bebidas. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y lograr construir totalmente su vivienda. La Sra. O. y su esposo agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través de financiamientos y logar mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth Evelina O. M. lives with her husband and her school aged son in their own house in the Santa Dominguita area, district of Santiago. She runs a grocery store and her husband is doing some contracted agricultural work for a neighbor in the area where they live. They do not have any open loan with any financial institution, they are hard working people who have taken particularly care of their home. They invested their savings in house improvements and in the education of their son. They are now requesting a loan to invest in their business, as they want to buy a refrigerator for the upcoming summer season, when the request of beverages increases. Their dream is to see their business growing and to be able to finalize the construction of their house. Mrs. O. and her husband are very grateful for the support they are receiving with this loan that will allow them to improve the quality of their life.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Unidas Somos Mas(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas somos Más  esta formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan día a día la superación personal y familiar con el fruto de su trabajo, viven por el sector  Nonodel a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, sus reuniones las hacen en campo abierto en medio de un paisaje natural en donde se ve la naturaleza en todo su esplendor y estado natural.

La señora Rosa León tiene 29 años  vive en union libre con su pareja y sus cinco hijos de 10,8, 5, 3 y 1 año de edad,  sus 3 primeros hijos estudian en la escuela Martin Huelte en  la comunidad Rumipamba por lo que tienen que caminar 30 minutos para llegar al plantel educativo, su esposo trabaja acerrando madera. La casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad construyéndola con mucho amor  donde se refleja todo el esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y  trabaja  tres días a la semana ya sea lavando ropa ajena o labrando la tierra de sus vecinos, siendo su prima quien la lleva a trabajar ya que ella tiene muchos conocidos que solicitan  sus servicios, tambien se dedica a la cria de cuyes, gallinas  que son tanto para su consumo personal como para la venta en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Este es su tercer crédito en la Fundación  fue su cuñada la que la incentivo para formar parte de su banco comunal  y los créditos le han beneficiado para superarse poco a poco en su hogar, con el préstamo que le entreguen  lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos, cuyes junto con su alimento.

Su gran sueño es que sus hijos estudien y  salgan adelante.  

Rosario B. tiene 33 años es otra socia de éste banco, vive en la parroquia Quingeo con su esposo y sus seis hijos  de 15, 12, 10, 6, 3 años  y uno de 2 meses de nacido. Su esposo es albañil actividad que le ha permitido ir construyendo poco a poco su casa propia y mantener a su familia

Ella se dedica a la cria de ganado, cuyes, gallinas que son para su consumo familiar y  nos comenta que su ganando lo vende solo cuando tiene algun apuro economico, tambien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Nuestra socia se encuentra en su primer crédito y es su cuñada quien la invito a este grupo de amigas que buscan la superación de sus  familias 
 

Con el préstamo que la  FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar  abono para el pasto y su gran sueño es salir adelante para brindarles un  buen  presente y futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Unidas Somos Más communal bank is made up of a group of hard-working women who daily seek their personal and their family’s progress through their work. They live in the Nonodel sector, which is about 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. They meet outdoors surrounded by natural scenery where Nature is seen in all her splendor and natural state. Rosa León, 29, lives with her life partner and their 5 children, who are 10, 8, 5, 3, and 1 years old. Her oldest three children are enrolled in the Martin Huelte elementary school, which is in Rumipamba; it’s a 30-minute walk to school. Her husband works hauling lumber. They own their own house which they built with lots of love and which reflects all their hard work. Rosa farms and works three days a week either taking in laundry or working her neighbors’ fields; her cousin takes her to work because she has many contacts who request their services. In addition, she raises guinea-pigs and chickens, both for her own personal consumption and to sell in the city of Cuenca. This is her third loan with the Foundation; her sister-in-law encouraged her to be part of a communal bank. The loans have gradually helped her to get ahead in her home. The loan she will get now will be used to buy chickens, guinea-pigs and animal feed. Her great dream is that her children study and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea-pigs, animal feed and natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his parents and 2 brothers. He is the one who supports his family with his business. He has been working as a farmer for the past 10 years. He cultivates parsley, zucchini, and tomatoes on his land.

Today, Khodor is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy seeds and fertilizers for the next harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Julia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como promotora de cultura y deportes en la Alcaldía de El Sauce donde promueve a los jóvenes a participar en actividades culturales. Actualmente tiene año y medio de laborar en este cargo. Este es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, zinc y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pequeña cocina en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is from El Sauce. She is a Sports and Culture promoter for the city of El Sauce where she encourages youngsters to participate in cultural activities. She has had this job for a year and a half. This is her first loan with Ceprodel. It will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: bricks, cement, zinc metal sheeting and to pay labor costs to build a small kitchen in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Petrona Cecilia E. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 16 años tiene un tramo de vena de verduras y frutas viaja  a la capital una vez a la semana a comprar mercadería  para abastecer su negocio, el tramo esta ubicado del alambra 1/2c al norte 1/2c al este en el callejon de verduras por el marisco.
Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 1,000, abre su negocio diario sin descansar de cinco de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde sus financiamientos los ocupa par el mismo negocio  tiene tres hijos  y solo uno depende de ella  lleva seis años de trabajar con ceprodel  y ella manifiesta que con estos financiamientos en su desarrollo económico le han ayudado bastante ya que ha mejorado el negocio y a la vez su calidad de vida ha ido progresando grandemente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona Cecilia E. has been a merchant in this market for 16 years. She has an assigned spot for selling green vegetables and fruit. She travels to the capital once a week to purchase merchandise to supply her business. Her spot is located a half-block to the north and a half-block to the east of the fence, in the alleyway for green vegetables, by the shellfish. She began her business with C$1,000 capital, and is open for business every day without taking a break, from five in the morning until four in the afternoon. Her loans are used for this very business. She has three children, only one is a dependent. She has spent six years working with Ceprodel, and she has demonstrated that these loans have helped her significantly in her economic development, as her business has improved and at the same time her quality of life has progressed tremendously.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cabbage, carrots, tomatoes, onions, scallops, plums, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva V. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing photography services to local community members. Eva has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Eva joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. Eva is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she has chosen to borrow the same amount as her first loan cycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
44-year-old Ariel raises pigs for a living. He is married with four children. His oldest child is age 22. He says that his business is really helpful to his family, especially for his children's education. He hopes that someday all of his children will graduate from college and have a bright future. He also hopes to have a stable income. 

Ariel requests a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. where he is a member. He will use it to buy additional piglets and also feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Gull-E- Badam Group

texts.en:
Bashi K., the son of S. W. K., is 53 years old and the leader of the G.-E- Badam group. He is married and the father of 6 children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is an educated man. He has a shop in Kabul where he sells books and magazines. Now he wants to enlarge his bookstore and buy more books for his shop.

Therefore, he has a requested a loan to buy books and magazines for his shop. He wants to work hard to make a better future for all of his family, especially for his son who works with him. He is sure that he can be more successful and further his business.

loans.use: buy books and magazines for his book shop

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena G. O. tiene 28 años de edad. Ella es casada, y tiene 2 hijos: Danita de 5 años y Patricio de 9 meses.  Viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

María Elena es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios.

Al momento, María Elena se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su domicilio y tiene una mini tienda. Ella compra los productos  para su pequeño negocio en Bucay. Solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio.  Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
María Elena G. O. is 28 years old, married, and has two children: Danita (age 5) and Patricio (age 9 months). They live in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. María Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. There are 15 members in the group, most of whom have small businesses. At the moment, María Elena devotes her time to performing her household chores and managing a tiny store. She buys products in Bucay for her small business. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her business. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her business

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel P. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Maridel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maridel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the local community member. Maridel is just starting this business.

In 2006, Maridel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maridel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maridel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maridel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Mirly

texts.en: Mirly N.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 58 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the town of Sta. Josefa. Mirly has been in her business for over 25 years now. Mirly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mirly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mirly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be her eighth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. In addition to credit for its clients, CEVI also provides savings, insurance and training through regular cluster group meetings. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: Ana Victoria C. de 26 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, y así mismo vive junto a su hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual asiste al kinder,  en la actualidad Ana esta embarazada de su segundo hijo. Ana se dedica  a la venta de zapatos para mujeres, hombres y niños, así mismo comercializa sandalias tanto formales como informales. Su venta esta ubicada en la calle principal llamada Francisco Morazán siempre en el departamento de Sonsonate, la cual es una calle de mucho comercio debido a que se encuentran diferentes negocios y ventas ambulantes y así mismo es muy transitado por una gran cantidad de personas. Ella desea poder aumentar sus ventas y así percibir mayores ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos y sandalias, en diferentes tallas y estilos y así poder llamar la atención de muchas más personas las cuales sean compradores potenciales, todo esto lo hace con la ilusión de mejorar sus ventas y así poder contar con el dinero necesario para  mejorar la estabilidad del hogar y también contar con todo lo necesario para la tan esperada llegada de su bebé.
texts.en:
Ana Victoria C., 26, lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Sonsonate. She lives there with her husband, a merchant, who sells a variety of products and her 6-year old son who is in kindergarten. She is now pregnant with her second child. Ana operates a business selling women's, men's and children's shoes. She also sells sandals, both formal and casual. She operates the business on a main street called Francisco Morazan, a major commercial street with many street vendors, a wide range of businesses, and plenty of foot traffic. Ana wants to increase her sales and, in turn, her earnings, something that would greatly help her family. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy larger supplies of shoes and sandals in different sizes and styles and, consequently, appeal to a larger number of prospective customers. The extra revenue will allow her to make the money she needs to better provide for her family and get the things she needs for the new baby.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Bertha Piedad

texts.es:
Bertha Piedad V. G., tiene 45 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos,  Jhony y Julio. 

Bertha es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Bertha  se dedica al comercio, tiene un bar donde vende jugos. Las compras las realizan a diario en el mercado de la localidad, vende en un bar en la misma Comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio e incrementar con ropa y viveres. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para arreglar la casa y aumentar el negocio. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Bertha Piedad V. G. is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her sons in Ventanas, a town in the province of Los Ríos. She has two sons, Jhony and Julio. Bertha is a member of the "Y" communal bank, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has 17 members, mostly working in agriculture. This is their first loan through the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. Bertha is a merchant. She has a bar where she sells juice. She buys her ingredients daily at the local market. Her bar is also there. She applies for a loan to invest in her business and purchase more clothes and groceries. She believes that the loan will provide an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to have enough money to repair her house and expand her business. Lack of money is a challenge she has to face. Bertha enjoys listening to music.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and purchase more clothes and groceries

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 4 años y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad al préstamo y el incentivo al ahorro.
Milagro es conviviente, tiene 22 años y una hijas de 6 años, Milagro estudio cosmetología y trabaja en un salón de belleza, en donde también vende cosméticos por catalogo y también los exhibe en el salón, también brinda servicios a domicilio. Además Milagro junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con la cual trabaja su esposo.
Milagro necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de cosméticos y la reparación de su mototaxi.
Milagro sueña con tener una casa propia pues ahora vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Milagro has been a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millenium) for four years. What she enjoys most are the convenience of the loans and having the incentive to save.

Milagro is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a six year old daughter. She is studying cosmetology and works at a beauty salon where she also sells cosmetics through a catalog. Milagro also displays her cosmetics at the salon and provides home services. Her husband has a motorcycle taxi that he uses for work.

Milagro needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy cosmetics and pay for motorcycle taxi repairs. She dreams of having her own home since she currently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & pay to repair her husband's motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Santa Celestina

texts.es: Santa Celestina es de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene cinco hijos varones y tres  mujeres, es Artesana, en la actividad tiene más de ocho años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito, para compra de activos para elaboración de cortes típicos, es una inversión rentable lo cual beneficiara a la solicitante para poder pagar el préstamo sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Santa Celestina is 47 years old and married. She has five sons and three daughters. She is an artisan, and she has over eight years of experience in this activity. She is requesting a loan to buy goods for making typical clothing. It is a profitable investment, which will be beneficial to her in order to be able to pay for the loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making typical clothing

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Desde muy pequeña Luz ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano y café de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar muy concurrido por la demanda de los productos que cosechan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luz is 39 years old and a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own home and wants to work hard so she can progress in life. Since she was little, she has worked with her parents cultivating their land. Over the years, she has been able to buy her own land and now she is one of the primary growers of bananas and coffee in the Chanchamayo province, a place known for its agricultural products. Her favorite part of her job is taking care of her products which she does lovingly; she has done this work for 15 years and feels like the most difficult part is taking the products to market. It is very difficult to find trucks that are willing to carry the heavy sacks of crops. Over time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production. This is her 3rd loan through MFP and she is confident that she will pay it back punctually as she has always done. In her village bank, she is a very happy and unified member. With the 2000 soles ($725 USD) she is seeking, she will buy fertilizer to improve the production of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to improver her productivity

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en:
Narmandah J. is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Huvsgul province in northern Mongolia with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a carpenter and builds wooden furniture. One of her sons attends college while the other is in elementary school.

In 2003 Narmandah completed her schooling in hairdressing and began work. Today she rents a seat at a salon called “Youth.” Narmandah says, “My dream is to have my own workspace and expand my business even more so I can provide a good education for my children.” She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her salon business

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo y siguen trabajando activamente todas en conjunto y también cada una con sus emprendimientos que les genera ganancias.
 Una de ellas y una de las mas trabajadoras y activas es la Sra. Teodosia Balmaceda de 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas quienes la  ayudan  en su trabajo ya que ella es de  profesión peluquera. 
Tiene su peluquería en su casa con clientela formada es una persona muy activa y también hace comestible los fines de semanas para tener más ingresos, para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa. 
Actualmente quiere anexar a su peluquería aprovechando la concurrencia de la gente, ropas de la temporada de verano, y para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, vestidos, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is in its eighth loan cycle and they are actively working together as well as in their respective business that generate profits for them.
One of the members, and one of the hardest working, is Teodosia. She is 50 years old, has 2 daughters who help her with her work, and she is a hairdresser. 
She runs her hairdressing business from home and has regular customers. She is a very active person and also makes and sells food at the weekends to bring in more income to cover the household expenses. 
Currently, she wants to add another service to her hairdressers, taking advantage of the fact that people are there: she plans to sell summer clothes, and for this she is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts, and other things.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts, and other things.

loans.name: Ruzikhol

texts.en:
Ruzikhol M. is married and has two children. She runs a small business primarily selling candies and sweets. She has been in this business for about ten years. One of Ruzikhol’s goals is to be able to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions.

Ruzikhol has requested a loan of 6500 TJS to buy additional candies and sweets. She is concerned that prices will go up soon and would like to buy in bulk now when prices are lower. The loan will help Ruzikhol increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Castor

texts.en:
Castor B. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 44 years old. Castor is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Castor owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Castor has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Castor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Castor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Castor is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Castor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers like manure

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie P. is from the village of Sangay Diot, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lenie owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lenie has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second taken out by Lenie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additonal inventory and working capital

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo L. is a 66-year-old widow and a mother of six children. She sells makuti (traditional palm-leaf roofing) at Mjanaheri in Malindi town. The lady was introduced to KADET LIMITED by a client who is already registered with KADET. She has been in this business for the past six years. Kadzo is applying for her first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings and plans to buy more materials for making makutis to sell to her customers. This will improve her daily sales. She intends to use the anticipated profit to help continue supporting her family as well as to expand her business.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
In Yea P'aeu village, Takeo province, this group consists of five people, applying for a group loan. Mrs. Khorn N. leads this group loan and she has been selected by the other group members. Each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standards of living.

She and husband, Mr. Hul Some, are farmers who own a small piece of land. They grow rice to sell in order to support their family. Mr. Hul Some is also a fisherman. Currently, Mrs. Khorn N. has some problems because her field has infertile soil. There are a lot of insects and the land is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. Khorn N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline. She has one child who is too young yet to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy treatments for his crops

loans.name: Sounkoura

texts.fr:
Madame Sounkoura Traoré  est une célibataire âgée de 44 ans, sans enfant qui vit dans une famille nucléaire dans le village de Sanankoroba, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, Sounkoura,  qui est enseignante de formation entreprena plusieurs activités mais finit par apprendre auprès de sa  tante, le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes fancy, wax et la fabrication et vente d’encens. Elle a cinq ans d’expériences dans le domaine, elle est très sollicitée.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, Sounkoura décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Sounkoura compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de matières premières entrant dans la fabrication de l’encens. EIle effectue sa vente à domicile et  au marché de Sanankoroba, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Sounkoura espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider son époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Soukoura Traore is a single woman who is 44 years of age. She doesn't have children and she lives in a nuclear family in the village of Sanankoroba. It is located in the Kati prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro. 

IN order to integrate him into the economy, Soukoura, who is a teacher by trade, took on a several business activities but finally decided to learn from her aunt the business of selling merchandise, including printed fabrics, wax cloth and the production and sale of incense. She has 5 years' experience in the field and she is highly solicited. 

While in search for additional financial resources, Soukoura decided to join the credit program at the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). 

Soukoura plans on using her loan to purchase a large quantity of materials she needs to make incense. She makes her sales from her house and at the market in Sanankoroba, completing the sales in cash and occasionally on credit. Her clientele is made up of women and men. 

Soukoura expects to earn a monthly income of 75.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan, to help her husband provide for the family's expenses, and to reinvest the remaining portion into the business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make incense.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Ángela Del Carmen tiene 50  años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos y solamente 1 está a su cargo. La señora se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de cosméticos, desde hace 3 años que tiene este negocio este medio de vida surgió con el objetivo de generar ingresos a su hogar, ella tiene que levantarse todos los días temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche para ofrecer los productos, necesarios. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, brillos entre otras cosas. Actualmente posee bastantes pedidos. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Carmen is 50 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is still in her care.  Her business is buying and selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  She started out with the goal of making income for her household.  She has to get up early every morning and works from 7.00am to 10.00pm selling her products.

Ángela is currently requesting a loan from Fundación León 2000 to invest in buying lipsticks, nail polish, lip gloss, etc.  She currently has quite a few orders.  Her dream has always been to own a large store in the new market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a forty-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the bar business for six years. He started with four crates of beer and now has thirteen crates. His problem is bad debtors; his vision is to have a well-established bar accommodating 200 people, and to educate his children. Fredrick needs the loan to renovate his bar.

loans.use: Rennovation of his bar

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es: Juana casada su esposo trabajo como conductor de transporte pesado le ayudan con los gastos económicos de la casa. Sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Anteriormente trabaja en su casa pero ahora tiene su propio negocio de transporte se desempeña como gestora de carga siendo un gran avance para el desarrollo en la sociedad. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: Cemento, bloques, arena, piedrines, estribus, alambre de amarre, kit de servicio, lava manos, puerta, reglones, camisa, ladrillo entre otros materiales de construcción que serán requerido para construir su baño así obtendrá comodidad y salud.
texts.en: Juana is married and her husband is a heavy transport driver and they help him with the household expenses.  Her children are grown and independent. She used to work at home but now she has her own transportation business, working as the load manager. It is a great advancement for the development in their society. With this loan she will purchase construction materials such as: cement, construction blocks, sand, gravel, stirrups, wiring, servicing kit, hand cleaners, a door, screeds, bricks and other construction materials which will be required to build a bathroom for their comfort and health.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El señor Tomas es profesor en el área rural y su esposa de dedica a la venta de golosinas en un colegio; el crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción. Cemento, arena, vigas, etc., para continuar la construcción de su casa. El anterior crédito lo utilizó para construir habitaciones. Vive en casa propia en la zona de Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto, es Casado y tiene tres hijos. Tomás está intentando mejorar las condiciones de vivienda para su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Tomas is a professor in the rural area and his wife sells sweets in a college. The loan will be used to buy construction material. They need cement, sand, lumber, etc. to continue building their home. The previous loan was used to build homes. He lives in his own home in the Bautista Saavedre area in the city of El Alto, is married, and has three children. Tomas is trying to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, lumber, etc. to continue building their home.

loans.name: Mirna Jeannette

texts.es:
Mirna, tiene 20 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y venta de comida, su familia esta conformada por sus padres, y su pequeña hija de 9 meses, vive casa que es propiedad de sus padres, ella es madre soltera.

El negocio esta ubicado en su casa, quedando cerca del hospital nacional de San Miguel, esta ubicación le permite tener más clientela, su madre le ayuda a la atención, por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería necesaria para elaborar comida y compra de bebida, boquitas y plásticos.

Con esta inversión espera mantener los niveles de mercadería para atender la demanda de los clientes, mejorando su condición de comerciante, ayudando a sus padres y a su hija principalmente.
texts.en:
Mirna is 20 years old and she lives in the city of San Miguel. She sells basic needs products and prepared foods. Her parents and her 9-month old daughter is her family. She lives at home with her parents and she is a single mother. 

Her business is installed in her house, located near the national hospital in San Miguel. This location yields more clients. Her mother helps her with the customer service. She requests a loan to purchase the merchandise she needs to prepare foods and to purchase drinks, finger foods, and plastic products. 

With this investment she will maintain the merchandise inventory she needs to meet the demand of her clients, thereby improving her business and helping her parents and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods and to purchase drinks and plastic products.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MAHUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier à Sèdégbé, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marguerite est née en 1958 à Tokpa-Domè au Bénin. Marguerite est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Marguerite s’est installée à Sèdégbé, où elle vit avec ses enfants. Marguerite  assure seule les charges de la famille, grâce aux revenus que lui procure son activité. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Marguerite exerce depuis une vingtaine d’année, comme activité la vente de pain et d’autres produits divers (conserves de sardine et de tomate, sucre, lait, savons, pâtes alimentaires, etc.). Marguerite achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et le pain dans les boulangeries de Cotonou. C’est cependant à son domicile que Marguerite revend ses produits. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Marguerite sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Mahugnon Group is composed of three women who live in the same neighborhood of Sèdégbé in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. This is the third time that they apply for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé in order to boost their activity level.

The group's representative is Marguerite, who is pictured raising her hand. She was born in Tokpa-Domè in Benin in 1958. She is widowed and provides for three children, who all attend school. Some 30 years ago, Marguerite settled in Sèdégbé, where she currently lives with her children. She provides alone for the household, thanks to the income from her business activity. For the past two decades Marguerite has been selling bread and other goods (canned sardines and tomatoes, sugar, milk, soap, pasta, etc.). Marguerite buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and her bread from bakers in Cotonou. It is from her home that she sells her goods. Eager to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her income, Marguerite and her group apply for another loan.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned sardines, milk, pasta and two cans of peanut oil.

loans.name: Calistus

texts.en:
Calistus is a resident and a farmer in the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He is age 37. Calistus is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 11. He has been in mixed farming for over 10 years and has one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize, beans, and poultry.

Calistus has made a loan request amounting to 62,400 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this loan will help him acquire the cow and improve his milk production capacity. He hopes to boost the family's living standard with the income. Calistus hopes to have acquired five dairy cows in five years' time. Calistus says dairy diseases and costly animal feeds are the main challenges in his farming business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Memtee Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Memtee” group. They are small-business women based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown.  This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.
