The leader of this group is Mamusu. Mamusu is 50 years old.  She was born in Waterloo, where she currently resides with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a businessman, and one of her children is attending primary school.  

For 15 years now, Mamusu has been selling gari (a fast food made from cassava roots) and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil in the area).  With this loan, Mamusu will buy gari and palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gari and palm oil to resell

loans.name: Groupe  1

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 1 de l’association JANTOYERELA II sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la commune de KOLOKOBA, préfecture de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée par ce groupe d’homme  est le maïs avec  AROUNA.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AROUNA compte payer les frais de labour, acheter de l’engrais et de l’herbicide. 
Les productions du groupe sont vendues au niveau du marché de Farakala  et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
AROUNA compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180 000 par campagne qui sera utilisé pour  prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group 1 of the association JANTOYERELA II are married men, and they average 40 years of age and five children each living for the most part in polygamous families in NIANTANSO, a village in the Commune of KOLOKOBA, Prefecture of  Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farm work during the off-season. And they are on their second collaborating with the institution. The last loan was properly repaid. 

The crop grown by this group of men is corn, as is the case with AROUNA, who plans to use this loan to cover the cost of plowing and to purchase manure and some pesticides.  

After a harvest, the group’s produce is sold at the Farakala market and also at the Sikasso market to a customer base composed of women and men.

AROUNA plans on making an average profit of 180,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will be used for meeting the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy manure and herbicides

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Analy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesoes to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analy is a new member of HSPFI, a Kiva partner. In the future, Analy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rikaton

texts.en:
Rikaton, 43 years old, is married to Lesoyo and they are blessed with children. Rikaton owns a shop in Enkaroni where she has been selling clothes for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Rikaton was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra profit to open another shop in Namanga. Rikaton hopes to become a big wholesaler. She is very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Joyce has a business selling sugar cane.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. Joyce sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar cane.     

The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land.  Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of sugar cane.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa de 53 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Dora de 50 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda una educación adecuada. Juan, trabaja con mucho esmero sus tierras, cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y achiote, las cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudades de  Quimbiri y San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus frutos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en tiempos de lluvia por que impiden el avance con su faena programada, por ello con el dinero del crédito solicitado comprará ponchos y botas térmicas para que así pueda protegerse de la humedad y seguir trabajando. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea refaccionar su vivienda. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar su propósito y por ello se compromete ser puntual con sus aportes de pago. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ponchos y botas para todo el miembro de su familia e así trabajar con tranquilidad las épocas de lluvia.
texts.en: Juan, is 53 and lives in Santa Rosa.  He is a hard worker and maintains a house with his wife, Dora, 50 and their four children, who are studying. Juan tends crops such as cacao, coffee and vegetables, which he sells in markets such as Quimbiri and San Francisco, where he has many trusting buyers. He has been farming for 25 years, though seasonal heavy rains are a major obstacle.  For this reason, he seeks this credit to buy rain gear and boots, to allow his family to continue working in the fields despite extreme humidity and heavy rains. He hopes to be able to improve his housing conditions in the future. This is his first credit with MFP, sabe and he is committed to prompt repayment. .

loans.use: to buy rain ponchos and boots to work in the fields

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Maria Soledad, D. 44 años es una mujer casada que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades D. 12 a 17 años en el barrio Altos D. Riomar al norte D. la ciudad. Allí tiene un  taller D. artesanías, donD. elabora con sus propias manos, bolsos , correas, zapatos, collares, pulseras, y también decora blusas y ropas en general. En su profesión D. administradora,  D. empresas, trabajó durante 12 años en el sistema financiero, y posteriormente cuando dejó D. hacerlo se dedicó a lo que mas le gusta y con ello ha perfeccionado su arte y aplicado su potencial financiero a su propio negocio. Con sus manualidades ha participado en ferias nacionales e internacionales y en la actualidad exporta a los Estados Unidos y a Puerto Rico. Su sueño es ampliar las exportaciones y continuar fortaleciendo su marca “Marisol Fashion” para lograr el posicionamiento en estos mercados. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para fabricar sus artesanías como palma D. iraca, telas, cuero, pedrería y demás accesorios, para ampliarse en su mercado local potencial e iniciar la fabricación D. sus productos D. mayor rotación solicitado por sus clientes. Mientras María Soledad cumple su sueño D. lograr al lado D. su esposo, generar ingresos suficientes, para que sus 3 hijos se fundamenten a nivel educativo con un potencial D. éxito, continua esmerándose en su negocio por sostener un margen D. utilidad no menor del 45 % y una rotación e inventarios D. 45 días.
texts.en: Maria Soledad is 44 years old and she is a married woman. She lives with her husband and their 3 children, aged between 12 and 17 years old. They live in the district of Altos D. Riomar, in the city's north end. She has a craft shop there where she makes hand-maD. purses, bands, shoes, necklaces, bracelets, and she also decorates blouses and clothing in general. She was employed for 12 years as a professional business administrator, specializing in the financial sector. When she left her employment she decided to do what she loves most and since then she has perfected her art form and she has applied her financial knowledge to her own business. She has participated in national and international fairs with her crafts and today she exports to the United States and to Puerto Rico. Her dream is to expand her export business and to continue strengthening her brand name "Marisol Fashion" to secure a niche in these markets. Her Kiva loan is the first loan that she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase products she requires to make her crafts such as straw, fabrics, leather, stone beads, and other craft accessories. Her goal is to expand to reach the local market potential and to start producing those crafts which sell the best to her clients. Maria Soledad wants to accomplish her dream of attaining success comparable to her husband's and to earn sufficient income so that her children can attain their level of schooling successfully. She continues to work on her business to maintain a profit margin of 45% and an inventory rotation of 45 days.

loans.use: to purchase products she requires for her crafts, such as straw, fabrics, leather, stone beads, and other crafting accessories.

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es radiotécnico.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y a la cual le ha gustado ganar algo por sus propios medios para lo cual hace 11 años puso en su casa un pequeño bazar en el cual vende todo tipo de productos como: ropa, zapatos, peluches, perfumes, bisutería y cosas para regalos. Cuando necesita mercadería se desplaza hasta Guayaquil para comprar más mercadería ya que allá les sale más barato. Con este negocio ella pudo ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos ya que esto representaba una carga muy difícil, pero pudieron salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, peluches, perfumes, bisutería entre otras cosas. Lleva 13 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Fe y Progreso" meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi.  This place has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, because of the large quantity of that fruit that was found in the city in those days.

In this place we meet Blanca, 59, who is married and has 3 children who are adults and are independent.  Her husband is a radio technician.

Blanca is a very tenacious woman who enjoys earning something on her own.  To do this she put a small store in her house 11 years ago where she sells all types of products such as: clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, perfumes, costume jewelry and gift items.  When she needs merchandise she goes to Guayaquil to buy, since she finds the goods cheaper there.  With this business Blanca was able to help her husband with the expenses and the education of their children.  This has been a very difficult burden, but they have managed to get ahead.

Blanca will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, perfumes, costume jewelry and other items. She has been with her communal bank for 13 years, and she likes it because of the help that the bank gives her.

Her dream is to continue to make progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, perfumes, costume jewelry and other items

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es:
La Sra. Alma Iris es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación  primaria en un colegio de dicho municipio con muchos años de experiencia.
Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir una refrigeradora ya que es de necesidad en su hogar para refrigerar su comida e insumos, es por esta razón que solicitó dicho crédito para llevar a cabo su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alma Iris is from the town of El Sauce.  She works as an elementary school teacher in a school in the town and has many years experience.

This is the first loan that Alma Iris has requested from Ceprodel and her aim is to acquire a refrigerator as she needs one in her home to refrigerate her food and supplies.  She has requested this loan so that she can achieve her aim.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is a 32-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has 1 daughter. He earns a living running a general store, which he has done for 2 years. 

Hiep would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings for his daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and shampoos to stock his general store

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Minerva le esta haciendo falta una cuarto. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar el material que es (Block, cemento, varilla y arena) ya que una familiar le va ayudar a realizar la construcción, ya que este cuarto será para sus dos hijos, quienes quieren su propio espacio y privacidad en la casa. 
Doña Minerva planea pagar préstamo con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fábrica en el aria de producción, este es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene la responsabilidad de sus hijos. 
Deas mejorar el patrimonio y la seguridad de sus familia y que sus niños tengan su propio espacio en la casa.
texts.en:
Minerva's house is missing a room. She would like a loan to buy materials such as cement blocks, cement, welding rods and sand so that a relative can help her to build this room. The room will be for her two children who want their own space and privacy in the house. Minerva plans to pay off the loan with a part of the salary that she receives from her work at a factory. This is her family's source of income since she is a single mother and is responsible for her children.

Minerva would like to improve her family's assets and financial security and wants her children to have their own space in the house.

loans.use: to add a room to the back of her house.

loans.name: Dyanne

texts.en:
Dyanne started her housekeeping business two years ago. After working for cleaning businesses and making very little money, she decided to open her own business cleaning houses. Dyanne works for herself, which means fewer hours and much more money. Her biggest challenge was to start the business with no income in the first few weeks and having a small clientele base.

Dyanne will use this loan from Accion USA to purchase cleaning supplies and some informal contracts. She hopes this will help her to continue expanding the business and make it formal in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning supplies and informal contracts.

loans.name: Rosener

texts.en:
Rosener is 43 years old and is married and with three children. To earn a living, she sells mobile phone accessories and offers mobile phone money transfer services. She also owns rental houses which earn her more income.  She was previously employed before she went into business.
Rosener hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy more mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lorna has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock for her store.
Lorna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past two years Benon has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks like beer. 

To help expand his business, Benon has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beers and soda for resale, and will help Benon to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Benon hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Benon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beers and soda for resale,

loans.name: Gracieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, separada e mãe de 2  filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 8ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e as vezes tem ajudado a mãe enviando dinheiro para dispesas alimentares. 

É negociante dedica-se a venda de roupa usada ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 20.000.00mt, para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende melhorar as condições da sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gracieta was born in the Boane district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is separated and has 2 children who are in school.  She attended school through the 8th grade but did not continue due to her parents’ financial situation.  She lives in her own home with her family and sometimes helps out her mother by sending her money for food expenses.  

Gracieta is a merchant and has sold used clothes for the past 2 years with a monthly income of around 8.500.000mt, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).  She has never had a loan in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase bundles of clothing to increase her inventory.  The first loan was for 20.000.00mt, for her business.  

She promises to make her payments on schedule.  In the future she plans to improve the condition of her home and she will request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has grown her business after servicing a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings.  She used the loan to buy body lotion, nail polish, and oils.  With the additional stock, she made good sales.  

Hellen has used the additional profit from her business to start a business of selling mobile phone credit cards.

She has requested another loan of 45,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair oil and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy hair oil and hair treatments.

loans.name: Fouimalo

texts.en:
Fouimalo is 36 years old and is married with 3 children.
Fouimalo owns and operates a transportation business venture (taxi service).  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Fouimalo needs a loan of WST $1000 to maintain her vehicle.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Fouimalo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fouimalo's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to repaint her vehicle

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru: Файзигул более 15 лет занимается скотоводством. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Fayzigul has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  She is 57 years old, married and has four children.  She has a secondary education.  Fayzigul is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is a 46-year-old widow who has ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Honorata runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.
Honorata has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amunoni

texts.en: Amunoni is 50 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is married and responsible for looking after seven children.  For 12 years, he has been operating a retail shop that he started after reaping tangible benefits.  Inadequate capital to purchase stock hinders his business while he dreams to move his business into town and send his children to university.  Amunoni is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: Doña Santos de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, anteriormente solicito un credito para la construccion de un cuarto, nuevamente solicita otrso credito para contruir otro cuarto ya que desea ampliar mas su vivienda por esa razon solicta dicho credito y asi poder comprar mas materiales de construccion y pago de mano de obra.

loans.use: para comprar mas materiales de construccion y pago de mano de obra.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is not married and has two children.She lives in Buza area in Dar es Salaam.Amina owns a small canteen near the Dar es Salaam Harbour. She sells cold drinks,breakfast and lunch to mostly harbour workers.Amina has received entrepreneurship and business training from Hans Said Foundation and Equal Oportunities Trust Fund (EOTF) in Dar es Salaam.
 On usual working hours her business is normally flocked with customers in need of services.She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables,food saving dishes and stock of cold drinks. To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD 750 as a working capital. Amina’s dream is to have one day a professional catering business.

loans.use: EXPANDING THE BUSINESS

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif  is an IDP from Fizuli district of Azerbaijan since 1993. In 2001 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2003-2006 he borrowed four loans with a total amount $2900 from Normicro, Baku branch and increased his variety of goods. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.use: to increase variety of goods

loans.name: Lemafoe

texts.en: In the tiny villages along the Samoan coastline, there remains a market for home-grown Samoan tobacco.  Lemafoe knows that she can make a decent income from raising and selling this native plant in the local markets.  With hard work, she can bring in revenues of up to ST 60 – 70 per day (approximately USD 25).  With this income, it remains a struggle to support her six children and keep them in school, but Lemafoe is confident that with hard work and access to micro-loan facilities, she can continue to grow her family’s income and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: Buy farming equipment: spades, gloves, hoes

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Corina and I am a saleswoman and I have a business in which I sell new clothing. I have several years experience in this activity and thanks to this business, I am able to cover household expenses and other obligations I have with my suppliers. Considering I am already reaching old age, and all of my children are married and live in their own homes, I am happy that I am still able to work and to do so for my own self-improvement.Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre  Corina soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores,  considerando que soy   de la tercera edad y mis hijos todos se casaron y  tiene su propio hogar y eso  me sastisface saber que todabia puedo trabajar y salir adelante por mi misma.

loans.use: To purchase long and short lycra skirts, underwear,  men's shirts,children's pants and other assortments of shirts.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia G. is 49 years old, and has been married for 18 years to Sergio Oporto. They have two children, 14 and 17 years old, who live with them and study at school. Lidia has worked as a seamstress for more than 31 years, and has had a small business selling merchandise from her home for two years. She is a hardworker and has sacrificed a lot since the work left her little time and she had to stop her studies.

Today, thanks to the support she has received from her husband, she has been able to progress forward and give her children the opportunity she never had, to study and one day get a university degree. Lidia is part of a group of 20 hardworking women, who work together to pay back the loans received through this committee. She needs $200 to buy fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc. which she will use in her home business.

Lidia Giménez tiene 49 años de edad, está casada con Sergio Oporto hace 18 años , con quien tiene 2 hijos adolescentes de 17 y 14 años respectivamente, ambos viven con ellos y están estudiando en la secundaria. Lidia se dedica a la costura hace más de 31 años y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de mercería que funciona hace 2 años en su domicilio. Es una mujer sumamente sacrificada ya que desde los 13 años empezó a trabajar. Debido a que el trabajo le dejaba poco tiempo tuvo que dejar los estudios. Hoy día gracias al apoyo que recibe de su esposo puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y los mismos tienen la oportunidad que ella no tuvo que es la de estudiar y lograr algún día un título universitario. Lidia forma parte de un grupo conformado en su totalidad por mujeres que se denomina Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, que está integrado por 20 personas muy trabajadoras y responden solidariamente por los créditos a los que acceden a través de este comité. Ella necesita U$S 200 para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. que pondrá a la venta en la ya mencionada mercería de su propiedad.

loans.use: Purchase thread, buttons, fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods/inventory.

loans.name: Ubalda De La Cruz

texts.en:
Ubalda is 39 years old and married with six children - four girls and two boys.  All of her children attend school.  Her husband works for a construction company.

Ubalda is an untiring woman.  She runs a small store, which she started five years ago.  She sells women's clothing, silver-plated jewelry, cosmetics and beauty products.  She gets the products in the captial, Santo Domingo, where she goes twice a month.  Currently, her business is very successful and she has a well established clientel.  She mostly sells the goods from her house, but on weekends she goes to sell in the surrounding areas.  Her monthly profit reaches the sum of $500.00. 

Ubalda is requesting a loan to purchase large amounts of products in order to increase her sales volume.  Getting products wholesale will help her saving money since she will considerably reduce the number of trips she makes outside the town to get the goods. 

This will be the second loan the entrepreneur will get from FSMA.  Five months ago, she took a loan from our organization to supply her business.  She used the funds wisely, could reach the goals she established and repaid the loan on time.  Given this second loan, Ubalda will be in a condition to make her business progress and will be on her way to fulfilling her dream, which is to have a big store.

loans.use: That second loan will be used to purchase cosmetics, jewelry and beauty products to supply the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 39 years old. He has 2 children and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Ali is a carpenter. He needs 1000$ to buy material for his business. Ali is providing for his family and is planning to make a new bedroom for his children. The revenue generation of his business will help him undertake this initiative.

loans.use: To buy material for his business

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en: Aynur Q. is a low income, vulnerable woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central, flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Aynur owns a small herd of cattle. On Saturdays she sells animals that she bred and buys calves for breeding purposes. Her mother, who is pictured, helps to breed the calves. The business is going well but needs certain improvements. Aynur plans to increase the number of calves she purchases to generate additional income. Her family's expenditures are increasing as the children grow older. Aynur has applied for a $1,000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will help her and her family.

loans.use: To buy additional calves

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric N. is a tailor. He is married to a fish monger and has no children. Eric is running out of tread and other knitting materials which are needed to meet customer demands.

Eric is asking for $525 to buy more thread and other knitting materials for his business

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more thread and other knitting materials.

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en: Shafiga is a 43-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband's family and her two children. She and her husband breed cattle in their yard. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. They also sell milk and other dairy products. Shafiga wants to increase the number of cows. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $500 USD.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Nyakwengata Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is a middle-aged Kenyan mother married with 3 children. She also lives with 2 orphan children whom she has to feed, clothe, and educate. Beatrice is the breadwinner for her family, as her husband is currently unemployed.

Beatrice’s primary business is selling fruits, which she started 3 years ago. She first started by selling fruits for a friend for a commission. She sold in the municipality market in the town of Kisii. From this she accumulated the savings to start her business. Beatrice mostly sells her fruits on a retail basis to her regular clients. With the help of her loan, she will be able to buy more fruits to increase her sales and eventually expand to wholesale business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand fruit business

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr:
Separated from her husband who has multiple wives, Mrs. Félicia A. lives with her five children in Lomé’s East Tokoin neighborhood. She was born in 1960 and has a small space to serve food and sell sandwiches. She would like a loan to build a kiosk from which to sell the sandwiches. She is energetic and a good manager of her business.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Séparé de son mari qui est polygamme, madame Félicia A. vit avec ses cinq (05) enfants à Lomé au quartier Tokoin Est. Elle est née en 1960 et détient une petite place de restauration et de vente de pain sandwich. Elle aimerait avoir un crédit pour construire un kiosque pour vendre des sandwichs. Elle est dynamique et a une bonne gestion de son activité.

loans.use: build a kiosk to sell sandwiches

loans.name: Nhiv

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhiv Sombou, 44 years old, has four children and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Two of her children are employed by the same organization, and Nhiv has been working as a grocery vendor in front of her house since 2000, selling basic food stuffs to the people in her community. Each day she can make a profit of $5 while her husband, a car mechanic in a small garage, also earns about $5 per day
To meet growing customer demand, Mrs. Nhiv Sombou would like to borrow $500 from KIVA to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: María Fermina

texts.es:
María Fermina is married and 62 years old; she studied until the third grade and has four children who no longer depend on her. She lives in the Victor Larco district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad.

Currently, she raises animales such as cows, pigs, hens, guinea pigs, etc. and later sells the bigger, fatter animals while keeping the smaller ones. She has customers who will buy the animals at her house, but she offers them at nearby markets; she also sells the milk that the cows produce.

María is a member of "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank where she received her first loan, which she used to buy small pigs to fatten and sell. With this loan of $550 that she will repay in six months, she will buy grass to feed her cows so that she can increase their milk production and generate more income to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Fermina está casada, tiene 62 años, estudió solo hasta tercer grado de primaria, tiene 04 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente, se dedica a la crianza de animales, tales como: vacas, cerdos, gallinas, pavos, etc. Para luego vender los que están grandes y gordos y quedarse con los pequeños. Tiene clientes que van a comprar los animales en su casa pero además los ofrece en mercados cercanos; también envía a vender la leche que producen las vacas. La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”, en el recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con los cuales compró cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses; comprará pasto para alimentar bien a sus vacas porque quiere incrementar la producción de leche lo cual le debe generar mayor ingreso con lo que piensa mejorar su casa.

loans.use: To purchase grass to feed her livestock.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: This is the third time Mr. Nhen Sopheap has taken out a loan to improve his living conditions. He and his wife, Mrs. Sam S., are farmers in Dounvong Village in Kandal Province. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is age four. Although the family members have different business activities, they still cannot afford to buy lumber to build a new house. In order to do this, Mrs. Nhen Sopheap decided to ask for a loan to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Ileana Sofia

texts.es: La señora Ilena V. tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad que cursa el tercer grado de primaria, vive en casa propia, su actividad economica es la comercializacion de cosmeticos y ropa como perfumes y blusas para damas, tambien se dedica a dar clases de español a extranjeros en su casa de habitacion, para lo cual con un poco mas de apoyo poder concretizar una escuela o un salon de estudios de español para extranjeros, ya que ella es licencianda en Español, obteniendo otras fuentes de ingresos al ofrecer estas clases. Su mayor sueño es poder obtener el apoyo de una mano amiga que le ayude a desarrollar su proyecto, ya que en leon son muy pocos los centros de aprendizajes para extranjeros, y los pocos que hay tiene altos costos, que al contrario de estos centros  ella ofrece un servicio personalizado y bajos costos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ilena V. is 30 years old. She is a single mom and has a 5-year-old daughter who is in 3rd grade. She owns her home and her business is selling cosmetics and clothes, like perfumes and women's blouses. She also works teaching Spanish to foreigners in her boarding house, which she thinks with a little more support she will be able to realize into a school or classroom for Spanish studies for foreigners, since she has a degree in Spanish. Offering these classes would allow her to obtain more sources of income. Her greatest dream is to get support from a friendly hand that will help her develop her project, given the lack of schools for foreigners, and the high cost of the few that exist. In contrast to the existing learning centers, she offers a personalized service at a low cost.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Rosemary M. from Mwanza, a widow with three children between the ages of 11 to 15. Rosemary has been operating a tailoring business since 2007, but also sells perfumes, soaps, and sandals. Working 12 hours per day, 6 days a week, she currently earns about $120 each month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy cloth and shoes to sell, and in the future she plans to open a cloth business. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Menssan

texts.fr: Agé de 61 ans, Monsieur K. Menssan est marié et père de 4 enfants. Revendeur de produits alimentaires et autres produits de premières nécessités au marché de sa localité. Très battant et dynamique, il arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. N’ayant pas assez de moyens, il sollicite un financement pour acheter plus de marchandises et agrandir son étalage.
texts.en:
Mr. Menssan K. is 61 years old, married, and the father of four. He is a retailer of groceries and other staple goods at his local marketplace. A very driving and energetic man, he manages with difficulty to provide for his family. Lacking sufficient means, he is requesting financing to buy more merchandise and to expand his display of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.en:
M. Otunoy lives in the B. Gafurov region but she works in Khujand. She is a loving mother of 2 pretty children. Mrs. M. Otunoy is engaged in commercial service and trade. She trades in the local bazaar selling children's wear. For example, she sells seasonal wear for teenagers (jackets, sportswear and warm socks).

She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but she recommended herself as a serious and reliable client. Mrs. M. Otunoy applies the KIVA with a request for a business support loan of 1700 STJ for 1 month to import seasonal wear. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Seasonal wear importing

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
I. is married to Che John and they are blessed with five children, two of whom are below 15 years of age. I. lives with her entire family in a house with six sleeping rooms and one sitting room. I. has had to work hard her whole life just to sustain the life of her family. I. has encountered some challenges in life such as the death of her husband and poor health. These challenges made life miserable for I. until she discovered GHAPE in 2007 and became a member.
	
In 2007, I. received her first loan (40,000 FRS) and she repayed it on time. With this loan of 200,000 FRS, she plans to buy palm oil for 100,000 FRS, and firewood for 75,000 FRS. The remaining 25,000 FRS will be used for transportation of the goods she buys. 
	
I. is convinced the business will succeed because of the experience she has had in this area. Furthermore, she is well known in her locality as the main supplier of these goods, and the members of her community trust her. I. plans to use the profit from her loan to pay for her children's school fees, to feed them, and to take of their medical needs. I. prefers to received loans from GHAPE because of the trust she has for GHAPE, and because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy of palm oil and firewood

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence S. is a hard-working man aged 32, married with 2 young children. Lawrence runs a bar in Makindye and also purchases matooke and chilli from the villages and exports them to London. Due to the quality of the products he sells, his business has been in existence since 2005.

He is using the loan proceeds to boost both businesses by purchasing more crates of beer, wines, and spirits and also more matooke (green bananas) and chilli for export. He intends to reinvest the profits back into the business. His desire is to educate his children through university.

loans.use: Purchasing more crates of beer, etc.and more matooke (green bananas) and chilli for export

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador H. of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines is 50 years old and lives with his wife and seven children, three of whom are still studying in secondary school. He is engaged in a retail business (buying and selling bananas) while his wife has a variety store (sari-sari store) in their residence. He goes to the public market in Cagayan de Oro once a week, about 37 kilometers away, to sell the bananas.

Salvador believes that through their business they could send their children to school and be able to earn sufficient income for the family needs. He decided to join HSPFI to get additional capital for the business. He is requesting a loan of Php 11,000.

loans.use: to purchase more  bananas to re-sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is 58 years old. She is married and has six children, four daughters and two sons. Five of the children are out of school and living independently. The last-born is in basic school. She lives with some of the children and her husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Some of the women are into trading activities. Her husband is a cocoa and palm nut farmer. Comfort is a fishmonger. She procures fresh fish and smokes it herself. Sometimes she also buys smoked fish to sell. She sells on a table at the market square and distributes the greater part to retailers and food vendors in and around her community. Comfort procures fresh fish from cold stores in the nearby cities. She has been in business for 30 years and has a lot of experience. She says she wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family and give their children a good education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Lidio Manuel

texts.es: El señor Lidio Solis se dedica arduamente a laborar en su actividad ganadera en el municipio de Nagarote de donde es originario. Es un caballero muy trabajador y con muchos deseos de salir adelante en su negocio. Hoy en día ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica para brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y por eso ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de terneros ya que le urge adquirirlos para así proceder a su crianza y luego sacarles el máximo provecho. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Lidio Solis ardously dedicates his time to raising livestock in the municipality of Nagarote where he resides. He is a very hard working gentleman and has a strong desire to get ahead in his business. He is currently looking for a way to improve his financial situation in order to be able to bring a better standard of living for his family. This is the reason for his turning to Ceprodel to get a loan so that he can purchase more calves. He needs to buy them so that he can proceed to raise them and then get the most profit from them. This loan will benefit both him and his family in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Rossanna

texts.es:
ROSSANNA RODRÍGUEZ BARBARÁN, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Zavala Nº 349, en el distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 38 años de edad. Se dedica a la costura, su esposo es mecánico y tienen 2 menores hijos.

Ella tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar telas y otros materiales de costura, con el fin de mantener su pequeño negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200. Nuevos Soles, invertirá para comprar telas y otros materiales de costura (hilos, cierres), con el propósito de mantener y expandir su pequeño negocio.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya como mujer por medio de los créditos  y las charlas que le brindan las promotoras, permitiéndola solventar gastos en su hogar.
texts.en:
ROSSANNA RODRÍGUEZ BARBARÁN belongs to “Las Margaritas” community bank and lives at no. 349 Zavala Avenue in the district of Calleria in the town of Pucallpa. She is 38 years old. She is a seamstress and her husband is a mechanic and they have two small sons. She has spent four years working with Manuela Ramos and the first loan that she obtained was one of 300 New soles which she used in order to buy fabric and other sewing materials with the aim of maintaining her small business. With this loan of 1200 soles she will invest in buying fabric and other sewing material (thread, buttons) with the aim of maintaining and expanding her small business. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because they have helped her as a woman with the credits and the talks which the promoters offer, allowing her to meet her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin K. O. is 29 years old. He is married with three kids, who are all currently in school. Martin trades in mobile phones, their appliances, and other electronic parts, like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screw drivers, wires, television cords, and antennas. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests a loan to buy increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings in order to expand his shop by including sound systems and televisions. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to a community group called Heavens Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: La señora Reyna Maria O. A., tiene la edad de 41 años. Habita en el barrio San Ignacio en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, su esposo es comerciante, Doña Reyna le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijas a su cargo, actualmente estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida a sus hijas y poder apoyarlas siempre en sus estudios, desde hace veintiún años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son la plagas que afectan los cultivos de pitahayas. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para a aplicar al cultivo y obtener una producción para vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Dá las gracias a Afodenic por los beneficios que obtenido ya que este es su noveno ciclo y a través de los préstamos ha logrado proyectarse en mantener en buenas condiciones su cultivo.
texts.en:
Reyna Maria Osajo A. is 41 years old and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood of Ticuantepe with her husband. He works as a shopkeeper to support the household. They have three daughters who are in school. She plans to improve the living conditions for their daughters and to keep supporting them in their studies. She has worked in farming for 21 years. The biggest difficulty she has are blights that affect the pitahayas, or dragon fruits. With this loan she is going to buy fertilizer and other applications for the crop so that her produce can sell for a better price in the market. She is grateful to Afodenic for the help she has received throughout her nine cycles with them. With these loans, she has been able to able plan and maintain good farming conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and other crop applications

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen M., 29, is married to El Eyseur, who is 33. Since early 2004, she and her husband have had a job as fish sellers. They always wake up quickly every night to buy fish in bulk on credit at the wholesale market and they rush to bring their fishes to sell in the retail market.

This modest couple has been blessed with three children who are teenagers. Presently, the family have hired a store to run their business. Right now, they hope to own a small shop in the market by using a loan from Kiva. This will allow them to cut down this hiring cost. They will use the remainder of the loan to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase a store in the market and for home repair

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena S. T. is 57 years old. She is originally from Maputo, but currently resides in Boane. She is single, has two children (aged 26 and 29) and also supports a nephew that lives with her. 

Filomena has been running her own business for the past 5 years. She primarily sells clothing and shawls. The cost of her products mainly depends on the Rand-Metical exchange rate as she buys most of her materials in South Africa. With this loan she intends on further expanding her business and offering more products to her customers. She dreams of one day being able to finish construction of her family home.

loans.use: To increase retail inventory.

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Ghulam Nabi Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar Parveen and I have been a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. I belong to a very poor and big family. My father was the only breadwinner in my family, so we always compromised on our needs. I married G. N.; he is a driver and drives a local 32-seat bus and takes fares from the passengers according to their destinations. He has been driving this vehicle for over 8 years. I am applying for a loan to use to repair my husband’s bus because its engine is creating a problem.

This loan group consists of three additional people:

Sheema baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

Hajra baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

Sobia Iram baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Kosar baji is seated first on the right side of this photo.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle (32-seat bus)

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok P., age 33, is married and has a school-aged child. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business as a grocery seller, typically earning US$ 5 per day which is the primary source of income for her family. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, typically earning US$ 4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more various kinds of groceries, a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing various grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Ulices

texts.en:
Ulices is a member of the Force and Power village bank. He is 42 years-old and has three children who are 22, 15, and 9 years-old. All three of his children go to the local public school. 
Ulices is from Huancayo where he went to school until he dropped out because he had to work more hours in order to support his family. He works as a driver  in his van and also owns a space in the market that he rents out. 

Ulices needs a loan of 1,000 soles to replace some parts in his van. His dream is to keep working to give the best to his children and maybe buy another van

loans.use: To replace some parts for her van

loans.name: Leat

texts.en:
Mrs. Leat M. lives in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. She is a sugar-juice seller.

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. Leat M. wants to expand it by purchasing a sugarcane juice box and to buy various drinks to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Leat M. is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom helps her mother with her business, while the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Leat M.’s husband, Mr. Srey Sareth, is employed by a company.

loans.use: To buy a sugarcane juice box and various drinks for her business

loans.name: Esperanza Y Esfuerzo 3 Group

texts.en:
Estela is a borrower from Consuelo, a small town on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Estela is the coordinator for her group, Esperanza y Esfuerzo 3 (Hope and Strength), and her story is representative of those in her group.

Estela is 64 years old, and lives with her husband and her granddaughter. Estela owns a small colmado, what the locals call a small general store. Colmados can sell anything from laundry detergent to soft drinks, and typically there is one on each street in a neighborhood. Estela sells several things in her colmado, including medications, clothing, and foods typical of the Dominican cuisine such as rice, beans, bread, and oil for cooking.

Estela is very thankful for this loan, her fifth with Esperanza. She has a perfect track record so far, and the experience with her loans is helping her to expand her business. With this loan, Estela is going to purchase prepaid cell-phone cards to sell to people in her neighborhood. Rather than having cell-phone “plans”, most Dominicans use prepaid cards, so her products will be in high demand.

Estela has already helped her daughter attend university, and she hopes that this loan will help her granddaughter have the same future. Thank you for lending to Estela and the Esperanza y Esfuerzo group!

loans.use: To buy prepaid cell-phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Small fish

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy S. is from the village of Cabacungan, Claveria Misamis Oriental. He is 40 years old, married, and has four infant children. 

To make a living, Rudy owns and operates a specialized retail business selling green bananas to the local market. Rudy has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rudy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Ang T., 42 years old, is a motorcycle taxi driver from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He runs his business along the streets in and around the city and he typically earns an average of $5 a day to help cover his family’s expenses. Another source of family income is from his wife’s business. She is in the picture. She rents a medium size flat where there is an attractive place where she sells coffee and other soft drinks, earning $10 per day. She has just started her business and she needs more capital to improve the business. Ang T. requested a loan for his wife to use to sustain the growth of her business. This couple has a school-aged kid who lives with them at home.

loans.use: Capital to improve the business

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie B. is 47 years old and lives in the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is married to Vicente B. who is a local tricycle driver in their village. They are blessed with three children who are all college graduates, married, and working professionals. Kristofferson, age 30, is an engineer in real estate, Kent Gilbert, age 29, works at a private company, and Karyll Joy, age 23, works in the Veterans Hospital. Despite the economic crisis, Genie and her husband work hard to improve their living conditions and save for their future because they are not getting any younger. Their main source of income is from farming rice and corn. Also, Genie does direct selling of books for children. She goes to different schools to sell the books which she usually purchases in Manila. As a fruit of her patience and sacrifice, she earns a net income of PHP 5,500  which she uses to meet her family needs. She is now requesting a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 15,000 which she will use to buy more books to sell.

loans.use: To buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Maisam

texts.en:
Maisam is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bekaa. Maisam has been working as a car repairman since 2004. Maisam is special in his business because of his clean and clear work. He decided to do this business because he wanted to have independent work. However, when he first started his business he had to face competition, especially since he wasn’t very known in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

Maisam has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car oil for his work. This is the first time that Maisam has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase car oil

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco A. tiene 57 años, es soltero y tiene 3 hijos, dos mujeres de 30 y 23 años que viven con la madre en Japón y un varón de 26 años que vive  y trabaja con él.
El mismo se dedica a la compra de carbón vegetal en forma mayorista, al fraccionamiento, venta y  reparto  del mismo en los negocios de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. 
Para el reparto utiliza  un camión Mercedes Benz 608 año 1974 de su propiedad.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de carbón por toneladas para abaratar de esa manera el costo de su mercadería y obtener mayor margen de ganancias sobres sus ventas.
texts.en:
Francisco A. is 57 years old, single, and has three children: two daughters, 23 and 30, who live with their mother in Japan and a son, 26 years old, who lives with Francisco. Francisco works buying charcoal at wholesale and breaking it into smaller pieces for sale and distribution to the businesses of Villa Elisa city. For distribution he uses his own 1974 Mercedes Benz model 608 truck. He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of charcoal by the ton in order to buy at a lower price and earn a better income on his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal at wholesale to break up and resell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel, in Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Zenaida is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a retail store. She sells products for daily use, such as shampoo, toothpaste, bath soap, laundry soap, candy, some snack foods, sugar (white and brown), and salt in the local community. Zenaida has had this business for over 3 years, and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month this way.

In 2009, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used as working capital, and to purchase additional inventory. This will be the third loan Zenaida has taken out through GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva, and then edited manually.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Zahira

texts.en: Zahira is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Zahira has been working in agriculture since 1995. She owns livestock, which allows her to produce dairy products. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a cow to increase her livestock. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time. Zahira is special in her work because she does her best to produce the best quality. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t produce as much as she does today. Zahira decided on doing her business because she took after her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on expanding her work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 36-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Jihad has been working as a blacksmith for more than ten years. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as the fact that he likes his work. When he first started his work, he had some difficulties purchasing all the required tools because he had a small budget, but he did his best to improve his working conditions and made the necessary money  to purchase his machines.

Jihad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan allowed him to improve his work, as well as his financiA. situation.

For the future, Jihad hopes that he will keep on improving his work, as well as his financiA. situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his work

loans.name: Primavera Cruz Papal Group

texts.es: El grupo “Primavera Cruz Papa” esta representado por la señora Cristina y conformado por 12 socios D. los cuales 11 son mujeres y el resto son varones, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Cristina es casada y tiene dos hijos uno que van al colegio y la otra hija que ya vive D.  forma independiente, la señora Cristina cuenta con un negocio pequeño D. venta abarrotes y artículos D. primera necesidad, ubicado en su domicilio D. la cuidad D.  El Alto donD. trabajan todos los días D. la semana para poder mantener a su hijo, viven en una pequeña casa la cual les pertenece a los dos, las expectativas D. Cristina es poder crecer poco a poco y poder establecerse en un local mas amplio y mejorado para poder sacar adelante a su familia. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, como la venta D. comida ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, una D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. víveres a crédito y otras se dedican a la venta D. ropa a crédito. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en sus puestos D. venta.  Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo con el que trabajan ya que por ningún motivo dejan D. generar ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mejores ingresos para poder tener una casa propia, ingresos más seguros y mejor calidad D. vida. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya van cursando juntos un quinto ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina represents the “Primavera Cruz Papa” group which has twelve members, eleven women and one man. This community bank is known for being very united and lively. Señora Cristina is married and has two children; her son attends high school and her daughter has already left home. Cristina runs a small business selling groceries and basic necessities. It is located in her home in the town of El Alto. She works there every day in order to earn money to support her son. They live in a small house which they own. Cristina hopes to expand the business gradually and to relocate to bigger premises so that she can continue helping her family to get ahead. The rest of the group works at a variety of jobs such as selling food in the streets or from a stall; one woman sells supplies on credit, and another sells clothing also on credit. The group has a lot of business experience and is well-known for being knowledgeable. Although competition is very stiff, the group has both experience and regular customers who know their work and request their services. They are also enthusiastic about what they do since their income is vital for their families. This loan will be used for working capital, to buy merchandise, supplies, and tools. The group hopes to expand their businesses and generate more income to buy their own homes, have more financial stability, and a better quality of life. The community bank already has a lot of experience with loans as this is their fifth loan. They have always been punctual with their repayments and shown themselves keen to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha C. C. tiene 61 años, es casada y vive en el barrio Villa Las Moras del municipio de Soledad. Se dedica a la venta de mercancías como prendas, cosmético y comercializa en mayor cantidad productos como aceite, arroz, jabón y cremas para la piel. Tiene más de 7 años de estar con la Fundación e inició en el programa de grupos solidarios, pero en la medida que su negocio fue creciendo, se independizó y adquirió un crédito individual. Ahora solicita un monto de $2.000.000, con el que quiere comprar en mayor volumen  productos como aceite, arroz, jabón y víveres  para surtir tiendas y algunas amas de casa.
Su familia fue ganadera en el departamento de Magdalena pero por cuestiones de seguridad, vendió la casa en su pueblo y cuando llegó compró otra en al barrio Siete de Abril de Barranquilla; desde ahí empezó a vender prendas de oro y plata, pero su primer negocio en firme  fue una tienda, que cerró porque entonces no conocía como funcionaba este mercado en Barranquilla y posteriormente  empezó a vender mercancía en Pelayo del departamento de Cesar con una amiga, con quien compartía las utilidades cuando viajaban a Maicao, (municipio de Colombia ubicado en la frontera venezolana)  para comprar electrodomésticos como licuadoras, ventiladores, planchas, etc. En su negocio actual tiene dos mercados: el principal son las tiendas donde vende  víveres y el segundo las amas de casa,  este último mercado, aunque le produce más ingresos, lo tiene en menos proporción y viven en otras comunidades,  esto lo hace para no competir con las tiendas a quien ella le vende, porque ella no quiere perder a los tenderos como clientes, que le generan un efectivo muy recuperable, de esta manera cuida su mercado. Más adelante, su meta es adecuar su casa y su máximo desafío es  construirle  un segundo piso.
texts.en:
Bertha C. C. is 61 years old, married, and lives in the Villa Las Moras neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad. She sells general merchandise such as clothing and cosmetics, and she also markets products in large quantities such as cooking oil, rice, soap and skin creams. She has worked with the Fundación for more than 7 years. She started out working in a solidarity group, but as her business was growing she became independent and acquired her own credit account. She now requests a loan in the amount of $2,000.00 which she will use to buy products in large volume, such as cooking oil, rice, soap and foodstuffs to supply to stores and to meet the demands of some housewives. Her family raised livestock in the Magdalena department (region), but for questions of security they sold the house in that town and when they arrived they bought another in the Siete de Abril neighborhood of Barranquilla. From there they began to sell gold and silver jewelry, but their first business was a store, which they closed because they were not familiar with the way that the market works in Barranquilla; later they started to sell merchandise in Pelayo in the Cesar department with a friend, with whom they shared the profits. They traveled to Maicao (a municipality of Colombia located on the Venezuelan border) in order to buy electric appliances such as blenders, fans, irons, etc. In her business they have two markets: the main one is selling to stores that sell food products, and the second is selling directly to housewives. This second market, although it generates a higher return, is conducted on a smaller scale. These housewives live in other communities because she does not want to compete with the stores where she sells her products; she does not want to lose them as customers since they generate a good cash flow, so in this way she cares for her market. In the future, her goal is to improve her home and her main challenge is to build a second floor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products in large volume such as cooking oil, rice, soap and other groceries to supply to stores

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es:
Mayra S. es socia del Banco Comunal  San Pablo ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca en la  comunidad de Rumiloma a unos 10 minutos a  las afueras de la urbe,  esta localidad  se caracteriza porque su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los  jóvenes prefieren migrar a ciudades más grandes dentro del país o fuera de él en  busca de mejores oportunidades para salir adelante junto a sus familias.

Mayra tiene 27 años de edad, se encuentra casada y como fruto de su unión concibió dos  hijos quienes se encuentran de 8 y 4 años, el mayor  estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como albañil,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su hermano.

Este es  su cuarto ciclo trabajando con  préstamos de su banco comunal  incentivada por su mamá,  ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes, también a la agricultura siembra verduras y le queda tiempo para atender  su tienda de víveres  que tiene hace dos años y su horario de atención es de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. de domingo a domingo. Con el nuevo crédito que realiza va a  comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal,  jabón, y otros víveres para surtir más su tienda.

Tiene como  sueño  llegar a  tener  su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra Mercedes is a partner of the San Pablo Community Bank located in the city of Cuenca, in the Rumilona community, which is located 10 minutes from the city center. This locality characterizes itself for the fact that its population is dedicated to agriculture and cattle ranching. The young population prefers to migrate to bigger cities in the country and abroad in search for better opportunities for them and their families. Mayra is 27 years old and is married. During this marriage she conceived two children who are now 8 and 4 years old. The oldest goes to a school in the city. Her husband is a bricklayer. They do not own a house and live with her brother. This is her fourth cycle working with loans from the community bank, due to her mother's incentive. She raises chickens, guinea pigs and also dedicates herself to agriculture by sowing vegetables. She also has time to attend to the general store she has had for two years. Her working hours are from 6am to 10pm Sunday to Sunday. With the new loan she plans to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap and other provisions to diversify her inventory. Her dream is to one day own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap and others

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke S., 52, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian temples. Her husband is shown in the photo.

S. is a farmer who sells her produce for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer too, also earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her three children who are currently employed at a local garment factory.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a machine to expand her child’s blacksmith business. S.'s husband is pictured while he is helping his child’s business.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her child's blacksmith business

loans.name: Sharavdulam

texts.en:
Sharavdulam is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her daughters attend a kindergarten.

Sharavdulam operates a business selling second-hand products such as shoes at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. Sharavdulam started her business in 1998 and has had steady growth over the years, gaining great business experience. She has used her earnings to support her family and expand her business. Sharavdulam is very hardworking and hopes to continue her success in the future. In 2009, Sharavdulam and her husband purchased their own house, grocery store and car. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
LAS MARGARITAS
El Grupo solidario Las Margaritas integradas por tres socias,  Francisca M.  A.,  Maria Florinda I. J.. Bilma Yesenia M. A.. Se dedican a distintas actividades venta de ropa típica, como güipiles típicos, fajas delantales típicos y venta de amueblados.
