Francisca es soltera tiene 42 años de edad, Maria tiene 34 años,  y Bilma de 33 años de edad.  Tienen diferentes actividades pero el mismo proposito y un  mismo sueño. Bilma Yesnia tiene una venta de amueblados de sala, y comedor,   ella es una mujer emprendedoras reúne a dos compañeras para formar este pequeño grupo con el fin de aumentar su negocio y el sueño es que tengan màs capital  y mercadería para la venta para llevar a cabo sus sueños de cada uno, pero la que mas resalta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos, y la  alimentación y tener vestuario.   El negocio vienen trabajando por cuatro y ocho años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, "Las Margaritas" is made up of three members: Francisca M. A., Maria Florinda I. J., and Bilma Yesenia M. A.. They make a living from various activities, including selling traditional clothing, aprons, and furniture. Francisca is 42 years old; Maria is 34; and Bilma is 33. Although they perform different activities, they have the same purpose and dreams. Bilma Yesnia has a store where she sells living room and dining room furniture. She is an enterprising woman who gathered two other partners together to form this small group with the purpose of expanding her business. Her dream is to have more working capital and more merchandise for sale, so that they can all achieve their dreams. However, the thing that stands out the most is to continue supporting their children, and to keep them well-fed and clothed. They have been running this business for 8 years now.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase traditional dresses and aprons

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Mrs. S., born in 1975 and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, currently works as a seamstress in a garment factory. She has a life partner in her husband (shown in the photo above), a requirement laborer hired by people to do a variety of jobs. The couple now lives with their young child who is enrolled in the public primary school. Because their current income is not adequate to serve them, Mrs. S. has requested a loan to be used as capital to provide a small loan with a specific schedule repayment to a garment worker, thereby providing her with extra income.

loans.use: To provide a small loan with a specific schedule repayment.

loans.name: Scholastica Atieno

texts.en:
Scholastica Atieno O. is 32 years old and is married to Jashon Check. They have four children (Michael, 14; Vinn, 11;  Edna, 7; and Clear Atieno, 2). They live in the Skyway area of Kisumu city. Her husband Jashon is an electrician and does his work within town and contributes to the wellbeing of his family.

Scholastica is a tailor and has been in this business for the past 12 years, thanks to her mother who taught her the skills when she was a young girl. Scholastica has been a client of KADET Ltd for sometime now. She is applying for her sixth loan, after successfully repaying the previous ones. She intends to use the money to buy materials to add to her stock which will enable her meet the demands of her clients by being able to design for them nice outfits.

Her dreams are to become the leading tailor in her neighborhood and to educate all her children to the university level.

loans.use: Buy materials for her business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena M. O. tiene 39 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 5 hijos, Guillermo (23), Kerly (20), Liseth (17), Raul (16) y Josué (14). 

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Maria se dedica al cultivo de banano y tomate trabaja 10 años  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en Babahoyo en Comercial Chávez.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra semillas de banano y tomate. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener una micro empresa. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Elena M. O. is 39 years old, single, and lives in Recinto Delicia in the canton of Chillanes, Bolivar Province. She has five children: Guillermo (age 23), Kerly (age 20), Liseth (age 17), Raul (age 16) and Josué (age 14). Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “El Progreso La Delicia Recinto”, which is in San José del Tambo Parish. The group has 19 members and their community engages in growing cacao and corn. María has been growing bananas for ten years. Every month she purchases products and farming supplies from the agricultural services division of AGRIPAD. She sells her goods in Babahoyo at Comercial Chávez. She is requesting a loan to buy banana and tomato seedlings and views it as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own micro-enterprise. The greatest challenge that she faces is the lack of financial resources and time. María enjoys working in order to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana & tomato seedlings

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 31 years old and married with four children between 4 and 12 years of age. Angelique owns a small business selling shoes in the Kigali city where it is profitable because most of the people wear shoes. Angelique has 2 years of experience in her business. Angelique employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.

Angelique is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more shoes for sale. With this expansion, Angelique will be able to attract more customers, which will allow her to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Hualtaco del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Al igual que la mayoria de  hombre de la zona se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde ha sembrado mango y limón, las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las fábricas procesadoras de la zona, el depende de estas actividades para sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para poder mantenerse en el negocio.

Wilfredo desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales pueda brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

El es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y entregado a los suyos, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Hualtaco neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande; an agricultural district characterized for primarly producing fruit for export. Tambogrande belongs to the Piura province and is located within the region of the same name which is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Just like the majority of men in the area, he works as a farmhand. He counts on a piece of farmland where he has planted mangos and lemons and the fruit he harvests, he sells to processing plants in the area. He depends on these business activities to maintain his household. He always gives his best in order to stay in the business. Wilfredo would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides with which he can upkeep his crops and ensure himself a good harvest. In order to achieve his objective he has requested his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN ($200USD). He is the head of household, hard working, and dedicated to care for his own. He longs to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. Those who know him in his neighborhood trust him and hold him in high regards.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and pesticide for upkeep of his mango and lemon crops

loans.name: Yader Alberto

texts.es: El señor Yader Alberto C. C., es un joven de 23 años habitante de las Pilas Orientales un municipio de Managua en una zona rural, el señor se dedica a la agricultura contando con más de 15 años de experiencia, y fue con el apoyo de sus padres que se gana la vida por los trabajos de esta actividad, dentro de sus planes a futuro para su negocio está la diversificación de sus cultivos, pero primero solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y pesticidas, que permitan un mejor mantenimiento para las cosechas, esta inversión le permitirá un aumento en las ganancias y a futuro la posibilidad de cultivar nuevas cosechas que tengan un buen consumo, y la mejora continua de las condiciones económicas de la familia
texts.en:
Yader Alberto C. Chavarria is 23, and a resident of Pilas Orientales which is a rural part of the municipality of Managua. He has more than 15 years experience working as a farmer. Due to his parents' help he is able to make a living doing this. He plans to diversify his crops in the future and is requesting a loan to buy various items including fertilizers and pesticides which will allow for better crop care. This investment will allow for greater income and the possibility for good crop yields that will sell well and so increasingly improve the family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Care for his crops

loans.name: Carla Elizabeth

texts.es: Carla Elizabeth G. L. de 20 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre y su tía quienes trabajan como comerciantes del sector informal quienes venden sus productos de forma ambulante. Carla posee su propio negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares tales como: baterías, cargadores, carcasas, estuches y otros más, así mismo hace recargas electrónicas y vende tarjetas para recargar saldo. El negocio cuenta con un año de existir pero debido al apogeo de esta tecnología como lo son los celulares y todo lo que tenga que ver con ellos, el negocio es muy estable, lo cual le permite aportar en su hogar y pagar todos sus gastos personales. Carla solicita un préstamo con la intención de invertir en el negocio, comprando más tarjetas de recargas como también invertir en accesorios para celulares de diferentes modelos. Carla es un gran ejemplo de una joven trabajadora y visionaria la cual cuenta con un enorme deseo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carla Elizabeth G. L. is 20 years old and lives in the department of Usulután. She lives with her mother and her aunt who work in the informal sector as traveling sales merchants. Carla owns her own business selling cell phone accessories such as batteries, chargers, covers, cases and more. She also recharges phones with more calling time and sells calling cards. Her business is a year old, but due to the high demand for this technology and all things associated with cell phones her business is very stable. This allows her to contribute to the household and to pay for her personal expenses. Carla is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She will buy more calling cards and cell phone accessories for different models. Carla is a great example of a hard-working and ambitious young woman who has an enormous desire to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more calling cards and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida L. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Leonida is widowed. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of of her raised animals.

In 2007, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Qahir

texts.en:
Qahir A. is 45 years old.  He is married with two children.  He owns a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and detergents. Qahir started this business six years ago with a small inventory of foodstuff.  Over time he has expanded his business and has become very successful. 

Qahir is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress through their studies, for which he is doing his very best.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase stock

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis Ernesto A. M. de 48 años de edad, es una persona muy esforzada quien ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive junto a su esposa y una hija de 18 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Luis posee un molino el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Usulután, en donde las personas llegan a moler: maíz, frijoles, verduras y diferentes tipos de alimentos ya sea para elaborar algún tipo de masa o para hacer salsas. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar un molino más y de esta forma atender a más personas, ya que muchas veces no da abasto con el que ya posee. Él desea mucho mejorar su negocio, debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee para vivir de una forma digna.
texts.en:
Luis Ernesto A. M. is 48 years old. He is a determined individual who works hard so that he can succeed on behalf of his family. Luis lives with his wife and 18 year old daughter who is a student. He operates a grain mill located in his home in the Department of Usulután where his customers bring him different types of food to process such as corn, beans, vegetables, and other items used for making flour or sauces.

Luis is requesting a loan so that that he will have the money needed to purchase another grain mill. This will enable him to serve more customers since there have been several occasions when he could not keep up with the machine he already owns. Luis wants to improve his business since this is the only source of income from which he is able to live a decent life.

loans.use: Purchase another grain mill

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20201030010) is a 27 year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, L. sells electronic products in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be Lien's 5th loan from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20201030010) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm điện tử trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina S. is a widow who lives in Purok 9, Brgy. Tinago, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental, in the Philippines. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling coffee, juice and personal products, and a piggery business. Regina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Regina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 (Philippine pesos) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for the personal product business and buy medicines and vaccines for the pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Regina S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the "NWTF Kiva lending team" on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more personal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jeniffer Joseph

texts.en:
Jeniffer Joseph S. is a woman of 32 years. She is married to Joseph S. and together they have six beautiful children who are aged between 4 months and 11 years. They live in Ortum in West Pokot, where her business is. She has a retail shop where she sells maize and many other basic things like soap, flour, etc. 

Jeniffer gets a monthly income of 15,000 shillings. This will be her second loan with KADET and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more maize for resale. With the income she is going to get, she plans to save and use it later to diversify her business.

In the future, Jeniffer wants to open a wholesale shop, purchase a vehicle for transport and provide for her family basic needs.

loans.use: To add stock in the shop, e.g. buy maize

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi O. is a widow. For the past 15 years, she has prepared doughnuts at Abura. Esi uses her income to provide for her own well-being. She will use her loan to purchase ingredients to prepare doughnuts to better supply her customers. Esi plans to reinvest the profits from her loan into expanding her business.
 
In this picture, Esi is displaying some of the ingredients and cookware she uses to prepare doughnuts.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare doughnuts

loans.name: Angela Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia Alajuela del cantón  Portoviejo  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Alajuela, este sector es conocido por ser una zona donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Angela, tiene 42 años de edad y está separada pero de esa relación tiene cinco  hijos dos mayores de edad y tres  de 17, 15 y 13 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Tiene un puesto de comidas rápidas en donde, vende empanadas, corviches y colas, trabaja todos los días  desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00, además los fines de semana también preparar los deliciosos encebollados y bollos  el cual lo hace en las mañanas desde las 7h00 hasta las 13h00, ella además de vender sus productos en su local también manda a sus hijos a vender por toda la localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar colas, plátano, maní, aceite, pescado y otros ingredientes en la elaboración de sus platos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In Alajuela Parish of the canton of Portoviejo the members of the Alajuela Communal Bank meet every two weeks. This sector is known as an area where most inhabitants are engaged in agriculture.

In this place, we meet Señora Angela, age 42. She is separated but has 5 grown children from her relationship and three, ages 17, 15, and 13, who are high school students. She has been in the communal bank for two years and is very happy since, thanks to her loans, her business has been able to progress.

She has a fast food stall where she sells empanadas, corviches (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili) and soft drinks. She works every day from 3:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. and on weekends. In addition, she also prepares delicious stews and buns which she makes in the mornings from 7:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. She sells her products at her stall and also sends her children to sell them throughout the area.

This loan is to purchase soft drinks, bananas, peanuts, cooking oil, fish, and other ingredients used to make her dishes. Her dream is to have a big shop for selling her products.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, bananas, peanuts, cooking oil, fish and more ingredients

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance N. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, none of whom are currently in school. Constance has a cosmetics shop business, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business running a clothes boutique.
To help expand her business, Constance has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics and clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Constance hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothes for resale

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr:
Madame Charlotte S. est une femme de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi en charge ces trois petits enfants . Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA depuis le 03 mai 1997. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et caprine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis avant son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter une paire de bœufs et des chèvres à emboucher 

Elle participe très souvent aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et paye les fournitures scolaires pour ses petits enfants/
texts.en:
Mrs. Charlotte S. is a 59-year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven. She also has three grandchildren in her care. She has been  a member of the Banc Villageois of Sanghe Douka since May 3, 1997.

She raises cows and goats. She has been  doing this line of work before joining Banc Villageois. Her new loan will allow her to purchase a couple of cows and goats to fatten for resale. She constantly contributes to the family budgets and pays for the school supplies for her grandchildren.

loans.use: Purchasing cows and goats

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1961 à Niamana préfecture de Kolondièba (Région Sikasso),  Madame Safiatou B. est mariée et mère de cinq enfants, résidant  avec ses enfants chez son époux à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou B. après avoir avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initiée  depuis maintenant plus de dix ans à l’achat et à la vente de tubercules (Pomme de terre, patate, igname, etc). Elle vend ses articles à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs mais aussi de transporteurs. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Ainsi elle a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui a été correctement remboursé. Alors dans but de toujours mieux relancer ses activités, elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir acheter, 15 caisses de pomme de terre, 10 sacs de patate et 10 sacs d’igname à Sikasso et environnants
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Niamana, prefecture of Kolondièba (region of Sikasso), Mrs. Safiatou B. is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her children and husband in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou Sikasso (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After trying several businesses unsuccessfully, Madam Safiatou B. started buying and selling tubers (potatoes, sweet potatoes, yam etc.) 10 years ago. She sells her goods at the bus station in Sikasso to a customer-base mainly made up of travelers but also of carriers. She is very much sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

In order to meet the needs of her ever-increasing customer-base, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution approximately two years ago. She benefited from a first loan, which she successfully paid off.

With the goal of boosting her business, she is requesting this second loan that will allow her to increase her working capital and buy 15 cases of potatoes, 10 bags of sweet potatoes and 10 bags of yam in Sikasso and its outskirts.

With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will be mainly used to increase her working capital, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interests of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase tubers

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de 37 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, trabaja todos los días de la semana de 6:00am a 5:00pm,  tiene un año de estar administrando el taller y hasta el momento lo realiza sin tener mayores dificultades.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para adecuar el techo del taller, ya que hasta el momento el taller no cuenta con las instalaciones adecuadas para evitar que en invierno la lluvia le dificulte trabajar.
El objetivo de Juan es que su taller este mejor, que este seguro y cómodo para realizar diariamente sus trabajos y de esta manera sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old and resides in San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 11 and 14. He has a workshop where he makes metal structures. Juan works every day of the week from 6am to 5pm. He has been managing his workshop for a year and has not experienced any major difficulties to this point.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy materials to replace the roof of his workshop because the existing one is not adequate to keep out the winter rains that make it difficult for him to work. His goal is to make his workshop better so that it is safe and comfortable for him to perform his daily work. As a result, he will be able to move his family forward.

loans.use: To purchase materials for replacing the roof of his metal shop.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana P. is divorced with an 8-year-old daughter. She lives in Ivano-Frankivsk.

Tetyana and her mother own a small bakery and eight vending locations where their baked goods are sold. Tetyana’s venture boasts reasonable prices and favorable locations for her kiosks in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Tetyana has been working in this sphere of business for nine years. Currently, she receives 10,000 UAH of income every month. Tetyana and her mother have 15 hired employees.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase flour for the bakery. She is also planning to use a portion of borrowed funds to pay the rent for her vending facilities. Tetyana is hoping to continue developing her business in the future ensuring decent living conditions for her growing daughter.

loans.use: to purchase flour for her bakery

loans.name: Valezka

texts.es:
La señora Valezka Tessalia Gutiérrez Riva de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos desde hace cinco años en el cual invertirá el crédito.
Gutiérrez inicio en Adim con crédito solidario la fue graduada a crédito individual.
texts.en: Valezka is 31 years old and is a hard-working, enterprising woman. She has made a living selling clothes and shoes for the past five years and plans to invest the loan in more merchandise. She started out with a group loan and has moved on to an individual loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en una zona rural de Saltur que se ubica en la localidad de Zaña, un distrito agrícola y ganadero que se encuentra situado en la región Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Walter se dedica hace 10 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales cría en ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Walter desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Walter, age 47, is married and lives with his family in Saltur which is a rural area located in Zaña -- an agricultural district in the Lambayeque region, more than forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For over ten years, Walter has been making a living by raising and commercializing livestock. He raises his animals at home, and when they reach a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public as well as to the merchants who visit the area. With the income from this activity, Walter has been able to provide for his family.

Walter would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed, thereby increasing his sales. For this reason, he has decided to ask  Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
José Roberto, habita  en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos que son lo más importante para él. José se dedica a la venta de ropa tanto para hombre como para mujer. Debido a que no posee un lugar fijo para  realizar la venta lo hace de manera ambulante. Ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo de esta forma y le ha dado buenos resultados. Cada día sale muy temprano de su casa para realizar sus ventas en las diferentes zonas cercanas al lugar en que vive, es muy conocido y muchas personas lo prefieren ya que siempre cuenta con variedad, nuevos y diferentes estilos de prendas de vestir. 

Su sueño es poder seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  con la esperanza que de esta forma logrará cumplir su sueño. Con el crédito pretende comprar variedad de pantalones tanto para hombre como para mujer, blusas, camisetas, faldas, shorts, y nuevos estilos que sean atractivos para los clientes ya que de la demanda de estos depende el éxito del negocio. Con esto espera lograr aumentar sus ventas para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Roberto lives in his own home with his wife and three children who are most important to him.  He sells clothes for men and women.  Since he does not have an established vending location, José sells his products as a traveling merchant.  He has worked in this manner for a long time and has achieved good results.  Each morning he leaves his house very early so that he can sell in different areas of the city where he lives.  José is well-known and many people prefer to buy from him because he always has a variety of clothes in new and different styles.  

His dream is to continue helping his family move forward.  This prompted him to request a loan from Apoyo Integral in hopes to being able to fulfill this dream.  He intends to use the funds to buy a variety of men’s and women’s trousers, blouses, T-shirts, skirts, shorts, and new styles of clothing that are popular with his customers since the demand for these products will determine the success of his business.  José hopes to increase his sales so that he can provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase various articles of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Na We Say Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the "Na We Say" group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 600,000 each. With the help of this loan, each of these women will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Celina, age 31, is the leader of this group. Her husband has his own business and they have two children. Celina has run a retail business for six years now: she sells such beverages as cold water, ginger drinks, and soft drinks. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy such beverages as cold water, ginger drinks, and soft drinks to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Donata

texts.es:
Donata, es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 44 años, es madre soltera con 3 hijos.
Donata es feriante, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
Donata viaja a la ferias de Matará los viernes y Seccelambras los días sábados y compra animales menores y los vende en Ayacucho.
Está en FINCA Perú, hace muchos años y le gusta porque les enseñan a trabajar y se practica los valores. Con sus ahorros pudo comprar artefactos para su domicilio. Su sueño es poder abrir un atienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Donata is a member of the communal bank "Paloma". She is 44 years old and a single mother of 3 children. Donata is a merchant. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of grocery products. Donata travels to the fairs in Matara on Fridays and to Seccelambras on Saturdays to purchase small livestock, which she resells in Ayacucho.

She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for many years and she appreciates it because they give work-related orientation and they practice sound values. With her savings she has managed to purchase appliances for her home. Her dream is to open a wholesale market.

loans.use: to purchase general grocery products.

loans.name: Loribel

texts.en:
Loribel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Loribel has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, noodles, detergents & biscuits. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles & biscuits.

Loribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Loribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles & biscuits.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: From Prey Chor district, Mrs. Tuon is a 48-year-old woman who is good at making Khmer cake and grilled banana at home. Her Khmer cakes are really delicious and she has a lot of valued customers who come to her house to order her cakes and grilled bananas for a ceremony or other party. Mrs. Tuon has more than 10 years of experience in this business and she is able to make an income of about $3 to use for their daily expenses. Some revenues come from her husband’s job as a domestic construction worker in the mobile place. Mrs. Tuon is seeking a loan of $500 to buy more ingredients for making Khmer cakes and to purchase more bananas to grilling and selling. Mrs. Tuon believes she would increase her income by borrowing a Kiva loan. Mrs. Tuon has five children. Two of the children are single and the other three are married.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make Khmer cakes and to buy more bananas to grill and sell

loans.name: Americo

texts.es: El señor Américo trabaja como chofer en una compañía de radio taxis y su esposa es vendedora en una tienda donde vende ropa de bebe. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de llantas para su vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona Pasankeri en  la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Américo works as a driver in a radio taxi company.  His wife works as a sales assistant in a store selling baby clothes.

Américo needs this loan to buy tires for his passenger transport vehicle.  He lives in a rental house in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en: The Putri Mandiri group resides in Banjar Village, Pancardawa Pendem Village, west Bali. Their goal in joining a group is to facilitate obtaining a loan that will be used to raise pigs and to be trained the right way to raise pigs. Each members gets Rp 1,500,000 to buy piglets. Ni Ketut use the loan to buy four piglets. Now the price of piglets is very expensive. The price per piglet is Rp. 450,000 so the cost of Rp 1,800,000 for the rest have been taken from the last profits. Ni Ketut and all the members of Puteri Mandiri hope the loan can help to increase their businesses.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: Santos Florentin

texts.es:
Santos  es un señor de 47 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Esta empresa de las Nubes se fundó en el año 2007 y se constituyo con el fin de obtener fondos patrimoniales y propiedad de los socios y socias. 

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Santos es un micro crédito de ¢400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para comprar una computadora portátil e impresora multifuncional, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible en la empresa.

Don Santos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico; y fomentar el ahorro en los niños. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Santos is a 47-year-old man living with his wife and children in the community of Las Nubes (The Clouds), located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is known for being mountainous and very close to the country's  northern border. The principal local economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture, especially sowing basic grains, sugar cane and oranges.

The Las Nubes enterprise was founded in 2007 for the purpose of obtaining patrimonial funds and property for its members. Santos belongs to this “Empresa de Credito Comunal Las Nubes,” (The Clouds Communal Credit Enterprise), one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. 

At present, Santos is requesting a micro-loan of 400,000 colons to buy a portable computer and multi-functional printer, and to provide the best possible maintenance and assistance to the enterprise.  With this loan, he hopes to grow at a personal and economic level and promote savings among his children. Also, it's clear that thanks to this type of organization and the means of credit it facilitates, he will be able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: buy a laptop computer and versatile printer for his personal advancement.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La SeñoraMaría es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre, al visitar este lugar nos regala la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura de sus padres y laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y artesanías como es la elaboración de sogas.

La Señora. María tiene 50 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos, una hija es casada e independiente, cuatro trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos son  de 16 y 14 años y estudian en el colegio. La casa en la que habita es heredada.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de cuyes y gallinas. También se dedica a la artesanía, ella realiza sogas y esta actividad  aprendió desde muy joven siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra 2 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para crecer en la cría de animales.
 
Su meta es sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Vegaspamba Community Bank. She lives in the community of the same name. Visitors to Vegaspamba will notice its natural beauty, as well as its its charismatic, happy, hard-working residents who do their best to preserve local culture. Many Vegaspamba residents are farmers or craftsmen who produce rope, etc. 

Maria is 50 years old and a single mother of seven. One of her daughters is married and living independently. Four others work and contribute to their mother's household. The two youngest, age 16 and 14, are still in school. This family lives in a house that has been passed down through their family. 

Maria spends a lot of time on housework, but also raises pigs and chickens. She also makes rope, a craft she learned many years ago from her mother. 

She has been a member of her community bank for two years now. With this new loan, she plans to buy a cow to raise, which should help her continue raising her family.

loans.use: buy a cow.

loans.name: Martha Alina

texts.es:
Doña Martha tiene la edad de 42 años, casada, madre de dos hijos, su esposo labora como auditor. Hoy en dia ella labora como analista de credito en una empresa privada.
Tiene su propia casa, que junto a su esposo han construido, para el bien comun de la familia, la cual con ahorros y prestamos en financieras, lo lograron.
Su meta es, poder apoyar  a su mama, ya que esta muy enferma, y la casa la tiene en muy, mal estado, ya que es de madera. El cual podra cambiar techo y levantar paredes de concreto, dando a su mama una mejor vivienda, y mejor higiene. Pues para ella es una inversion ya que es patriminio de la familia.
Para este proyecto no cuenta con todo el capital, y recurre al financiamiento de Afodenic, para hacer la mejora y lograr comenzar la obra de un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as an auditor. She works for a private company as a credit analyst.

She has her own house, which she built alongside her husband to benefit the whole family. They managed thanks to savings and loans acquired through financial services companies. Her goal is to support her mother, who is very ill and lives in a house that's in very poor condition as it's made of wood. With the loan she will be able to replace the roof and build concrete walls, which will give her mother better, more hygienic housing. For Martha this is an investment as it is part of the family's assets. 

She doesn't have all the capital she needs for this project and that's why she's requesting the financial support of Afodenic in order to make the improvements and begin the works to improve the roof.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a concrete house, with a better roof and more hygiene.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is a 38-year-old married woman with one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ha earns a living by running a general store, which she has done for seven years. Ha would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bumtsend

texts.en: Bumtsend is 61 years old lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. His two children are high school students. His wife helps him to manage the family business. He started his business three years ago by selling wood and coal at the local market. He buys a truckload of coal at the price of 280,000 MNT. Then he packs the coal into smaller bags, and each bag costs 850 MNT. Aside from the coal, he also sells wood. On average, 5 truckloads of coal are sold each month. During the winter he sells coal and wood, and in summer he makes bricks. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to expand my business and I have a plan to buy a truck for my business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy coal.

loans.use: To buy more coal for resale.

loans.name: Norma Veronica

texts.es: Norma Verónica es una mujer muy responsable, anteriormente vivía con sus padres de los cuales ayudaba en los gastos, pero hace algunos años fallecieron. Por el agradecimiento que le tenían por la ayuda  le heredaron la casa y el terreno donde actualmente vive, pero la casa ya esta un poco deteriorada por lo que quiere comenzar con arreglar el baño que esta en muy malas condiciones. Por tal motivo pide el préstamo para realizarle algunas me0joras como enjarrar, pintar, poner llaves nuevas en el lavabo y en la regadera, para esto necesita comprar material de construcción para que su proyecto quede terminado.
texts.en: Norma Veronica is a very responsible woman who used to live with her parents and she helped them with expenses. But they died some years ago.  In gratitude for her aid, they willed the house and land where she currently lives to her. But now, the house is somewhat deteriorated and for that reason, she wishes to begin reconstruction, starting with the bathroom which is in the worst condition. Consequently Norma is requesting a loan to carry out improvements, including masonry, painting, and installing new plumbing fixtures, including a shower. To do this, she needs to buy the necessary construction materials for her project to be completed.

loans.use: to buy construction material and pay laborers for needed home repairs.

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Bramwel is 30 years old and married to Doris. They have two children. He runs a butcher shop, and he has been in business for nine years. Right now, his monthly income from the business is 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is borrowing a loan of 5,000 KES to buy meat to sell.

He plans to use the profit from the business to open another business to be managed by his wife. This is his first loan. His dream is to continue with his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Baraka A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Baraka A Group in Western Kenya! Wycliffe is the facilitator of the Baraka A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Wycliffe takes care of 12 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Wycliffe had a very good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Wycliffe was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wycliffe and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Wycliffe will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Baraka A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Wycliffe is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 18 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her small shop where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes for resale. Her loan will help Aisha generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Aisha, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mamarasul

texts.ru: Мамарасул трудолюбивый мужчина, отец пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он работает на земле: выращивает картошку, лук, чеснок, пшеницу. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи пшеницы и орехов. Постепенно стал расширят ассортимент товара, купил землю и стал заниматься выращиванием сельхозкультур. Ему в хозяйстве помогают старшие дети. Он хочет получить доход для покупки минеральный удобрений и оплаты работы наемных работников. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Mamarasul is a hardworking man and the father of five children. His wife is a homemaker. He works the earth, growing potatoes, onions, garlic, and wheat. He began his business selling wheat and nuts. He gradually started to expand the variety of his goods, bought land and started to cultivate crops. His older children help him on the farm. He would like to to receive a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and pay salaries for employees. He looks forward to your support and thanks you.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizers and pay the salaries for employees

loans.name: Tushirikiane B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tushirikiane B Group in Western Kenya! Daina is the facilitator of Tushirikiane B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Daina takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Daina had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Daina was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Daina will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Tushirikiane B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes a futuros es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Isabel cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que trabaja en una empresa privada y esto le permite que los gastos de dividan en el hogar , doña Isabel  lleva muchos años laborando como comérciate y a la vez para una empresa privada , ellos dos se esfuerzan mucho para poder construir su vivienda , pero todavía no les ajusta para comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción y asi cumplir sus sueños de tener un techo digno y gozar de privacidad . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de Kiva ya que sin ellos no fuese posible construir sueños y hacerlo realidad .
texts.en:
Señora Isabel lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her family.  Her plans for the future are to be able to improve her living conditions.  

Doña Isabel has the support of her husband, as he works in a private enterprise and this allows them to divide the household expenses between them.  Doña Isabel has spent several years working as a business-woman and sometimes for a private company.  They are both struggling greatly to build their home, but they still have not been able to make a one-time purchase of construction materials and so accomplish their dreams of having a decent roof and a source of privacy.

She is grateful for the support being provided by Afodenic through Kiva, as without this, it would not be possible to build their dreams and make them into reality.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle exerce un commerce de produits de beauté et de produits ménagers.Elle achète ses marchandises dans un pays voisin non loin de sa ville.Elle les vend ensuite à crédit à  ses clients avant de se faire payer au bout de deux mois. Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices consistants de son commerce; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et de soutenir grandement son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f  auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 5 caisses de lait de beauté, 3 cartons de mèches pour tresse et 2 cartons de parfum.Son ambition est de construire une cantine devant son domicile.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman and mother of two children. She sells beauty and household products. She buys her merchandise in a neighboring country not far from her city. She then sells it on credit to her clients before charging them after two months. She manages to get consistent revenues from her business; this allows her to provide for her own needs and to heavily support her husband in the management of the family's household expenses. She is asking for a loan of 200000f from UIMCEC to buy five crates of lotion, three boxes of hair extensions, and two boxes of perfume. Her ambition is to build a canteen in front of her home.

loans.use: to buy five crates of lotion, three boxes of hair extensions, and two boxes of perfume.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn is 57 years old, married, and has four children.  He resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been a village leader for over 20 years. 

Chorn and his wife have been involved in growing rice for over 20 years and are successful in their business. He has begun a new business of raising fish to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. 

Chorn is requesting a loan for $1,000, which will be used to purchase fodder to feed the fish so that they gain weight and can then be sold. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his youngest child to study until he/she earns a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to feed fish.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
El señor Artemio es un señor trabajador que se dedica a la crianza de marranos desde hace dos años , es una persona humilde y trabajadora.
Es soltero , el nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es darle de comer a sus  marranos   para que estén gordos y bonitos.
Tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de contraposos para que las personas de su localidad no les falte agua.
El pidió el préstamo para  la compra de marranos para la crianza ya que en su localidad se vende  bien la carne de marrano.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarlos a salir adelante y seguir creciendo cada día mas.
texts.en:
Artemio is a hardworking man who has worked raising pigs for two years.  He is a humble and hardworking person.  He is single.  He says the thing he likes best about his work is feeding his pigs so that they are fat and beautiful.  He also works building wells so that people in his area have access to water.

He is asking for this loan to purchase pigs to raise since pork sells well in his area.

He is thankful to the Foundation for helping him get ahead and continue growing more every day.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Benkadi  7 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz et l’arachide  avec  FANTA, 1 ere debout de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 320.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 7" are married women averaging 39 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Djigonso, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with FANTA, the first one standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 2 hectares.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 320,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr: Gilbert est  un homme de 32 ans marié père de famille. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 10 ans déjà, il fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus, une machine  et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Gilbert is a 32-year-old married father. After his training, he opened a small sewing workshop that has been working well for already ten years.

He also embroiders but does not have all the necessary equipment to fulfill his orders faster and satisfy his customers with timely deliveries.

That is why he is requesting a loan to buy fabric, a sewing machine and small sewing equipment (pins, needles, lining, thread, ...), which will avoid his having to go to the market all the time, so that instead he can sew and sell to his customers.

The profit from this loan will enable him not only to buy his small sewing equipment to expand his activity, but also to satisfy some of his personal needs and those of his family.

loans.use: buy fabric and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna, aged in early 40s, is a mother of seven children. Her residential area is Battambang province where her pineapple is grown. Besides this fruit plantation, she works for others for a fee and it has returned her about 30,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Vanna with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost. She highly hopes that she can improve her living condition gradually from the business that she has managed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock for the business

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu and her family  have settled in Sumgait city. She is 36 year old, an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli. 
Having borrowed $300 she bought a sewing machine. She has been engaged in this business at her own home for 14 years. After buying the sewing machine she thought that it is time to start a business, but she did not have enough money. The second time she borrowed $500 to sew on a machine genuine leather jackets, genuine leather clothes for women. She  does not have a tailor shop. She has a lot of clients but her home is not comfortable for her business.  
Arzu needs a loan of $850 to open her own tailor shop.

loans.use: To open her own tailor shop.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva P. is a single woman living in the small Samoan village of Vaipuna. She joined the SPBD program last year right after completing school.

Passionate about being financially independent, she manages her mother’s small village store and is applying for a small loan so she can restock the shop’s shelves and finance an expansion of their product line.

The shop brings in about ST 350 – 400 (approximately USD 150) in revenue a week for her and her mother. Minerva feels that this is a solid income stream worth investing in and that with diligence she can grow it further.

loans.use: Buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs T. is 34 years old, and she has a 4 year old daughter. She lives in the small town of Do Luong, about 50 km from the border with Laos. Her husband is a border guard who comes home every 2-3 weeks. Two years ago she opened her little butcher shop. Farmers bring her the meat, but now she would like to buy a cow for breeding, to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Mr. B. is a low income vulnerable person. He is 51, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Shahin sells milk to the Saatli people and local milk processing factory. The income from one cow is too low to support the family. That’s why Shahin applied for a $400 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Shahin has some of his own money to contribute as well.

loans.use: Shahin would like to buy one more pedigree cow to sell its milk.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 40 years old, married and for the last four years has operated a wholesale goods shop in Kayunga. He sells soap, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil along with salt, beans, rice and pineapple sugar. He is a very committed man who has had no problem repaying previous loans. He has been able to build his own home. Eventually he would like to buy a vehicle to more easily transport his goods and reduce his costs of transport. The products he carries have a very good market. He plans to use his loan to expand his business by buying more products to stock his wholesale store.

loans.use: Alfred plans to use his loan to buy more, soap, sugar, maize, cooking oil to stock his wholesale store

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario Alberto is a young man who understands life and knows that in order to move ahead, he has to work hard. Mario is studying engineering, but tuition is expensive and his family is unable to afford it since his father's salary is very low and Mario has two other siblings who are also students. To pay for his tuition costs, Mario bought clothes and sold them to his friends, and little by little, he soon made some money. After some time, he had the opportunity to obtain a mobile stall to use on the weekends. This is how he opened his business and currently, he has some customers.

However, he needs to buy merchandise for the winter season. Thus, he requests a loan of $925 that he is certain will be paid in installments over 6 months. With this loan, Mario will be able to have a well-stocked inventory of winter clothing. With your help, Mario will be able to sell these clothes and have the resources to eventually become an engineer.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Mario Alberto es un joven que sabe lo que cuesta la vida, y que para poder salir adelante se tienen que esforzar mucho. Mario está estudiando ingeniería, sin embargo los gastos de la escuela son mucho, y su familia no le puede pagar esto, puesto que el sueldo de su papá es muy bajo y Mario tiene otros dos hermanos que están estudiando y necesitan salir adelante. Para poder pagar sus estudios Mario compró ropa y la ofreció a sus amigos, y poco a poco iba adquiriendo dinero, después de un tiempo se le presentó la oportunidad de obtener un local los fines de semana en un mercado rodante, y fue así como comenzó por abrir su negocio. Actualmente ya tiene unos clientes.

Sin embargo, necesita comprar mercancía para la temporada de invierno, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está seguro podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Mario podrá surtir de ropa para la temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda Mario podrá tener qué vender en esta temporada y así tendrá dinero para poder ser un ingeniero.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Ujamoral Massoumé Group

texts.fr:
We live on the island of Carabane, a very isolated place. Our main resource is fish, and we would like to develop our business of processing fish products and selling them in markets in cities like Dakar and Ziguinchor and in other places in Senegal. We would also like to buy and sell industrial products, which are very difficult to find in our town due to its island location. We would like to buy perishable goods (shrimp, smoked, dried and salted fish and other seafood such as oysters and shellfish), which we will process to sell in town.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous habitons une zone très enclavée qui est l'île de Carabane. notre principale ressource est la pêche et 

nous  voulons développer le commerce des produits de la pêche que nous transformons et allons vendre 

dans les marchés des villes comme Dakar, Ziguinchor et autres lieux du Sénégal. Il y a aussi le commerce 

des produits industiels qui sont d'accès très difficile vu notre situation géographique d'insulaire. qinsi donc, 

nous allons acheter les produits frais que nous transformerons pour les revendre en ville(crevettes; 

poissons fumés, séchés et salés et les autres fruits de mer commes les huîtres et coquillages)

loans.use: Purchase of fish products and women’s and children’s clothing

loans.name: Ivonne De Los Ángele

texts.es:
Ivonne de los Ángeles C. V. is single and has three school-aged children. Her last year of studies was the fifth grade. She runs a general store, and tells us that she has enjoyed working since a young age. For a time in her life, she decided to travel overseas. Upon her return, and with the money she was able to save, she obtained her business in Chinandega. She started her store upon the birth of her first child. She was quite young and her husband was out of work. She invested the money she earned abroad in the implementation of her store.

This young lady has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she feels very gratified with the 21 loans that have been granted to her. They have helped her stock her store and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ivonne de los Ángeles C. V. , soltera, tiene tres hijos los tres están el periodo escolar, el ultimo año que cursó ella fue el quinto año de secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, nos dice que desde joven le ha gustado trabajar, tanto así que en un momento de su vida decidió viajar al extranjero, después regresó y con el dinero que logró ahorrar obtuvo este negocio de pulpería en Chinandega. El negocio lo comienza cuando nace su primer hijo, ella era muy joven y su esposo estaba sin trabajo entonces con el dinero que ella recopiló en el exterior lo invierte en la implementación de la pequeña pulpería.

Esta joven señora trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los 21 créditos otorgados que los utiliza para suplir el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store business.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula is a member if the communal bank Loreto, located in the Jr. Victor Montalvo, No. 792, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Paula is 43 years old and has 5 children. With the first S/. 300.00 loan she received from Manuela Rios she invested in the sale of whole grains. Currently she continues to sell grains with the help of her husband. For this reason she has to constantly go to her farm to check on her crop and bring the corn that will be sold.

The S/1,300 loan, that she will pay back in 5 months, will be used to sow more corn and purchase sacks to store grains. She will save the remainder of the loan for any eventuality that may arise.

Paula posses an enviable vitality. She doesn't stop working even though she is tired. He children support her and she states that all of her sacrifices are for their benefit. Her greatest satisfaction will be to see them become educated professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Paula pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Victor Montalvo N° 792, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Paula tiene 43 años y es madre de 5 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en la compra y venta de granos. En la actualidad sigue con el negocio de venta de granos, para ello tiene que ir constantemente a su chacra y ver como está la cosecha y traer el maíz para poder venderlos, su esposo trabaja junto con ella. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la siembra de maíz, comprará sacos para poder almacenar y otra parte del prestamo lo guardará para cualquier necesidad que se le presente. Paula tiene una vitalidad envidiable porque aún cansada no deja de seguir trabajando, sus hijos la apoyan y manifiesta que todo el sacrificio que realiza es por ellos, que quiere verlos profesionales, eso será su mayor satisfacción.

loans.use: To invest in corn crops

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 25 years old and is a single woman. She owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. She works every day from 9 am to 6 pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Aisha , who has a business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en:
Sroeun K. is a 52-year-old mother of two grown daughters living in Cambodia. Her village is across the Mekong River, located about 12 kilometers from the capital city of Phnom Penh.

For the past two decade, she and her husband (shown in the picture) have earned a living by farming the land. They grow corn, sesame, and other crops. Sroeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to buy a water pump and fertilizer to boost their farm production and family income.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizer for growing crops

loans.name: Máximo Andrés

texts.es:
Maximo P. has been in farming for 15 years in the county of Condega, in the city of Esteli. Through his business he has been able to maintain his family which consists of his partner and their 4 kids, three of whom are school age so need his unconditional support.

Now Maximo needs to buy some young bulls so that he can raise them. This is why he needs a loan from Ceprodel; so that he can buy these bulls and feed them so that he can get the best price for them when he offers them to clients. It is very important to add that the main beneficiaries of this credit will be his partner and kids as much as him.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Máximo P. se dedica al negocio de la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años habiéndolo desempeñado en el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí. Por medio de su negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos están en edad escolar y por tanto necesitan de su apoyo incondicional.

Hoy en día la necesidad del caballero Máximo es la pronta adquisición de los novillos para su respectiva crianza es por este motivo que muy sabiamente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para llevar a cabo la compra de estos novillos los cuales al adquirirlos los alimentará para luego sacarle el máximo provecho ofreciéndolos a sus clientes. Es de suma importancia destacar que por medio de este crédito son beneficiados tanto el como su cónyuge e hijos.

loans.use: To buy young bulls to raise/Compra de novillos para desarrollo

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak R., 31, is a grocer in Siem Reap Province, living with her husband and five children. She typically makes $15 in revenue at her store, while her husband brings home $3 each day as a construction worker. The family is also aided by one daughter who sells souvenirs in front of the temple each day.

Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year, greatly increasing the price of food and other basic necessities.
