Sak R. would like to expand her business to account for these rising costs and so is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to add to her inventory. She sees this as a stable investment that can increase her profits and improve her ability to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Yesenia Yadira

texts.es:
Yesenia started her business to help her husband with the household expenses. A year ago she began selling natural products to her mother because she had problems with her weight. Since the results were so good for her mother, she now is a distributor and her sales have gone very well due to her many clients.

She needs a $300 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise since her sales have been increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Yesenia inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar Comenzó hace un año a vender pero al principio su mama le vendió los productos naturistas para que ella lo consumiera ya que tenia problemas D. sobre peso pero le ha dado tan buen resultado que ahora ella es distribuidora y le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para compra D. mercancía ya que sus ventas cada vez se han ido incrementando

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia is a widow with three children aged 10, 6 and six months. She is a clothes seller, working from 7am to 9pm every day. She earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fauzia requests a loan to buy more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Medina M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 2 children, 5 months and 2 years old. Medina has been running a grocery since 2006. She sells sugar, salt, rice, wheat flour, etc. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 16 hours per day.

Medina currently earns about US$ 300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional stocks of cooking oil, soda, and rice. In the future, she plans to expand and establish another shop. Medina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cooking oil, soda, and rice

loans.name: Carmen Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Carmen cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en tejidos, su arte ya vio tierra extranjera a través de una de sus hermanas, por lo que ve un atisbo del sueño que tuvo cuando apenas se iniciaba como tejedora: exportar sus productos. Su trabajo es exquisito y el hambre de éxito de Carmen hizo que fingiera un stand en plena sala de su casa en pos de promocionar parte de su obra.


La señora Carmen requiere 700 soles para poder solventar tan maravillosa creatividad volcada en sus productos, que irán destinados a la compra de lana de alpaca e hilo de primera calidad, digna de exportación peruana.
texts.en:
Carmen has 10 years of experience in knitting. Her art has been seen in other countries through one of her sisters. This has allowed her to see a hint of the dream she had when she began knitting: to export her products. Her work is exquisite and her drive for success led Carmen to fashion a kind of stand in the living room of her home in order to promote her handiwork. Carmen needs a loan for 700 soles to buy high-quality alpaca wool and thread in order to afford to keep making marvelous creations worthy of becoming Peruvian exports.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her business

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo A. est âgé de 28 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il tient une boutique de fournitures de bureau depuis 2 ans à Kpalime, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Ce crédit lui permettra d’approvisionner son magasin et pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kodzo A. is 28 years old, single and without children. He's been running a shop that sells office supplies for two years in Kpalime, a city located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. This loan will enable him to resupply his shop to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell office supplies

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en: G. Robert is a member of Kwewayo Namukozi Women’s Group in Mityana. He is 32 years of age and married with 3 children and he cares for 1 adopted daughter. He has a shop from which he has been selling sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and many other things for 3 years now. He has been with his lending group for a year and a half and he has a dream of transforming his business into a wholesale shop. He needs a new loan to help with restocking his shop to make more profits.

loans.use: Robert needs a new loan to help with restocking his shop.

loans.name: Safia Rahmat Ali Group

texts.en:
Safia baji is 56 years old and married. She owns a two-room brick house in a city named Vehari, Pakistan and has lived in it with her family for the last 25 years. She is an uneducated lady. She could not get an education due to few financial resources and the sudden death of her father. Her father passed away when she was just 5 years old. Her husband's name is R. A., and he has a business selling cane products. He makes cane furniture and ladders as well and sells the products in markets. He has 40 years of experience in this business. They have four sons. The first two sons are involved in a sewing machine repair business. The younger sons are involved in their father’s business. Safia baji also helps her husband in cleaning the cane sticks. She successfully repaid her previous two loans that she took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more cane sticks to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of three other women. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to resell. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy washing powder to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cane sticks for making furniture, engine oil to resell, beams for a shutter business, and powdered soap to resell.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mrs. Socheat P., 37, and her husband, Mr. Leap Chab, 34, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1995 and have two sons. Both of them are in local school.

Socheat has been a garment factory worker for four years. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for ten years. They hope that their businesses will be able to support their children's further education. The family lives in an old house and part of it is broken but they lack the money to repair it.

Therefore, Socheat is requesting her first loan of US$ 1000 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has two children, and her children go to school.

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop.

loans.name: Karin Dallan

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Karin G. se esfuerza grandemente en su trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar y continuar con el mantenimiento de su vivienda ya que la ha comenzado a reconstruir para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de pintura ya que requiere de esta para así continuar con el siguiente paso como es darle color a sus paredes y terminar de reconstruir las partes que así lo requieren. Por esta razón ella espera en Ceprodel para que le brinden el crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Karin G. works hard at her job in order to support her family and continue to maintain her home since she begun to repair it to create better living conditions for her family. She has come to Ceprodel to receive a loan so she can buy paint since she needs to continue with the next step, coloring her walls, and to finish remodeling the parts that need it. For this reason, she hopes Ceprodel can grant her the loan and therefore enable her to proceed with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael O., 41, has been selling yams for the past five years to support her family. She is married and the mother of six children. Yam is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in the diet. Rachael takes delivery of produce from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell at higher prices. She loves selling goods, the business from which she obtains a daily source of livelihood.

With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Four of her children are currently in junior and senior high. Rachael belongs to a village bank called Yesu Abusua which literally means "God’s Family".

loans.use: To purchase yams from direct from farmers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fish (sea bass, red snapper, and lagoon shrimp)

loans.name: Yader Javier

texts.es: El joven Yader Javier Sánchez, tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el barrio Pablo Calero, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos , que actualmente estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su casa , ya que ellos habitan en cuarto , desde hace 10 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener estable su cultivo , en momento ha sido afectado por plagas , ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos por falta de financiamiento . Con el préstamo va a comprar los insumos necesarios para su cultivo y así poder lograr una buena producción y con las ganancias poder terminar de hacer su vivienda que es uno de sus anheló para su familia.
texts.en:
Yader Javier Sánchez, a young man of 27 years, lives in the community of Pablo Calero with his wife who works to help him with the household expenses. They have two children who are primary school students. His plans for his family are to be able to finish building his house, since they now live in a room. For ten years he has worked in agriculture. With his own efforts he has been able to maintain stability in his crop although at times it has been affected by plagues (insects, weeds, disease) since he lacks fertilizer and other supplies because of lack of financing. With this loan he is going to buy the necessary inputs for his crop and thus be able to attain a better production and with the earnings be able to finish building the house that is one of his wishes for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building the living room of his house

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
N. Joyce is the leader of Kewerimidde group in Lugazi, Katosi. She is a farmer with various food plantations like cassava, matooke (plantain), sweet potatoes and ginger for both home consumption and for sale, as well as having friesian cows at home that give her milk for sale. Joyce also manages her late husband’s fleet of boats that are used for fishing and here she employs men who work on each one of them for pay depending on their day’s catch.

Joyce is a widow with ten children and her loans have helped in boosting her many businesses, giving her children a chance to attain an education. Joyce needs a loan to help with paying school fees and employing labor on her farm for fast and high-quality yields.

loans.use: To pay school fees and to employ manpower on her farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 42-year-old mother of three children, all in school, is married to a teacher. She is a very resourceful mother who supports her children through the sale of used clothing, curtains and bed sheets which she purchases from the nearby city of Kumasi. In business for 18 years now, the sale of these used products commands a very large market share in Ghana, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the poor.

Grace is requesting the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s future and also rent a store from which to sell her goods, as she currently sells through hawking.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом Махмудов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдусалом более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует детской одеждой. Клиент на  полученный кредит хочет закупить детскую одежду из г.Душанбе. Часть товара он продаст на Районом рынке по оптовым ценам, а другую часть пустит в свой оборот.
texts.en:
Abdusalom M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 54 years old, married and has three children. Abdusalom has been in the retail business for more than three years. He mainly sells children's clothing. He will use the loan to buy children's clothing from the city of Dushanbe. Part of the goods he will sell on the Regional market at wholesale prices and the other part he will sell in retail.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Шухрат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Орипов Шухрат 1976 года рождения. Женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка присматривает за детьми. Шухрат с малых лет увлекался игрой на барабане и мечтал стать артистом. Его мечта сбылось он стал знаменитым барабанщиком. Шухрат работает артистом в театре «Кохи Рудаки» города Худжанда. Он играет на разных инструментах как доира, таблак, кулабек. Его виртуозная игра очень нравится зрителям. Для того чтобы разнообразить свою программу он хочет приобрести инструмент Конго.

loans.use: На покупку музыкального инструмента Конго.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 43 años, vive junto a su pareja quien lo apoya mucho, no tienen hijos y la casa donde habitan es propia. Anteriormente tenía el negocio de cabinas de internet público, pero no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas, por tal motivo, hace 9 meses optó por construir 4 habitaciones en el espacio donde estaban sus computadoras, y desde ese entonces se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones. Negocio donde le está yendo muy bien porque ya cuenta con 4 inquilinos. Sin embargo, José no solo se dedica a esa actividad, ya que es profesor de primaria en una institución educativa desde hace 17 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de sus labores, tanto independiente como dependiente, es que lo mantienen ocupado y le son rentables, porque ambos le permiten tener ingresos fijos mensuales. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, él está muy contento y agradecido con su banco comunal porque cuanto tuvo algunos problemas, todos le ayudaron a resolverlos. Asimismo sabe que todos son personas responsables con sus respectivos negocios y con el pago de sus créditos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando mandará a refaccionar sus habitaciones; las pintará, le colocará un mejor piso y construirá lavatorios.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and live with his partner, who is very supportive. They do not have children and live in their own home. Previously, José operated a public Internet café but did not generate enough revenue as he expected. Nine months ago, he decided to build 4 rooms in the space that previously housed his computer terminals and rent them out to tenants. Business is doing well because all 4 rooms are occupied. In addition, José is a primary school teacher at an educational institution and has been in this profession for the past 17 years. He enjoys both of his jobs, being an employee and a small business owner, because it keeps him busy and he is able to earn additional profits instead of relying on a fixed monthly income.

José is requesting his 3rd loan with MFP. He is very happy and grateful to his Communal Bank because they supported him whenever he faced difficulties. He knows that everyone is responsible in their own businesses and with their loan payments. The funds he requested will be used to perform renovations to his rental rooms, including painting and installation of new floors and sinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations to his rental space

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann C. is 38 years old and has four school-aged children with her husand Elwin C., who makes a living as a fieldhand. The money he earns is not enough to support their family. That is why Mary Ann is looking for new ways to earn extra money by raising more pigs. She started her business with a loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). This business, which has done well, brings in extra income, so she would like to expand it. She will use a portion of this loan to buy more pigs and feed for them to eat. 

In addition to raising livestock, Mary Ann runs a variety store, which she stocks with funds earned from her livestock business. She plans to use some of the funds from this loan to buy more items to sell in her store, including soft drinks, wine, cooking oil, soy sauce and different kinds of groceries. She will also use some money from the loan to help run a small farm that she operates. 

Mary Ann's goal is to have enough money to provide for the education of her children, because she wants them to finish their studies, go to college and get good, stable jobs in the future. She is determined that they never experience the hardships she has gone through.

loans.use: To help expand several small businesses

loans.name: Coumba Tabaski

texts.fr: Coumba Tabaski  S.  s’active dans le commerce de tissus et habillement pour femme. Elle est âgée de 29 ans ; elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle exerce le commerce en même temps de que son métier de surveillance dans une école privée de la ville de Mbour. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité en  achetant des tissus pour la rentrée des classes. Avec les revenus issus de son  commerce elle parvienne à se prendre en change paiement du loyers et achat de vêtements.

loans.use: Achat de tissus

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and lives with Maria. They have 1 child together and they live in a neighborhood that is very close to the center of the city of Ita.
Juan has run a machine shop out of his home for 9 years. He replaces spare parts for vehicles or taxis, private or casual. He says he is pleased with the profits because it helps his family’s welfare. 
Juan wants to take out a loan to buy petrol engines, so he can resell it and generate extra family income.

loans.use: Petrol Engines

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie S. J., 46 years old, is happily married to 47 year old Dante S. J.. In the long years of their marriage, they are blessed with four children; Aiza, 21 in the second year at college, Dansie, 16 in her fourth year at the high school, Danica, 11 in grade 6 and Danjo, 9 in grade 4. They spend a significant amount of money on school expenses. But Josie and her husband do not mind it and work hard because they want their children to complete their studies, so that they may improve their way of living.

A source of their family income is her husband who is a driver, and the other is her business of selling fish. Josie also manages a food preparation business that contributes to their income and helps with their daily expenses. They live on an island village, so access to fish for resale is easy. She does not have to visit far off places to buy fish, so she saves on transportation. She has been running this business for 20 years and wants to expand and improve it. The loan will be used to buy a variety of fish, which is found only in the Philippines, so that her business will earn more.

Josie’s hope is that her business will continue to run and grow so she can always afford the schooling expenses for their 4 children. Josie and Dante really want the children to finish their studies because they believe that is the only thing they can inherit from them.

loans.use: To finance her fish vending business

loans.name: 16.01.02 Đông Hải Group

texts.en: Hoan Lê Thị (1) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Đông Hải (16.01.02 Đông Hải). Hoan is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. In 2004, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hoan is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 7th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị Việt (28) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 2. Đỗ Thị Huyền (30) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 3. Lê Thị Hương (34) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 4. N. Thị Dung (31) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 5. Lê Thị Y (14) is a 60-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hoan Lê Thị (1) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Đông Hải (16,01,02 Đông Hải). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2004, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Việt (28) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 2. Đỗ Thị Huyền (30) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 3. Lê Thị Hương (34) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 4. N. Thị Dung (31) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 5. Lê Thị Y (14) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cidlia

texts.es:
La señora Cidlia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años y 02 hijos,  que aun dependen de ella.

Cidlia, se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio, nos cuenta que ya tiene experiencia en este tipo de actividad, al que ya viene dedicándose 02 años. Se inicio con un capital de S/. 1,000.00 y poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias y haciéndose muy conocida en el mercado. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender sus clientes fijos que viven en el barrio y amigos conocidos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará más productos para su stock como: cuadernos, lápices, borradores lapiceros, plumones, engrapadores. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de andamios para mostrar sus productos.

Cidlia, tiene un carisma para vender a sus clientes, comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Cidlia is a member of the "Corazón de Jesús" (Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank, in the San José de Sisa District, in the Province of El Dorado, in the Department of San Martín. She is 43 years-old and has 2 children, who still depend on her. Cidlia works selling desk and office supplies. She says she has two years of experience in this business. She began with S/1,000.00 as capital, and little by little increased her earnings, making herself known in the market. Currently she is continuing with this same business and says her store is very well-fitted to serve her loyal customers who live in the neighborhood and her friends. With this loan of S/3,000.00 Cidlia will buy more products to stock her inventory, such as: notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, pens, erasers, and staplers. Some of the funds will also be invested in the purchase of shelves to display the merchandise. Cidlia is very charismatic while selling to her customers. She says Movimiento Manuela Ramos as an organization helps women develop and progress economically with the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to increase store inventory.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 58-year-old widowed woman who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with her child. Majida has been the owner of a mini market near her house since 1997. Her clients are neighbors, relatives and passersby. Majida requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise which will help increase her capitA.. It will also help with her son’s marriage arrangements.

This is Majida’s ninth year with microcredits and she has an excellent payback history. She plans to improve and expand her work in the future by opening a supermarket with a wide variety of choices to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en su casa propia.Se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (platillo compuesto de salchichas y papas fritas),  además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda que esta ubicada un poco alejada de la ciudad, es por esta razón que logra buenas ventas ya que es el único negocio que ofrece este delicioso  platillo en su zona; los clientes la frecuentan muy seguido, ya que el mercado donde venden algo similar se encuentra a media hora. Lidia se siente contenta con su trabajo porque  le permite salir adelante al lado de su familia, y  atiende con mucho empeño a todos los clientes, además  es  una persona muy querida en su vecindario, y trabaja siempre pensando  en el futuro, quiere brindarles mayor estabilidad a sus hijos.Es su primer préstamo con  MFP y promete ser muy responsable con todas las cuotas.Con el dinero del crédito  quiere comprar mayor cantidad de papas( tubérculos peruanos) para aumentar la producción de platos y además quiere abastecer de panetones (bizcochos navideños)  su tienda, para venderlos por navidad y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Lidia is 34 years old, lives with her partner in her own house, and has two children. She sells a type of food called "salchipapas," a dish made from sausage (salchichas) and french fries (papas fritas). She also has a grocery store that she runs out of her home, which is located outside the city. She makes good sales as she is the only business in her area that offers the delicious dish. Her customers come to her very often since the other market that sells something similar is a half an hour away. Lidia feels very happy with her job because it lets her her and her family succeed, and she is very dedicated to attending to her customers. She is also a very well-liked person in her neighborhood, and she always works with a mind toward the future. She wants to provide stability for her children. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very responsible with the repayments. With the money from the loan, she plans to buy a large quantity of potatoes (Peruvian tubers) in order to increase the number of dishes she makes, and she also wants to supply her store with "panetones" (traditional Christmas cakes) in order to sell them for the holidays and make a good profit.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to supply her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a café business

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is 34 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and three children. Mouhamad has been working as a constructor since 1995, and his particular job is taking care of the cement. His customers are people from his region and the surrounding villages. When Mouhamad first started his work, he wasn’t really known by people in his region which meant that he didn't have a lot of contacts. He decided to start his business because of his experience.
Mouhamad has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work and to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and married with seven children, ranging in age from 10 to 22 years old.  Six of her children are currently enrolled in school. Betty has been running a mixed farm for over ten years just outside of Kitale, Kenya, in the western region of the country. She sells maize, milk, and cereals as the primary source of her income, while also earning money selling second-hand clothes and blankets in her town. She says that the main challenge right now is occasional bouts of disease spreading through her livestock.

Betty recently completed her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo for KES 30,000, and has now requested this loan for KES 50,000 to expand her stock of poultry and acquire necessary farm supplies. She also wants to use a portion of the loan for school fees for her children, as she repeatedly stresses the importance of education. She says that the extra income from this loan will hopefully enable her to send all of her children through school, and eradicate poverty in her family. In the future, she would like to continually improve on her farming abilities and provide for her extended family.

Betty is thus far very pleased with her association with Juhudi Kilimo/Kiva. She is proud of the changes she has witnessed in her own family and her town, and hopes that one day all of her needs will be met through continued cooperation with Juhudi/Kiva.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and increase poultry stock

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA CAROLINA ES UNA CLIENTE DINAMICA, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑO,  ELLA  YA TRABAJO TRES SECUENCIAS EN LA INSTITUCION, EN SU COMPORTAMIENTO ELLA DEMOSTRO PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD, LA SEÑORA CAROLINA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y VENTA DE JUGUETES, ESTOS LOS AGARRA POR FARDOS QUE LLEGAN DEL EXTERIOR, LA ROPA QUE ELLA RECIBE ES VARIADA RECIBE ROPA DE BUENA CALIDAD COMO TAMBIEN DE MALA CALIDAD, LO MISMO LOS JUGUETES, EL PUESTO DE LA SEÑORA ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA 16 DE JULIO, LA FERIA SE LLAMA TAMBIEN 16 DE JULIO, EN LA FERIA EXISTE TODO TIPO DE PRODUCTOS A LA VENTA DESDE UNA AGUJA HASTA UN AUTO, EL NEGOCIO DE LA SEÑORA ESTA UBICADO EN LA AV. PANORAMICA ZONA QUE ES MUY POPULAR DE EL ALTO POR SER UNA ZONA QUE TIENE PRODUCTOS BARATOS, EL ESPOSO DE LA SEÑORA SE DEDICA A LA CONDUCCION DE TAXI, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA Y JUGUETES POR MAYOR.

ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ms. Carolina is a dynamic member of our institute. She is married and has 2 young children. She has been working in our institute for three loan cycles, demonstrating punctuality and responsibility. Ms. Carolina sells clothing and toys for a living. She obtains the merchandise in bulk as they come in from abroad. She receives a wide variety of apparel and toys, from good quality to bad. Her stand is located in the 16 de Julio zone in the market that goes by the same name. A wide variety of merchandise is offered there, from needles to cars. Her business is located on Panoramica Avenue, which is a popular area in El Alto because of the affordable products that are sold there. Her husband works as a taxi cab driver. This loan will be invested in purchasing toys and apparel wholesale. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust she has been given when receiving her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys and apparel wholesale

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas son la joven Neysi Rebeca C. Vallecillo tiene una pequeña librería y comercializa ropa nueva y usada. Esta joven de 25 años inicio con la ayuda de la Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura donde estudio operador en computación  y como forma de apoyarlos les dio un financiamiento para que iniciaran su negocio.

Es entonces que C. instala su pequeña librería a finales del 2005 y luego para aumentarlo empezó a prestar con lo cual luego de un tiempo invierte en otro negocio  que es en ropa y cosméticos. Ella con el préstamo comprara pacas de ropa  y cosméticos ya que en esta época son los productos que tienen mayor demanda.

Sus Compañeras son Idalia U. quien vende frescos, gaseosas y comida y Karla C. de 21 años la cual para poder costear sus estudios y lograr ser una enfermera empezó hace dos años y medio a vender nacatamales, platillo típico que se consume generalmente los fines de semana.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Group is composed of 3 young working women, one of whom is Neysi Rebeca who has a small book store and sells new and used clothing. This young woman of 25 began with the aid of the Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura (Association of Cultural Promoters) where she studied to be a computer operator. As a way of helping, they provided financing to help start her business. That is when she began her small book store, at the end of 2005, and later, to expand it, she borrowed money, which, eventually, she invested in an additional business, selling clothes and cosmetics. She used the loan to buy boxes of clothes and cosmetics, especially products that were in high demand at that time. Neysi's companions are Idalia, who sells fruit drinks, soft drinks, and meals, and Karla, 21 years old, who in order to pay her nursing school expenses, began 2 ½ years ago to sell 'nacatamales,' a typical local dish generally consumed on weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Maria Soledad tiene 41 años. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con los financiamientos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada y ademas venta de refrescos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella desde muy joven ha trabajado, ya que además acude en una empresa a ofrecer la variedad de productos y así provecha a distribuir una gran variedad. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y ropa interior. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios para que sean personas de bien y con un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad is 41 years old. This is not her first experience working with loans. She sells used clothing and also soft drinks. Maria has more than six years of experience in this business and has been working since she was a very young woman. Her business offers a variety of products, so she hopes to use this to her advantage.

The loan she is requesting will used as operating capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and undergarments. She wants her children to finish their studies so that they can become outstanding people and have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and undergarments

loans.name: Nimrod

texts.en:
Nimrod E. O. is a fish vendor in Nambale, Busia District, Kenya. He started this business in 2006 immediately after his college studies in Accounts. He buys his stock from Jinja, Uganda, twice a week, since the Kenya-Uganda border is 20 km away.

Nimrod is 30 years of age, married and blessed with three children. He intends to buy a parcel of land and build rentals. He says this is his dream for the future. He would like a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which he will use to expand his current  fish business by increasing his stock.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Beneficta Dangcalan Group

texts.en:
Beneficta D. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Beneficta is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Beneficta is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Beneficta owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Beneficta has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Beneficta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beneficta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Beneficta is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Beneficta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Johanna Valeria

texts.es:
Johanna A. es una socia joven  del bankito Las Flores, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca cuna de deportistas, escritores que han puesto muy en alto no solo el nombre de esta ciudad sino del país entero, y es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador. 

Nuestra socia es tesorera en la junta Parroquial del agua potable labora en esta actividad hace cuatro años de lunes a viernes y en sus tiempos libres vende los productos Yanbal. Johana tiene 22 años de edad es casada y fruto de su unión matrimonial concibió un hijo de apenas un mes de nacido, su esposo tiene una mecánica industrial en sociedad y como aun no tienen viven  en casa de un familiar.

 Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace un año y fue gracias a su mamá  que  la incentivo a que ingrese a este hermoso grupo de mujeres carismáticas y luchadoras, con su crédito  comprará cremas, perfumes, maquillajes, esmaltes, sombras  y más productos cosméticos Yanbal.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Johanna A. is a young member of the bank Las Flores. She lives in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the cradle of athletes and writers who have brought fame not only to the city but the entire country. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. Our member is the treasurer of the parrish board of potable water. She has been working at this activity for four years from Monday to Friday. In her free time, she sells Yanbal products. Johana is 22 years old, married, and has a son who is barely a month old. Her husband is an industrial mechanic in a business and since they still don't have their own house, they live in a relative's. She has been in the communal bank for a year and it was her mother who motivated her to join this beautiful group of charismatic, fighter women. With the loan, she will buy creams, perfume, makeup, nail polish, eyeshadow, and more Yanbal cosmetic products. Her goal is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, makeup, nail polish, eyeshadow and more Yanbal products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used colthing

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.en:
N. Ubaidullo is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Ubaidullo is running his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located near a railway terminal. He has been in this business for eight years. On average, he serves 20-25 clients a day. His wife and elder son help him with the business. Ubaidullo is trying to use only the best inputs in his café. Thus, the business is stable and brings considerable income for the family. He requests $1250 US Dollars to purchase meat and coal for his café to cook shish kebab. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Ubaidullo wants to thank everyone who supports him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase meat and coal for his café

loans.name: Segunda Adelaida

texts.es:
Segunda Adelaida P. P. tiene 27 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 3 hijos, Gisela (10), Yomaira  (12), Adriana (8) y Víctor (16). 

Segunda es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Segunda se dedica a la siembra de maíz. Realiza sus compras las realiza en mata de Cacao y San Jose del Tambo  y vende los productos en Mata de Cacao y Ventanas según el precio mejor.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra del insumo de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño buscar mejoramiento de la familia y en el negocio crecer económicamente. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar y ser alegre.
texts.en:
Segunda Adelaida P. P. is 27 years old. She is single, and lives in the town of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. She has 4 children, Gisela (10), Yomaira (12), Adriana (8) and Víctor (16). Segunda is a member of the El Progreso La Delicia Recinto rural loan program, in the San José del Tambo parish. The group is comprised of 19 members, and the community dedicates itself primarily to growing cacao and corn. Segunda plants corn. She makes her purchases in Mata de Cacao and San Jose del Tambo, and sells her products in Mata de Cacao and Ventanas, depending on the prices. She thinks that this loan is a good opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to improve her family’s standard of living and to grow her business. The biggest challenges we face are time and the lack of financial resources. She enjoys working and being happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su madre y sus hermanos. Desde hace 3 años decidió  emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, en un inicio fue en un local que arrendó en una calle comercial de su ciudad, tuvo su primer negocio, pero fue victima de robo, ante esto le motivaron a establecer su negocio en casa de sus  padres. Desde entonces atiende en su establecimiento, dando el servicio de  llamadas a celular con un maquina que calcula el tiempo y la tarifa que se utilizó en ese tiempo de llamada. Por otro lado su negocio lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y algunos artículos de bazar como regalos y detalles para el arreglo personal, de esta manera su negocio este más surtido y atractivo para su clientela. Afirma que le gusta trabajar de manera independiente porque puede disponer de su  dinero y es por esta razón que esta planeando  adquirir mejores equipos pasa su negocio. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de un maquina más actual y electrónica que le permitirá tener un control más exacto en el costo de las llamadas que realicen sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pilar, 24, lives in her parents’ house with her mother and siblings. Three years ago she decided to start her own business to generate her own income. At the beginning, she rented a space in one of the city’s commercial streets. She had her first business there but was robbed. This motivated her to move her business to her parents’ house. Since then, she has tended to her business there. Her business consists in offering cell phone calls using a machine that calculates call duration and charges. In addition, she also sells snacks and some general merchandise like gift items and items of personal adornment. This makes her business better stocked and more attractive to her customers. She states that she enjoys working independently because she can dispose of her income. She is planning, therefore, to acquire better equipment for her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support. In addition, she enjoys team work because all her fellow group members are responsible and unified people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan which will be very useful to her business. She will use the requested funds to buy a more up-to-date, electronic machine that will allow her to have better control over the costs of calls placed by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new machine in order to have improved ability to calculate customer call charges.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia P. is from the village of Luna. She is 48 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from operating tricycle transport services. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nelia joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima Del Carmen P. vive en Charasol, que  pertenece a la ciudad de Azogues que es la capital de la Provincia del Cañar, se  localizada en la Hoya del río Paute, se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica a tejer vestidos de  lana, alfarería, etc. Su iglesia se encuentra en lo más alto de la ciudad siendo su principal atractivo turístico.

Doña Fátima tiene 36 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 16, 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la universidad, su segunda hija  en el colegio y su ultima hija estudia en una escuela de la comunidad,  su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero en busca de un buen trabajo para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad la que fue construida con el sacrificio conyugal.

La Señora Fátima se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, realiza manualidades en tela y cerámica, aprendió este oficio mediante cursos, los vende en su tiempo libre a sus conocidos.
 
Es el cuarto crédito que realiza en la fundación y nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado para la estabilidad económica de su hogar  por la facilidad de pago que le ofrecen,  el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en el pago de matriculas de sus hijos y también para la compra de  materiales para la realización de sus manualidades.

Su sueño es pagar la deuda que adquirió su esposo para el viaje y que pueda regresar pronto para que la familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Fátima Del Carmen P. lives in Charasol, which is part of the city of Azogues; the capital of the Cañar province, located along the river Paute. The area is characterized by its people who weave wool dresses, work in pottery, etc. Its church is located on the highest point and is the main tourist attraction. Fátima is 36 years old, is married and has three children, ages 17, 16, and 5. Her oldest son studies at university; her oldest daughter attends college, and her youngest daughter attends the local school. Her husband is out of the country, in search of a better future for the family. The home they live in is theirs and was built with sacrifice from both of them. Fátima is a homemaker who also does crafts in cloth and ceramic. She learned this trade by taking classes and she sells her items to her acquaintances in her spare time. This will be the fourth loan through the foundation and she tells us that her previous loans have helped improve the financial stability of their household, because of the easy payments. She will use the money from this loan, through Fundacion Espoir, to pay for her children’s tuition and also to buy supplies for her crafts. Her dream is to pay the debt that her husband took out for the trip and that he will be able to return soon so that the family can be together.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion L., from the village of Agunod, is 69 years old, married, and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Presentacion has owned and operated a business venture raising pigs for sale for over 9 years, earning approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Presentacion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she is now requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Presentacion's 14th loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad comes from a small city of Punjab called Kasur, famous in Pakistan for its leather industry. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family in the area of Basti Laal Shah. She is married to S. A. and has given birth to three daughters and three sons. Only three of them could manage to get education till fifth standard. They had to leave their education due to the poor financial conditions of Irshaad and her husband. 

Irshaad’s husband operates a decorative embroidery business. He collects orders from different boutiques and cloth shops and provides them finished goods to earn an income for his family. Irshaad, her three sons and her eldest daughter also do embroidery to support S. A. in completing the orders on time. 

Irshaad has applied for a loan for her husband’s decorative embroidery business. With the loan amount her husband will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk quantity and make more embroidered dresses to fulfill large orders on time.  Irshaad is hopeful that her husband will successfully uplift his business with this loan investment. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application to any MFI.

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies in bulk quantity for embroidery business

loans.name: La Casita De Juan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama la casita de Juan, porque no se ponían de acuerdo con el nombre de grupo, entonces le pusieron el nombre del esposo de la señora María Gloria, que fue la que organizó el grupo. El cual está ubicado en Cuautla de Morelos en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. María Gloria Cabrera, es tesorera del grupo, tiene 44 años de edad, vende productos Jafra y es líder de un grupo de vendedoras, tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a esto desde hace 8. Su esposo el señor Juan Castañeda es agricultor y se dedica a la siembra de gladiola. Ella se ha beneficiado con esta actividad, ya que con esto han hecho mejoras a su casa gracias a los ingresos que ha tenido, además de satisfacciones dado que por su buen desempeño ha ganado varios reconocimientos y premios, como viajes a Cancún, Acapulco, y el que nunca olvidara es el que gano a la ciudad de París Francia, ya que dice que por su situación económica, jamás le habría alcanzado para que ella algún día hubiera visitado esos lugares. Utiliza su crédito para invertir en productos y siempre tener lo que los clientes le pidan.
texts.en: This group is called La casita de Juan (Juan’s Little House) because the group could not agree on a name, and so they chose the name of Mrs. María Gloria’s husband, the one who organized the group.   It is located in Cuatla de Morelos in Mexico.  The group is made up of 10 members.  María Gloria Cabrera is the group’s treasurer.  She is 44 years old, sells Jafra products, is the leader of a group of saleswomen, and has two children.  She has done this work for eight years.  Her husband, Mr. Juan Castañeda, is a farmer and works cultivating gladiola.  She has benefited from this work, as they have made improvements to their house thanks to her income.  In addition to feeling pride for her hard work, she has also earned a lot of  recognition and prizes such as trips to Cancun, Acapulco, and the one she will never forget was the trip she won to Paris, France.  She says that because of her economic situation, she never would have thought she would be able to visit those places.  She will use the loan to buy products and to always have what her customers request.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkea V. (pictured with her daughter) is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Thorn Van, is 32 years old. They have been married for ten years and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a suburb approximately 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokkea is a construction worker. Her husband is a soldier. She is requesting her first loan of 600 USD to add to her own money to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K.  is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs for sale.  Alice is 21 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 3 children and 1 child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish another type of business.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo V. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 45 years old. Eduardo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP that will also be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria M., 48, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Florentino M. and together they have four children, two of whom are in college. By the grace of God, Gloria has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gloria operates a frozen food business. She sells on credit spiced hams, native sausages and sweetened and cured meat. Customers have one week to pay it back. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products to expand her  inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Gloria dreams of being able to send her children all the way through college so they get stable job someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married to a mason and together they live with their two children. She sells provisions and fruits at Abura. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She will use the loan to increase the supply of provisions to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans educate her children.

loans.use: To increase the supply of provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal from Marka, Amman is a 34-year-old married woman who has one child. She is very talented in fashioning and decorating with flowers which earns her a good reputation in that field although she works from home.
Manal is requesting a loan of 500 JD which is her first loan from Tamweelcom and Kiva. She intends to use the loan to purchase materials for her home-based business. Manal is looking to open her own licensed shop in a reputable area in Amman.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her home-based business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a firewood-selling business for the past six months, selling from home to her neighbors. Salama faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bundle of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simplicity to join.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of firewood for resale

loans.name: Balam Nah De Carrillo Group

texts.es: La señora    María Magdalena B. K.,  “Doña Magda”,  tiene  40 años de edad , ella es miembro del  grupo  Balam Nah de Carrillo , cuyo significado es  Casa del  Jaguar  en  lengua  maya . El grupo está ubicado  en la comunidad de  Carrillo Puerto.  María Magdalena  cuenta con  un cuarto que le sirve tanto de vivienda,  como de  tienda, lugar donde habitan  su  esposo  Mauricio  y  sus  3  hijos:  Nacho  de 21 años, (persona con capacidades  diferentes ), Yuridia  de 12 años,  y el pequeño  Lisandro  de 7 años,  en edad  escolar.   Necesita  construir  otro cuarto para utilizarlo como  tienda  para la venta  sus  productos naturistas,   negocio que  inició hace 3 años  mediante la venta por catálogo , actualmente María  ya cuenta con los productos  en su casa , de modo que esto hace más atractivo su negocio, al contar con una  tienda  para  sus clientas. Actualmente  ,Magdalena , se siente  comprometida  con su  labor de madre  y con su negocio,  su prioridad  es   ganar  dinero para seguir llevando  a su hijo Nacho  a  sus  tratamientos de rehabilitación.  Por lo que nos solicita  crédito, para llevar a cabo  sus  planes  de  ampliar su negocio  ofreciéndole   una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena B. K., “Miss Magda” is 40 years old.  She is a member of the Balam Nah de Carrillo group.  The name means House of the Jaguar in Mayan.  The group is located in the Carrillo Puerto community.

María Magdaleana has a room, which serves as a home as much as a store.  This is where she lives with her husband, Mauricio, and their three children.  Nacho is 21 (he has special needs), Yuridia is 12, and little Lisandra is seven and school age.

She needs to build another room to use as a store for her natural products sales.  She started this business three years ago selling by catalog.  María currently has the products in her house.  Having a store would mA. her business more attractive to her customers.

Magdalena currently feels committed to her work as a mother and to her business.  Her priority is to earn money in order to continue taking her son, Nacho, for his rehabilitation treatments.  That is why she is asking us for a loan, to be able to carry out her plans to expand her store and to present a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: Improvements to her business

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: F. Daler is 24 years old. Together with his wife, they have been raising two children. Daler is an experienced bread baker. He has been in this business for more than seven years. He bakes the national bread lepeshka at home. His brother helps him with the business. Having many customers, Daler is selling most of his products right from his place. However, he also runs a trading place in the local central market for selling the lepeshka. Now Daler requests a 7000 somoni loan. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale as required for his business. Daler is grateful to all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Mónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mónica Elizabeth M.  P. tiene 27 años, Es Soltera vive con la hija en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Mónica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa propia para la hija.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la hija.
texts.en:
Mónica Elizabeth M. P., 27, is single and has one child.  She lives in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.

The “JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS” (We Progress Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which belongs to Chillanes canton.  It has 12 members primarily involved in short cycle farming of corn, rice and small amounts of passion fruit and in raising small animals like pigs and chickens.

Mónica farms corn and raises pigs.  She buys her supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at Chillanes’ Sunday farmers market.
She is asking for a loan to plant corn and to buy animals as well as to buy feed and farming supplies.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  

The challenges she faces are infestations, diseases and variable weather.  Her dream is to buy a house for her daughter.  She enjoys excursions with her daughter.

loans.use: To plant corn, to buy animals and to buy feed and farming supplies.

loans.name: Fenix Group

texts.es:
La señora Erika Estrella M. C., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chipas México, vive en unión libre con el señor Damián Gómez E. y con quien procreo dos hijos: José Antonio de  cinco años y Erik Damián  de dos años.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo en fundación y es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  antojitos  en donde lleva nueve años y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos.

     Para dedicarse a esta actividad la animaron sus cuñadas, para que así tenga ingresos y se apoye con algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar y así cubrirlas sin ningún detalle.

    Con la ganancia que va obteniendo  lo invierte en la misma actividad y así seguir trabajando como ella le gusta realizar su venta de antojitos.

    Lo que desea es que con este oficio que tiene aunque humildemente logre tener ahorros para comprar materiales y construir su casa más grande.

     Las personas que integran en el grupo son las siguientes: 

Erika Estrella M. C.: ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de chorizos y tostadas.
Olga Lidia J. E.: Compra de productos por catálogo como ropa de mujer, lencería, sabanas, cholcas, etc.
Elaine H. H.: Compra y venta de cosméticos por catálogo de la marca BLONDY.
Fany J. E.: Compra y venta de cosméticos por catálogo de la marca JAFRA
texts.en:
Erika Estrella M. C. lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, Mexico.  She is the common-law wife of Damián Gómez E., and they have two children:  José Antonio (5 years old), and Erik Damián (2 years old).

This is the first time she has requested a loan from the foundation, and it will be used to buy ingredients to prepare appetizers.  She has been doing this for nine years, and thus supports her spouse with the income.

Her sisters-in-law encouraged her to take up this work, to have income and provide support for some of the household’s expenses, to cover them effectively.

She will use the earnings derived for the same business, and continue to work, for she likes selling appetizers.

Her wish is to use this modest business to have savings sufficient to buy materials and expand her house.

Members of the group are:

Erika Estrella M. C.:  she will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare sausages and toasted breads.
Olga Lidia Juárez E.:  to buy items by catalogue, such as women’s clothing, linens, sheets, bedspreads, etc.
Elaine H. Hernández:  to buy cosmetics through the Blondy catalogue and sell them.
Fany Juárez E.:  to buy cosmetics through the Jafra catalogue and sell them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients used to prepare sausages and toasted breads

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
Doña María, reside en Berlín, departamento de Usulután, en este lugar vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 15 años de edad, su negocio es una tienda donde ofrece artículos de consumo, su edad es de 46 años.
Este negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, lo inicio hace 10 años, el horario de venta es de 6:00am a 5:00pm, actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico, esta mercadería es de la que diariamente vende a los clientes, por esta razón es importante que tenga suficiente cantidad en su inventario.
