Las aspiraciones de doña María es que su negocio se fortalezca, que sea capaz de generar mejores ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María lives in Berlín in the Usulután department.  She lives with her husband and her two children, ages 8 and 15.  Her business is a store selling consumable goods.  She is 46 years old.

Her business is located in the municipal market, and she started it ten years ago.  Her sales schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She currently needs a loan to invest in beans, sugar, oil, soap, and toilet paper.  This is the merchandise that she sells daily to her customers.  For this reason it is important to have sufficient inventory.

Maria’s ambition is to strengthen her business so that it will be capable of generating better income.  That way she will improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy  beans, sugar, oil, soap, and toilet paper

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Don Armando C., es casado de 50 años de edad, estudio la educación secundaria solo el primer año, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la artesanía, a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, lleva 17 años de experiancia con este oficio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es artesana tambien que lo apoya en este trabajo, inicio este oficio gracias al apoyo de un familiar. 

Decide acercarse a ASDIR para solocitar un prestamo que le servirá para invertirlo como capital de trabaja para la compra de materia prima para la compra de hilo de diferentes clases para tejeduría. Espera mejorar su negocio con el prestamo que esta haciendo.
texts.en:
Armando C. is a 50-year-old married man. He only has one year of high school education and has one son. Armando works making handicrafts, weaving traditional clothing. He has been in this line of work for 17 years now. His wife, a craftswoman herself, supports him in his work. Armando got into this profession thanks to the support of a relative.

Armando decided to ask ASDIR for a loan in order to purchase material and different kinds of thread for weaving. He hopes to use this loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy material to make clothing.

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: Née en 1966 à Dogbo au Bénin, Séraphine a cinq enfants à sa charge, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec Séraphine. Séraphine est une veuve. Il y a environs quinze ans que Séraphine vit au quartier Cocotomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi avec ses enfants. Seule Séraphine assure les divers besoins de ses enfants. Pour y arriver, Séraphine achète des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, etc.), qu’elle vend à son domicile et au marché de Cococodji . C’est aux marchés de Dogbo et de Azovè que Séraphine s’approvisionne. Séraphine exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année.  Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Séraphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Séraphine avait obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Born in Dogbo, Benin in 1966, Séraphine has five children under her care, four of whom are her own. All of the children go to school and live together with Séraphine, who is a widow. Séraphine has been living in the Cocotomey neighborhood in the town of Abomey Calavi with her children for about the past fifteen years. Séraphine alone sees to the various needs of her children. In order to do so, Séraphine buys products for food production (corn, beans, cassava flour, etc.), which she sells from her home and the market in Cococodji. It's at the Dogbo and Azovè markets that Séraphine finds her supplies. Séraphine has been running this business for some ten years. With the goals of increasing her business and of better responding to her customers' level of demand, Séraphine is seeking a third loan from Alidé. Séraphine has previously secured two loans, both of which have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans and 3 sacks of cassava flour.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three school-age children. He has been working in the agriculture field for almost 25 years. He grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. These tents allow him to grow more types of products throughout the year. He is well established in his business. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work.  He estimates that with the coming harvest, his sales will increase and so will his profits.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Lorena Lizeth

texts.es:
Esta señora reside en la capital de Managua, es persona de buenos valores responsable y  trabajadora.  
La señora  Lorena Lizeth  preocupada  por mejorar su vivienda  ha solicitado un financiamiento  para la compara de  materiales de construcción como es arena cemento  mano de obra, piedrín, hierro y pago de mano de obra esto será utilizado para hacer ampliación y mejoramiento de su hogar  y así  ofrecerle  un hogar digno a su familia y también unificar deudas adquiridas por otras Instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the capital of Managua. She is a responsible and hard-working person with good values.
Lorena Lizeth was worried about improving her home and has requested a loan in order to purchase construction materials like sand, cement, labor, stones, iron and payment for the labor. This will be used in order to make extensions and improvements to her home. With these improvements, she can give her family a decent home and she can also consolidate debts with other financial institutions.

loans.use: improve her home, buy construction materials and pay down debts.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with 2 children.  Eduardo is providing motorcycle transport or habal-habal services.  He has had this business for 3 years.  He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for maintenance services.

Eduardo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for maintenance services

loans.name: Afissetou

texts.fr: Mariée à un tailleur,  Afissetou a 41ans. Elle vend de l’huile végétale de façon ambulante. Vu son âge, elle veut avoir un prêt pour mieux vendre afin d’avoir une boutique. Elle a 02 enfants et est dans son 6eme année d’ancienneté dans cette activité.
texts.en: Married to a tailor, Afissetou is 41. She sells vegetable oil as an itinerant salesperson. In view of her age, she would like a loan so that she can make more sales so as to have a store. She has two children and is in her sixth year in this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: AMEYO est revendeuse de cartes de recharges et divers. Elle est à son deuxième prêt et veut renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2008 de façon ambulante et achète chez les distributeurs agréés.
texts.en: Ameyo is a re-seller of top-up cards and various other products.  She is on her second loan and wants to strengthen her business.  She started in 2008 as a travelling saleswoman and buys from authorized distributors.

loans.use: To purchase top-up cards

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is now 57 years old and married. She is engaged in farming to create income for her family. In farming, she earned an average net income of PHP 40,000 in the previous cropping season. In the future, Adelaida hopes to earn consistent profits from farming to make her family more economically stable.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such fertilizers and to pay for labor fees for the people she hired to till, sow, pull and transplant her rice crop in the field. She has been doing this type of work for 25 years already.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such fertilizer and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 34 and is married with six children. She lives in Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past 10 years, she has been selling grilled and fried banana snacks to earn a living. Genie has been a member of PMPC for one month.

Genie is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase bananas to cook. In the future, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and see her children finish their studies through college.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to cook

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Hawa A.

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Hawa. She is married to a businessman and has 3 children, aged 11, 15 and 20 years. 

In 2001, Hawa established her textiles business. She began her business because she did not go to school; she decided to join her mother into business. When she got married, her husband set up her own little business for her so that she could help in supporting their family.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le1, 200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton and dry cotton for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL250,000. 

In the future, Hawa intends to open a shop. She will make it possible to pay the loan on time so that she will be able to access more loans. She wants her three children to go through university education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of wax and dry cotton for her business.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, from Vale, South Georgia, is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife Manana, his 6-year-old daughter and his retired parents. The sole income provider of the family, Zurab grows potatoes and cabbage on a family-owned 0.75 hectare plot of land, selling 8 tones of potatoes and 17 tones of cabbage per year to local greengrocery retailers. Total average family monthly income is 900 Laris, including Zurab’s parents' pensions.

Zurab has requested a loan to diversify his agricultural business. He plans to purchase six or seven calves to raise, and will sell them in the spring for a profit. Food for the calves will cost nothing, as he will mow the grass and make hay. The profits from this new enterprise will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Jennyfe

texts.en:
Jennyfe is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jennyfe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Jennyfe has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Jennyfe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for four years. From this type of business, she is able to earn about PHP 300 daily. She is grateful that her income allows her to help meet the daily needs of her children.

She is 33 year of age, married and blessed with three children. Her husband works as a farmer in their village, where farming is most common source of income. 

She would like to increase her income because the profit she generates is not enough. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to allow her to purchase stock of groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk, and sugar for her retail business.

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena, 26, is a single mother with one child.Mouena plants and harvests taro (a potato-like tuber) for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Mouena needs a loan of WST 2450 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or US $125 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family and pay for her son's school fee.

In 2008, Mouena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Mouena's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and married with two children. He has been operating a retail shop for four years to earn a living. Despite operating his business in a very competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good reputation.
  
Peter hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, soap, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, and maize flour

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun is widowed with one child. She is 52 years old. 

She plants cassava. To better support her family, she also makes fried bananas to generate additional income. She has been planting cassava for eight years. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to plant more cassava. With this loan, she hopes to grow more cassava, which will enable her to generate more income to better feed her family and improve her business.

loans.use: to plant cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina, a 39-year-old married mother of three,  earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 12 years and earns additional income from farming rice. Divina is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Safoura

texts.fr:
Safoura est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 9 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.  
Safoura travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1998. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Safoura a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Safoura voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safoura is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children who go to school. The first-born is nine and the youngest is seven years old.

Safoura has been working as a vendor since 1998. She sells cereals to a variety of clients at the market. She buys her product in Lomé. She works alone. Right now, she has no difficulties.

Safoura requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Safoura would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to make sure that her family's basic food needs are met.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Tushirikiane A Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Tushirikiane A group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Jane joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Jane invest in a cow and then build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Tushirikiane A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nelly Rafaela

texts.es: Doña Nelly, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto con su familia. Con el crédito anterior, doña Nelly a logrado establecer una red de vendedores permitiéndole obtener mayores rendimiento en las ventas, logrando de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ;  con este crédito que ahora le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondo Kiva, lograra  ampliar la oferta de  productos naturales, pudiendo asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en cuanto a nuevos productos   .
texts.en: Nelly lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her family.  With her previous loan, Nelly was able to set up a network of salespeople, which allowed her to get a higher yield from sales.  This has allowed her to improve her family's quality of life.  With the loan AFODENIC is currently offering her through Kiva's funding, she will be able to expand on the natural products she offers, thus allowing her to satisfy her customers' demands for new products.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramón es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de barrio que se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas con las otras. Son todas señora muy trabajadoras, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, lo que me da mas satisfacción es que son muy unidas y trabajan juntas.
María es una de las miembros, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, es decir de yuyos, ella comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, ya que ella recorre para venderlos y eso es muy agotador. Esta sumamente agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues no muchas instituciones se la darían.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios yuyos en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda estar abastecida y tener más variedad de especias.
texts.en:
The San Ramón Group is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members are all friends and neighbors who formed a group with the desire to get ahead and help one another. They are all very hard-working women and they are in their second loan cycle for women in business. I am most pleased by the fact that they are all very united and work together.

María is one of the members. She says she works selling natural remedies, or herbal remedies. She says her job requires a lot of work because she has to travel around to sell her products and it is very tiring. She is incredibly thankful for the opportunity provided by the loan institution, because many other institutions would not offer this help. She is asking for a loan to buy herbal remedies in bulk, so that she can be well-stocked and have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: buy natural remedies for resale

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec   AWA,  1ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 3" are married women averaging 35 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with AWA, the first one standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 180,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
Mario es el secretario del grupo “El Mirador” (en el video es el primero del lado izquierdo, que se presenta a los inversionistas Kiva), un grupo integrado por seis socios todos trabajadores y con muchas ganas de progresar.
Mario tiene 23 años, es soltero y estudia administración de negocios en la universidad.
Como es un joven muy emprendedor, Mario tenía muchas ganas de empezar su propio negocio. Así que, después de investigar la rentabilidad y demanda de algunos negocios, se decidió a empezar un negocio de lencería. Él compra los productos en un mercado mayorista y véndelos en su propia tienda. Solo empezó hace una semana pero está muy animado y creé que con este negocio va a conseguir ingresos suficientes para financiar sus estudios.
Mario invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos de lencería para su negocio como medias, calcetines, mallas, ropa interior, etc.
El mayor sueño de Mario es terminar sus estudios en administración y tener un buen hogar y una buena familia. El pide a los inversionistas Kiva que apoyen a su negocio y a los negocios de otras personan que tengan ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mario Salvador is 66 years old and has three children.  He is a member of the group "El Mirador", which is made up of six members, all of whom are hard-working and have a great desire to get ahead.  

Mario Salvador has been making furniture with engineered wood for 35 years.  He builds closets, kitchen cabinets, shelves, etc.  This work has helped him support his family and cover the costs of educating his children.  He currently has a small workshop in his house, which he has expanded little by little.  

He would like to invest the loan in the purchase of engineered wood to make furniture that he already has on order.  In the photo, we can find Mario Salvador in the bottom right.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of engineered wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Nancy Ester

texts.es:
Nancy de 45 años de edad, es una apasiona por los niños, tanto que desde hace 6 años, decidió crear en su casa un hogar comunitario con el fin de ayudar a  madres cabeza de familia con el cuidado de sus hijos mientras ellas laboran, de igual forma genera recursos para el sostenimiento de su casa y sus hijos de 14 y 19 años de edad. 
Su mayor sueño es tener un salón de juguetería para garantizarles a los niños acceso a una buena recreación, adquirir mayor conocimiento en la elaboración de talleres manuales con el propósito de transmitir su conocimiento y despertar la creatividad de sus pequeños.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la adecuación de su unidad locativa, espera poder invertir el dinero en la compra de baldosa para ofrecerles a sus niños un  espacio con mayor comodidad y menor riesgo.
texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old. She is passionate about children, so much that 6 years ago, she decided to create in her house a community home with the goal of helping working mothers with childcare while they worked. At the same time, she earns income to maintain her household and her own children, who are 14 and 19 years old. 

Her biggest dream is to have a room of toys to guarantee the children access to good recreation, to acquire more knowledge in making things with their hands and with the purpose of awaking the children's creativity. She currently is requesting a loan for modifying her space. She hopes to incest the money in the purchase of floor tiles to offer the children a space that is more comfortable and has less risk.

loans.use: to modify her space (with the purchase of floor tiles)

loans.name: Las Quimeñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS QUIMEÑAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de pollos a la broster, tienda de barrio, compra y venta de mineral, venta de ropa, venta de pan, jardinero.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina, azúcar, arroz) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS QUIMEÑAS” will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the "Centro Focal de Patacamaya". The group is comprised of eight members and is governed by a Board of Directors led by Cristina, their President. The members of the communal association work in a variety of activities including: selling candy, selling fried chicken, running a neighbourhood store, buying and selling minerals, selling clothes, selling bread and gardening. 

The loan they take out will benefit these small-business owners including Cristina. She states that this is her fourth cycle working with Pro Mujer (For Women). She became a member after being invited to do so by a Pro Mujer promoter who visited her home.  She currently has a neighbourhood shop, a business which she started on her own initiative. 

The loan will be used to increase resources; to purchase flour, sugar and rice from markets in the city of El Alto. These items will later be sold at her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can. She is married and has two children. 

When people ask her why she likes Pro Mujer (For Women), she answer is that she likes its focus on health.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a middle school-leaver. She is a single mother and has five children.

Currently, she sells food items like groundnut paste, canned tomatoes, powdered pepper, and oil in Elmina. She has been in this business for several years. 

The profits from her business normally go towards paying the family's utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of groundnut paste, canned tomatoes, and oil for resale.  

Joyce hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up her own shop and increase her working capital. In the future, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages and to give her children a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase groundnut paste, canned tomatoes, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Sabaly 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  SABALY 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43ans, 4 enfants  et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  FOUGATIE, un des villages de Yanfolila, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  SALI MOCTAR, 4ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  FOUGATIE , après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Sy Tha

texts.en:
P. Sy Tha is a caring father of three sons and one daughter. He currently drives a passenger taxi cart (tuk tuk), and earns about $12.50 a day. He is applying for a loan for $1,000 in order to purchase another tuk tuk, so that his son-in-law may join him in the business. The tuk tuk costs $1,380, but he plans on paying some of it from his current savings. P. Sy Tha's wife sells vegetables at the market and earns about $7.50 per day. His daughter works in a local factory and earns $60 each month. His three sons attend school every day.

 

He is excited about the increased income that adding another tuk tuk to the family business will bring. He hopes to be able to build his family a cement home in the future; their current home is made of wood. He believes that he will be able to increase his family's standard of living as a result of this loan.

loans.use: Purchase Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her general retail business

loans.name: Sieraseta

texts.en:
Sieraseta has been a member of the SPBD Program for two years. She is married and has two children.

Although her husband is a policeman and earns a steady income, Sieraseta still works hard to bring in the extra income that can raise her family’s standard of living and provide her children a good education.

She knows how to weave in the traditional Samoan fashion, and she leverages this talent to weave mats and bags and other items. She spends the bulk of her days at the flea market selling her products. Locals and tourists alike buy her wares.

Loaning funds to Sieraseta would help her purchase raw materials for weaving.

loans.use: Buy materials for making traditional Samoan handicrafts

loans.name: Assa Andre

texts.pt:
Assa M. is 42 years old. She is a single mother of two sons. Assa was born in the city of Maputo, she studied until the 5th grade. Since 2000 she has been supporting her family though the family business of raising chicken. In 2006 she was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema by friends. There she requested her first loan. Today her business is doing well. It employs two people including Assa.

With the loan of 9.2000,00 MT, Assa plans on increasing the volume of her business from 200 chicks to 300. Assa’s work has a positive impact in her community because it brings fresh chicken closer to her clients. With the income from her business Assa supports her family and pays for the education of her sons who are almost graduating from pre-university school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Bairro 1 - Boane CLIENTE : Assa M. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Avicultura VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 9.200,00MT (368.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de pintos para engorde INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/12/2007 Assa M. de 42 anos de idade, solteira, mae de dois filhos, Natural de Cidade de Maputo, estudou ate 5 classe. desde ano 2000 vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia (Criacao de pintos ). Em 2006, por indicacao de amigas teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo aproximo e solicitado e seu primeiro emprestimo para a criacao de pintos. Actualmente a sua actividade esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para duas pessoas, incluindo ela propria.

Com o emprestimo de 9.200,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume do negocio, dos actuais 200 para 300 pintos. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego coloca o produto (frangos) mais perto dos clientes. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, incluindo despesas escolares dos dois filhos que estao a concluir o ensino pre universitario.

loans.use: To produce chicken

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
Sra. Asuncion C., 53, is married with 5 children. She sells the basic ingredients required to make “chipas”. Chipas are a traditional food, much like bread, made with corn starch, cheese, milk, and vegetable oil, that is widely eaten in Paraguay. She has done this for more than 20 years and she told us that thanks to this work, she and her husband, Sr. Mario Fernandez, were able to give their family a good education and even buy their own house.

Her main customers are factories where they make chipas and bakeries in the neighborhood; they buy the ingredients—corn starch, cheese, vegetable oil, etc—from her daily. The San Francisco de Caacupe neighborhood, where she lives, is a prominent area for chipas production which helps her sales, especially on the first days after every weekend.

In the months up to December 8, the demand for chipas production is incessant because of the Virgin of Caacupe celebration on that day. Pilgrims from various parts of the country go to the city of Caacupe to attend the mass at the basilica there. Sales are very good during this period and the neighborhood hums with activity as everyone in the neighborhood busies themselves making chipas for sale.

Sra. C. is asking for the loan to buy more corn starch, cheese, and maize so that she can meet the huge demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Asunción, tiene 53 años, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de materia prima para la elaboración de “chipas”. La chipa es una comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y esta hecho a base de almidón, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Ella se dedica a esta actividad más de veinte años, nos comenta que gracias a éste trabajo, ella y su marido, el señor Mario Fernández, pudieron brindarle a su familia una buena educación y hasta adquirieron su casa propia.

Sus principales clientes son las chiperías (fábricas de chipas) y panaderías de la zona, quiénes en forma diaria compran los productos que ellos venden como ser almidón, queso, aceite vegetal, etc. El barrio San Francisco de Caacupé donde ella reside, es una zona eminentemente productora de chipas, por lo que su movimiento de ventas es muy bueno especialmente en los días próximos al fin de semana.

En los meses cercanos al 8 de Diciembre el movimiento de producción de chipas es incesante, ya que en esa fecha es el día de la Virgen de Caacupé y peregrinantes de diferentes partes del país van hasta la ciudad de Caacupé van a asistir a la misa que se realiza en la basílica. Por ello la venta es muy buena en esa época y genera un dinamismo en el barrio ya que casi en todas las casas de la ciudad elaboran chipas para vender.

Desea el crédito para comprar más almidón, queso, maíz, porque la demanda de sus productos es bastante alta.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman has a small business capitalizing on the huge demand in Ukraine for cell phones and related accessories. He started selling phones three years ago and now has a small stand in a market at the bus station in Borislav. Roman’s business is very personal. Often he will get a request for a specific phone or accessory, and he will make a special effort to find it if he does not have it in stock.

Currently the cell phone business is Roman’s second source of income. He also works at a factory to make ends meet. He is not married but hopes to save money and one day be able to start a family. Roman has requested a short term loan of $200 to give him extra capital to purchase inventory for his business. Nadiya Ukraine is happy to be able to provide the means for Roman to strengthen his business and continue working toward his goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Elyane

texts.en: Elyane G. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli City in Azerbaijan. Her family settled in Beylagan in 1993. She is selling fruits and vegetables with her mother in the Beylagan city bazaar. She wants to expand her business and because of this she needs a loan of $600.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Adriana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Since Adriana was a little girl, she has worked with her mother, who made a living selling hamburgers and tostadas. After she got married, she decided to start a business like this to be able to make income in addition to that of her husband so she could have money for her children's expenses. Litlle by little, she has acquired clients who buy from her often.

However, the fight to grow her business continues, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $1125, which she is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money, Adriana will be able to buy merchandise to supply her business and also to make some repairs like painting her business. With your help, Adriana will be able to keep her business growing so her kids can inherit it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Adriana desde pequeña trabajaba con su mamá quien se dedicaba a la venta de hamburguesas y tostadas. Después de casarse decidió comenzar un negocio igual para poder obtener ingresos extras a los de su esposo y así poder tener dinero para los gastos de sus hijos. Poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo clientes que le compran frecuentemente.

Sin embargo la lucha por crecer sigue y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $1,125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con este dinero Adriana podrá comprar mercancía para surtir su negocio además de hacerle unos arreglos como pintar el negocio. Con tu ayuda Adriana podrá sacar adelante su negocio para que este les quede a sus hijos como un patrimonio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
Julia Yamileth S. M. has two school-aged daughters. Her business is a general store and, since of a young age, she has worked at sales with her mother. She tells us her husband is with her and their children, but that he earns very little money. For this reason, feeling the need to help out with the family’s living expenses, she set out to start her own enterprise. She recalls it being very difficult at first but, little by little, over time, she began to grow the business.

Julia’s primary need is to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her store. Toward this end, she has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. She is very gratified by the loans they have granted her at opportune times, helping her to keep her store stocked and to meet the needs of her customers each day. She has a record of 12 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia Yamileth S. M., soltera, tiene dos hijas las que están en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven ha trabajado vendiendo con su mama, nos cuenta que su esposo ha estado con ella y sus hijos pero que también él gana muy poco dinero. Por este motivo es que ella sintió la necesidad de ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar, es a si que ella con la poca experiencia que tenía decide poner su propio negocio, nos cuenta que al comienzo le fue duro pero poco a poco se vino desarrollando en el negocio.

La mayor necesidad de doña Julia es la adquisición de los productos para su pulpería y por este motivo trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se le otorgaron en el momento más oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 12 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira was born in 1947 and she is married. Her husband is a pensioner and his monthly pension is 250 KM. They have 2 children, 31 and 37 years old. She works as a translator (German-Croatia). She wants to buy computer with this loan in the amount of 1000KM to help her to do her work more profesionally.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her translating business

loans.name: Rasoola's Group

texts.en: Rasoola B. is a widow from Lahore, a large city in Pakistan.  She has four sons, none of whom could finish school due to their father’s prolonged illness and death. One of her sons is a carpenter and wants to buy a lathe.  The other women in this group are:  Khalida B., who manufactures carpets; Abida J., who will invest in her family's business; Shumaila B., who embroiders clothes; and Najma J., who also embroiders clothes.  As a group, they are requesting a loan of $1,150.00.

loans.use: To buy a lathe.

loans.name: Ndimyake

texts.en:
Ndimyake is married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 3 years old. Ndimyake is a chicken keeping,she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Giovanna Jaqueline

texts.es:
Giovanna is 37 years old. She is married and has two sons who are still dependent on her and her husband. She studied accounting in university but no longer practices her profession because of a lack of opportunities. She lives with her in-laws in the Razuri neighborhood in Trujillo, Peru.

Giovanna has sold children’s and baby clothing since 1997, though she left for a time to care for her sons and also because she had insufficient resources. She was able to take up her business again thanks to an initial loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) that was given to her by the Manuela Ramos organization, which she invested in purchasing merchandise. Giovanna belongs to Las Jadeitas Communal Bank.

Giovanna will use the present loan of 1900 Soles ($700) to purchase clothing for the Mother’s Day holiday and the winter season; the loan will be repaid in 4 months. She will deliver the clothing to the homes of relatives, friends, and other customers who have placed orders.

Giovanna dreams of having her own stand where she can sell her merchandise. That way she would be able to improve her income, which would in turn allow her to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Giovanna, esta casada, tiene 37 años y 02 hijos varones dependientes aún de ella y de su esposo, tiene estudios superiores de contabilidad, pero no lo ejerce por falta de oportunidades, y vive junto a sus suegros en la Urb. Razuri - Trujillo – Perú.

Desde el año 1997, Giovanna se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños y de bebe, dejando por un tiempo el negocio por dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos y por no contar con recursos suficientes; retomó el negocio gracias a un primer préstamo otorgado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, de S/.300, invirtió completamente en la compra de mercadería. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Jadeitas”,

Con el préstamo de S/. 1900. el cual cancelará en 4 meses comprará ropa por campaña del día de la madre y por temporada de frío, ella utiliza la modalidad de reparto a domicilio de los pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigas y demás clientes.

Giovanna sueña con tener un stand propio donde poder vender su mercadería y así mejorar sus ingresos lo cual le permita comprar su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in alcoholic beverages for a small bar.

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
More than eight years ago, 18 women formed the “Corazones de Oro” Association. They work together with the Pro-Mujer family convinced that they can improve their quality of life. The majority of the women live in the Senkata neighborhood in the city of El Alto. The most common activity among them is the preparation and sale of food in local markets and boarding houses, as is the case with Bacilia who rents a space where she can offer, for the most part, traditional food like chairo paceño (soup made with dried potatoes and lamb), fricase (stew made with pork, white corn and dried potatoes) and pork rinds among other dishes.

The women affirm that an increase in food prices caused an imbalance in their earnings, which is what brings them to ask for additional credit. They will inject capital into their businesses in order to maintain economic stability in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace mas de nueve años 18 mujeres conforman la asociación “Corazones de Oro” que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer, convencidas de que pueden mejorar su calidad de vida. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona de Senkata de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo la actividad mas común entre ellas la elaboración y venta de comida en mercados del lugar y también en pensiones, como es el caso de doña Bacilia, que alquila una pensión para ofrecer por lo general comida tradicional como ser: chairo paceño, fricase, chicharon y otros, afirman que el alza de los precios en los alimentos causo desequilibrio en sus ganancias lo que les lleva a solicitar créditos mayores para inyectar capital a sus negocios, con el unico fin de mantener estabilidad económica en sus hogares

loans.use: Injection of capital into the group's food businesses

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: This is the second time Mr. Chen B. has asked for a loan to improve his business. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Sounvong Village in Kandal Province. He now faces a problem because his motorbike is too old and he uses a lot of money on gasoline to support his motorbike. In order to reduce family expenses on gasoline, Mr. Chen B. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings and to buy a new a motorbike for his business. His wife, Mrs. Bun Khoen, is a housewife. Mr. Chen B. is 60 years old and the father of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending school.

loans.use: to add to his savings to buy a new a motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi H.  est née en Février 1961 à Lomé. Elles est mariée et a quatre  (04) enfants plus une personne à charges. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer son activité de restauration, accroître  et ouvrir une boutique d’alimentations générales et avoir ainsi une indépendance financière.
texts.en:
Ablavi H. was born in February 1961 in Lomé. She is married and has 4 children plus one other person in her care. She is requesting this loan to improve and grow her little food service business and to open a general store so as to have financial independence.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase crockery, window curtains and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi T. est revendeuse des sacs et des trousseaux bébé depuis 2003 à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs et aussi en louant un magasin pour l’installation de ses marchandises. Afi est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Afi T. has been re-selling bags and baby clothing since 2003 in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second credit from FECECAV, she would like to grow her small business by buying bags and also by renting a store for the installation of her goods. Afi is 39 years old, is married and a mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of bags and baby clothing

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is a mother of two kids; one is currently in school. She is a 32-year-old trader. She trades in lace and material. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She also sells shirts and skirts. For lack of adequate working capital, Beatrice buys few extras of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education. 

Beatrice belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust group. The group members guarantee a loan through a repayment pledge and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase bulk lace materials and textiles to resell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. sells firewood. The demands for her firewood is high. Victoria is 43 years old and is married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. 

She needs a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more firewood to sell. She says "thank you" to everyone who has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina F. is thirty four years old, married and a mother of three children. Her kids are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Bawjiase, a suburb of Accra, the capital city of Ghana. Augustina loves trading, the business through which she earns bread for her family. She is a petty trader, who trades in cassava, yams, plantain, maize, etc. She sells in the community market. She treks to the farming communities to procure the foodstuffs and retail to her customers.

Her husband is a taxi driver in the Bawjiase community. Augustina’s support of her husband is known from her resourcefulness in food provision for the family and payment of utility bills. She believes education is the best legacy a parent can leave to a child, so matters of her kids' education are of utmost concern to her. She believe she can do better in her business when she is resourced with additional working capital in the form of a loan, which will enable her to purchase more stock to serve her customers. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and save more to finance her kids' schooling.

She is a member of a community group called Special Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase cassava, yams, plantain, maize, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede is 45-years old and married with a child. Abosede sells drinks, bottled water and handkerchiefs in her shop. She has been in this business for many years. Abosede lives in Ilaje, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell. She says thank you for helping her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Ifigenia C. T. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción”, del Barrio Bolognesi, en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios primaria competa 
Ella Trabaja recientemente con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas de forma ambulatoria; ella desea obtener un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar sus comidas (arroz, fideos, gas, aceite, papas, etc.), su anhelo en el futuro es tener su casa propia donde colocará su propio restaurante; finalmente ella desea contribuir con la educación de de sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales. 
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que la dan para poder superar su negocio y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Efigenia C. T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgin of the Assumption,” Bolognesi neighborood, Yunguvo district, Yunguyo Province, Puno. She’s 42 years old, married, and has four children. She completed her primary school studies. She’s recently been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She works in portable meal preparation. She wants to obtain a loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, an amount she plans to invest in the purchase of food staples (rice, beans, gas, oil, potatoes, etc.). In the future, she longs to have a house of her own where she could put her own restaurant. Above all, she hopes to contribute to her children’s education so that they become professionals. She appreciates the opportunity that Manuela Ramos has given her to improve her business and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of food staples: rice, beans, gas, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses A. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He is a tailor, and he also sells tailoring materials and wall clocks. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more wall clocks and tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and clocks to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. She says some have completed senior high school while others are still in the junior high school. The firstborn is currently studying at the tertiary level. Her husband is in the sand-winning business. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Grace is a trader. She trades in food items such as yam, tilapia, and vegetables, and she sells on a tabletop in the market square. She procures tubers and other goods from a nearby town called Afram Plains. She has been in business for three years and desires to expand her business. She hopes to give all her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure food items for sale.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima M. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says all her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. Alima lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver while she is a food vendor. She sells fried yam and fish. Alima procures tubers of yam all the way from Atebubu in the northern sector. She sells by the road side from afternoon to evening. Alima has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yam in bulk

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar C. V. , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio la borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual le poya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos , los cuales estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace treinta años, se dedica a la agricultura , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , , los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversificar sus cultivos .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios que ha logrado por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar C. V. is 38 years old and lives in the Borgoña neighborhood of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who helps out with the home. They have three children who study and help with the agricultural work. He would like to provide his family with better living conditions. He has worked in agriculture for 30 years. He began this work with support from his parents. In the future, he would like to diversify his crops. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers and supplies to improve his production. This is his sixth round with Afodenic and he is thankful for the benefits he’s been able to gain for his family’s welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Avant ce monsieur était un agent commercial, mais étant marié et père de famille. Le revenu de sa profession ne lui permettait pas de couvrir toutes les charges de sa famille, il a alors démissionné pour se lancer dans le commerce de produits laitiers FANMILK. Il s’approvisionne auprès de la société FANMILK. Son congélateur  est en panne ce qui a entraîné un baisse considérable de son chiffre d’affaire, il veut acheter  un nouveau congélateur pour rehausser ses ventes, il demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter un congélateur, il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman, who used to be a commercial agent, is married and the father of a family. The revenues from his profession did not allow him to support his family entirely. So he resigned his job in order to get started in the commerce of FANMILK milk products. He supplies himself through the FANMILK company. His freezer is out of order, resulting in a considerable drop in his sales figures. He wants to buy a new freezer to increase his sales. He’s asking WAGES for his first loan to buy a freezer. He is married and the father of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is fifty years old. She is married with two children. Currently, both are in school. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. at the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand her business. Grace hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide the children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married and has been blessed with 2 beautiful daughters. She also has four parents who depend solely on her for all their needs. With such a big financial obligation, Stella started a retail store last year in Machakos. She is now seeking a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to increase the stock in her retail store. Her five year strategic plan is to operate a wholesale shop. Her dream is to see her children get the best education and help the needy in the society.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel M.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Daniel trabaja como obrero en construcciones privadas de La Paz, ingresos con los que se mantiene y a sus dos hijos ya que es viudo.
El crédito solicitado es para la curación de su hijo menor, que sufrió la fractura de su muñeca en un accidente.
Esta es la novena vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel M. lives in his own home, in the Pasankeri area, west of the city of La Paz. He works as a construction worker in private constructions in La Paz. With his income, he supports himself and two children. He is a widower. The requested loan is for the medical care of his youngest son, who suffered a wrist fracture in an accident. This is the ninth time requesting a loan and the the socioeconomic research done indicates that he is qualified to access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEDICAL CARE FOR HIS YOUNGEST SON WHO FRACTURED HIS WRIST IN AN ACCIDENT.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 38 years old. Resty is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Resty engages in a traditional gold mining activity called Pamiling. He sells mined gold dusts in the local community. Resty has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Resty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resty successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that he used to to pay for the fabrication of equipment used in his gold mining.

Resty is requesting his 4th loan from HSPFI for 13000 PHP to repair his house. He plans to use the additional revenue to completely repair his house and to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in his business and repair his house.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ilem Group

texts.en:
Janeth is a member of the Ilem borrower group Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 10,7, and 5 years old.

Janeth has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 6 years. She works10 hours day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Janeth first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Janeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Oliva is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya is a single Mom. She raises her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her small trade 10 years ago when second hand sales business was only getting started in Ukraine. Today she has a nice kiosk selling second hand items and getting about 7,000 Grivnyas of income each month. She has about 60,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. 

This time Ibolya is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is hoping to re-stock her kiosk and make more profit this season ensuring stable income for the family for upcoming winter season.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and sell spare parts

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun V., 32 (not pictured) and his wife, Mrs. Rany Som, 22 (pictured) have been married since 2004 and have no children yet. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mr. Savoeun V. has been a driver for three years, and his wife has been selling clothes for two years. Additionally, Savoeun started a new business selling Khmer noodles. He buys the noodles in his village for resale at the Prek Phnao market. 

Savoeun is requesting his second loan of $1,000 in order to buy a motorbike for commuting. He will use a part of his loan to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to repair his car.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda J. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 49 years old. Melinda is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad Moreno is 69 years old, widowed with 7 children and also stands as the head of the family. Currently living at fine-looking place of Tagbac, Antipolo City. She is engaged in food vending business (Preparation of foods and selling it to consumers) and also get involved in Buy and Sell of “Uling” means Charcoals, and retailing of small items and goods.

She has seven children, the eldest is 39 years old and 29 years old is the youngest. Five of her children had not finish studies in college just only finished high school because she is a poor women that couldn’t sustain well for the education of her children. Currently she has one child who is in studies in college and she hopes to finish the studies of her son through the benefit of having loans from ASHI- KIVA field Partners. She believes that her business will help them to rise up and fight for poverty and provide the needs of her son in college studies and to have a comfortable house to live with.

She plans to use the loan amounting Php 35,000 for the expansion of her business and get involved in another business to gain more profit. At her older age, she hopes for a better and more secure retirement and to enjoy the good of older life. For 15 years being a Member of ASHI she had shown a very good performance and she is being trusted by ASHI for the length of time she stayed having loan to completely achieve dreams in life to have a successful business and best in life.

loans.use: expansion of her food vending business

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario del Pilar es una socia emprendedora y jovial, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es divorciada y es madre de dos hijos menores de edad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace dos años y se dedica a la venta de gaseosas.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en la compra de cajas de gaseosas.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de gaseosas y néctares. 
La meta de Rosario es terminar su carrera de técnica en enfermería y construir una fuente soda.
texts.en:
Rosario de Pilar is an enterprising and good-humored member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali Region. She is 34-years-old, divorced, and the mother of two young children. She has been a member of the "Las Tigresas" Village Bank for two years; she earns her living selling soft drinks. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which they allowed her to invest in cartons of soft drinks. Currently she is seeking a loan for 300 soles, which she will use to buy soft drinks and fruit juices. Rosario's goal is to end her career as a hospital technician and open a sweet shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll use her loan to buy soft drinks and fruit juices.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eladia es propietaria de una Despensa en el barrio San Isidro de la Ciudad, es madre de 3 Jóvenes una mayor y dos menores de edad, vive en casa propia y todos estudiantes.
La Cliente es una mujer luchadora que ha sobresalido con sus hijos adelante, su despensa es muy bien surtida, cuenta con artículos de primera necesidad, embutidos, carnicería, artículos de limpieza, etc.
Mediante el crédito otorgado por la Fundación pudo ampliar su negocio y contar con nuevos productos de calidad y buen precio, de esto precisaba ya que en esta época las ventas aumenta masivamente.
Eladia manifiesta estar conforme trabajando con la Institución, y aprovecha la oportunidad a la confianza que se le brinda.-
texts.en:
Eladia is the proprietor of a shop in the San Isidro neighborhood in San Ignacio. She lives in her own home and is mother of three children who all study, one of whom is an adult.

She is a hardworking woman who has overcome challenges, putting her children first. Her shop is well-stocked with grocery items, meats, packaged goods, cleaning supplies, etc.

With the loan provided by the Foundation she will be able to increase her business by stocking new quality products at reasonable prices, which she needs to do since this is the season when her sales increase significantly.

Eladia asserts that she agrees to work with the Institution, and will make good use of the opportunity provided by their confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale, such as rice, flour, sugar, noodles, baked goods, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Dionicio Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Dionisio es un hombre muy esforzado, tiene 53 años de edad, y su trabajo es de taxista por el cual lo ha ejercido desde hace veinte años, su esposa vende ropa, zapatos y junto a ella han logrado criar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos son mayores  y dos menores, su objetivo es poder seguir mejorando su pequeña vivienda el cual solo mediante el crédito ha podido hacer esta obra , ya que las carreras están bajas debido ala alza de combustible que esta sufriendo el país y por tal razones los clientes no quieren pagar el costo alto, y la opción que toman es la mas barata la ruta, lo cual solo la alimentación y los gastos necesario cubre. Y con esta solicitud de crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer un muro a lado para mayor seguridad de propiedad, como la misma seguridad de su familia ya que solo su cerco esta cerrado con pequeños pedazos de zinc viejo el cual espera mejorar pronto y poco a poco ir cerrando todo, así como, hacer un sumidero para mejor higiene. Para poder ofrecer  a sus hijos un techo digno.
texts.en:
Dionisio, 53, is a hard-working man who has worked as a taxi driver for 20 years. His wife sells clothing and shoes and, together, they have managed to raise their four children, two of whom are adults and two are still minors. His goal is to continue to make improvements to his small house which, up to now, he has only been able to do thanks to these loans because the recent hikes in fuel costs in the country have made transportation costs for people much higher. Therefore, passengers tend to forego taxi rides and opt for the less expensive choice, the bus. He is making barely enough to cover basic needs like food. With this loan request he will buy building materials like: stone, sand, cement and iron to build a wall so that his property and his family will be more secure since his current fencing is merely small, old pieces of zinc metal sheeting which he hopes to improve soon and bit by bit close everything off. He would also like to install a sewer drain for better hygiene so that his children can have a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies like: stone, sand, cement and iron, to build a wall.

loans.name: Batzul

texts.en:
Batzul is 32 years old and lives alone in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Batzul operates a taxi service in his town. He enjoys transporting people. He says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers.”

Batzul started his business in 2003 after conducting a vegetable-trading business for three years. During that time he gained much experience in conducting a business and saved some money in order to buy a car.

This is Batzul’s second loan that he is requesting from Kiva. With his first Kiva loan he bought a plot of land and built a house for himself. He is planning to expand his house in the future. He says, “I am doing my best in order to have a decent living standard before getting married.”

Batzul is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase parts for his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro 2 & 9 Group

texts.en:
Eladia, 49, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, 'Trabajando Para el Futuro' (Working for the Future), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Eladia and her husband have three children and live in a simple home in Samana, a city on a peninsula with the same name in the northeastern part of the Dominican Republic. Life in Samana can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate health care. Despite these difficulties, Eladia runs a successful business selling seafood. The area is known for its fishing industry, and since it is a peninsula, the demand for and availability of fish is quite high. With this loan, Eladia will catch and purchase fish, shrimp, and crab to sell for a small profit.

This is Eladia’s ninth loan with Esperanza International. With her profits, she hopes to buy a small boat so she can catch more of her own seafood, giving her a greater profit margin. She also will buy her children school supplies, including notebooks, shoes, and backpacks. With continued investments into her business, Eladia hopes to one day have her own home. With your loan, Eladia will be well on her way to reach these goals.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Eladia and the 'Trabajando Para el Futuro' group!

loans.use: Fish, shrimp, and crab to sell for profit

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Reynalda es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Reynalda  es casada, tiene 58 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 2 viven con ella, Reynalda venD. ropas interiores y lencería D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado central D. la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Reynalda necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. interiores y medias.
El sueño D. Reynalda es tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Reynalda is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She is married, is 58 years old and has 8 children, 2 of whom live with her. Reynalda sells undergarments and lingerie walking around the central city market, an activity she does every day. Reynalda nees a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of underwear and socks. Reynalda's dream is to have a fixed shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear and socks

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel A.  labora arduamente en uno de los mercados de Managua con el fin de llevarle el bienestar a su pequeño hijo a su cargo el cual se encuentran en edad escolar y por tanto debe suplir todas sus necesidades.

La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y levantar las paredes de esta con el propósito de beneficiar a su pequeño hijo. Entre los materiales de construcción que comprará se encuentran el cemento, arena y también pagará la mano de obra.

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado muy satisfactoriamente y de esta manera beneficiar a su familia y principalmente a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel A. M. works as a bus fare collector in the Roberto Huembes de Managua market. He has one child in his care who is school-aged. He is married, and this is his second loan with CEPRODEL. He will invest this loan in improving his home, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement and sand, and to pay for labor costs to reinforce the walls of his home. His goal is to provide better security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal BOLIVIA, en su Secuencia 8, está formado por 9 clientes, 7 mujeres y 2 varones, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Pampahasi, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina D. Emprender las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa, carteras, cosméticos, venta D. comida. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros debido que uno D. sus familiares falleció, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. 

La Sra. Maria Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco se dedica a la confección D. polleras en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con esta actividad hace 4 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. telas y otros artículos para la confección D. polleras.  Vive con sus  hijos mayores y nietos, se desconoce su estado civil D. la socia, aunque en su hoja D. datos indica que es soltera.
