En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Yolanda Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. pescado en la misma zona  cuenta esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo esta destinado a incrementar su capital. Casada con el señor Néstor tiene tres hijos. Asimismo, la socia Yolanda nos cuenta que, cuando ingreso a Emprender el muro D. su casa se estaba por caer, y con los créditos D. emprender realizo el arreglo D. su vivienda el cual ella esta agradecida. Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo. 

La Sra. Erika, es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la confección y venta D. ropa. El préstamo esta destinado para compra D. tela y asi incrementar su capital. Soltera tiene un hijo, vive con sus familiares en la zona D. Pampahasi. Su meta es tener su propia microempresa y realizar sus ventas al por mayor.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bolivia," in its 8th loan cycle, has 9 members: 7 women and 2 men. The majority of the members are from the Pampahasi zone, which is located in the vicinity of the EMPRENDER office. The members sell a variety of products such as clothing, wallets, cosmetics and food. In the previous loan cycle all of the members paid off their debt with the exception of 2 members who paid with their savings, due to the fact that one of their relatives died. These members left the bank. Maria is the representative, and she currently holds the title of bank president. She makes polleras (traditional Bolivian skirts) in her home. She has been carrying out this activity for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy fabric and other items needed to make the polleras. She lives with her oldest children and grandchildren. Her marital status is unknown, although the data sheet indicates that she is single. In her communal bank she has stood out as a responsible person who is punctual with her payments. Erika, elected as secretary, makes and sells clothing. She will use the loan to buy fabric and increase her capital. She is single and has one son, and she lives with relatives in the Pampahasi zone. Her goal is to have her own small business and to sell at wholesale. Yolanda, the member who is acting as the bank's treasurer, has been selling fish in the same area for 10 years. This loan will be used to increase her capital. She is married to Nestor and has 3 children. In addition, Yolanda tells us that when she came to EMPRENDER the wall of her house was about to fall, and with the loans she was able to fix her home, for which she is very grateful. She is one of the representatives of the communal bank, and she was elected to this post because she had demonstrated responsibility as a guarantor and fellow group member. All of the members are very grateful to EMPRENDER and Kiva for the trust provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: fabric and other products

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 34-year-old married man who is blessed with two children, a six-year-old and a two-year-old.  He has been selling clothes, bags, bottles and water containers for ten years and has two employees. He was previously employed before he ventured into business.  

Martin also rents out houses to earn more income for supporting his family.  He joined Faulu Kenya with a group of young entrepreneurs.  This has allowed him to access loans from Faulu Kenya because his group members guarantee him, hence his business has really improved.  He plans to buy a motorbike for transporting his goods because he has customers in different locations. He wants to add clothes, bottles and water containers to his inventory and buy a weighing machine.  For this reason, he has requested a loan of Kes. 90,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to someday employ more people and to enlarge his business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike, add clothes, bottles, water containers to his inventory, and buy a weighing machine

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: A. Célestine est née en 1960 et vit depuis trente cinq ans environs au quartier Agata à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à CODJO Toussaint, Célestine est mère de six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Mais trois des enfants restent encore à la charge de Célestine et de son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis dix huit ans environs, Célestine vend divers articles (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, huile d’arachide, savons, bougies, biscuits, farine de manioc, etc.) dans son quartier. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Célestine achète ses produits. Célestine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq prêts qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Célestine souhaite augmenter son stock de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle et se faire plus de profits. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité que Célestine sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Célestine A. was born in 1960 and has lived in the Agata quarter of Cotonou, Benin's administrative capital, for around 35 years. She is married to Toussaint Codjo and has six children; some of them attend school, but three are still under Célestine and her husband's care. The couple share the family demands between them. Célestine never attended school, and for around 8 years she has sold various products (tomato and sardine pastes, milk, peanut oil, soap, candles, manioc flour etc) in and around her quarter. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from ALIDé, and is seeking another in order to increase her inventory levels to better satisfy her customers' demands and to generate more profit.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing pastes, soap, insecticide, peanut oil etc

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo B. is from the village of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old. Rodolfo is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Rodolfo operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing painting services to the local community as he is a painter. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Rodolfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rodolfo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R., 37, is committed to making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs, and devotes a major portion of every day to ensuring that she earns enough money to give her six children a better life.  For the last several years, she has made a living as a garbage collector.

Myrna has been a member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends meetings and pays dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to take out several loans from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is able to repay her loans on time because she has made good use of these loans to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the continued success of her small company, she has applied for a new loan, for PHP 23,000. She will use this money to buy a new sidecar and repair her old one. She will also buy a new wooden cart.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and repair existing equipment

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma O., 29, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has a 3-year-old child. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a farming business, with most of her revenue coming from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. She is saving money she earns to be able to pay for her child's future education.

Alma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has already successfully repaid her first two loans  from CEVI and is now requesting a new one - in the amount of 8,000 PHP - which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Alma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: Purchase of general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita T. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 37 years old, married, and has seven children. To make a living, Rosita render her service in house to house basis as a manicurist. Rosita has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her business. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used as an additional capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy materials for her business

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Manos Confeccionistas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MANOS CONFECCIONISTAS
EL GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR LA SEÑORA TELMA ILEANA P. B., QUIEN ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO .  SU NEGOCIO ES LA CONFECCON DE BLUSAS DE TELA EN DIFERENTES COLORES .  SU MERCADO ES VARIADO Y CUENTA CON LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSO.  TAMBIEN LA SEÑORA VICENTA GERTRUDIS C. CANEL  ES COMPAÑERA DEL GRUPO VENDIENDO UNICAMENTE BLUSAS DE TELA DE MANERA AMBULANTE.  SARA ELIZABETH C. C.  TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS DE TELA. ELLAS  TIENEN MUCHOS SUEÑOS Y METAS Y DECEAN LOGRARLOS CON LA AYUDA DE DIOS Y  A TRAVEZ DE  PODER INVERTIR BIEN EN SUS NEGOCIOS EL PRESTAMO QUE ESTAN SOLICITANDO YA QUE  ELLAS MENCIONAN QUE AUNQUE TENGAN MUCHOS PLANES SI NO TIENEN EL CAPITAL SUFICIENTE NO PUEDE HACER MAYOR COSA, ELLAS ESTAN MUY CONTENTAS DE TENER LA OPORTUNIDAD DE QUE  KIVA LES APOYE ATRAVEZ DE FAPE.
texts.en:
Sewing Hands Solidarity Group

This group was formed by Sra. Telma Ileana P. B., who is the group representative. Her business involves producing blouses out of fabric in various colors. She has an assortment of inventory and receives help from her husband.

Sra. Vicenta Gertrudis C. Canel is a fellow group member who sells only blouses made of fabric as a street vendor. Sara Elizabeth C. C. also makes blouses out of fabric. They have many dreams and goals that they hope to achieve with the help of God. With the loan they are requesting, they plan to invest well in their businesses. Unless they have sufficient capital, they are not able to do anything. They are glad to have this opportunity to receive Kiva support through FAPE.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for their businesses

location.town: Cantón San Francisco, Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Ped

loans.name: Agamammad

texts.en:
Agamammad M. is 54 years old and is married with five children. He dedicated himself to his livestock business in 2000. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Agamammad decided to increase his income and for this he requires more animals, so he is planning to buy more sheep.

His monthly profit is about 300 AZN and he believes with this loan he could increase it to 500 AZN. He applied for 1,500 AZN so he can purchase both lambs and cattle.

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and one calve

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia G. is a 31 year old who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, electronic reloading (mobile-phone credits) sales and charcoal vending. She lives in Lunas, Brgy. Kawit, Bogo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ignacia is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ignacia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old and is married with one adult child. Estrella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling boost food like bread and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Estrella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables, maize and beans which she sells locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family. Rose is 35 years old and married with six children between 16 and six months. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested this loan of 60,000KES to start a poultry project. She says her family will be able to live a better life and also see her children through school with the income from this project. The prevailing low market prices are a major setback for her. In five years' time, she hopes to have acquired two quality dairy cows so that she can diversify her source of income.

loans.use: To start  a poultry project.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Doña Patricia, es casada, tiene 47 años D. edad,  se dedica a la vender productos D. belleza, venD. en el mercado D. salcajá todos los días, tiene 16 años D. vender, lo cual ha sido una fuentre D. ingresos para ella. Necesitando capital para comprar  mercadería y siendo una persona con liderazgo reúne a otras once mujeres para solicitar crédito en ASDIR formando un Banco Comunal el cual lo llaman Los Girasoles. La mayoría D. las señoras tienen negocios los cuales son ambulantes y ellas al igual que doña Pattricia sueñan con lograr adquirir un local propio para agrandar el negocio que tiene y asi loghrar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Patricia is married, 47 years old, and works selling beauty products in the Salcajá market every day. She has been in sales for 16 years, and this has been a source of income for her. She needs capital to buy merchandise, and being that she is a leader, she joined with eleven other women to apply for a loan from ASDIR. They formed a communal bank called "Los Girasoles" [The Sunflowers]. The majority of these women have traveling businesses, and like Patricia, they dream of establishing stores of their own to expand their businesses and improve their incomes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ntonwa Bakyara Tweimukye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Devis B. belongs to Ntonwa Bakyara Tweimukye group with members who hold each other accountable for paying back loans. Devis is a self-motivated and hardworking married father of seven children. For over eight years he has been operating a motorcycle transport business, motorcycle transport being the most common and accessible means of conveyance for locals in the area. He earns 120,000 UGX on a monthly basis that helps him in undertaking family responsibilities such as educating his children and making other provisions.

As Devis envisions more means of generating income, he is looking forward to buying beans and maize for a produce business. He feels this loan will be of great importance in implementing this new business.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize for a produce business

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (20201030016) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong-Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children. V. owns & operates a business providing general services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month.

In 2007, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.496.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her business. V. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her 5th loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


V. Nguyễn Thị (20201030016) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, V. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  V. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua vật tư cần thiết để mở rộng dịch vụ được cung cấp.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  V. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio S. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 62 years old. Elpidio is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elpidio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elpidio has been engaged in his business for over 32 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elpidio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elpidio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 33,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Elpidio is requesting a new loan of 38,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Elpidio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Bourema

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bourema D., âgé de 45 ans, marié à une femme et père de 3 enfants, vit dans le quartier Médine de la ville de San (région de Ségou) .
L’activité principale de Monsieur Bourema est l’agriculture à savoir l’achat et la vente de jeunes plants (arbres fruitiers et non fruitiers) à San. 
Monsieur Bourema D. confectionne d’abord des pépinières et achète ensuite à Sikasso auprès des pépiniéristes et planteurs,  des plantes jeunes de : (Manguiers, Nîmes , Caïcédras, Cocos etc.)  Il fait cette activité il y’a plus de 7 ans. Il est très sollicité dans son activité.
Dans le souci de satisfaire ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux, Bourema à intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième cycle de prêt individuel et les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Il envisage acheter 300 pieds de mangue, 100 pieds de Nîmes et plusieurs autres plantes sur commandes.  
Le bénéfice escompté par mois est de 100 000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des échéances, subvenir au besoin de sa famille  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Bourema D. is a 45-year-old married man and father of three children. He lives in the Medina district of the city of San (region of Ségou).

His main activity is agriculture, more specifically the purchase and sale of seedlings (fruit and non-fruit trees) in San. First, Mr. D. makes the nursery beds. Then, in Sikasso, he purchases seedlings from nurserymen and planters, including Mango trees, Nîmes trees, Caïcédras trees, Coco trees, etc.).  He has been in this business for over seven years and is in very high demand.

In order to satisfy his growing clientele, Bourema joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his third individual loan cycle. The two previous loans have been fully repaid.

He plans to buy 300 mango seedlings, 100 Nîmes seedlings, and several other plants on order.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and provide for his family, the remainder to be invested in his business.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. operates a food joint at Abura. Ekua has received a junior high education, is married, and has four children. Her husband is a mason, and she assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be enable her to increase her capital to expand her business. She will use the loan to purchase more food stuffs and ingredients to prepare food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children. 

In this picture, Ekua is stirring the soup she had made.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs and ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Phath

texts.en:
Mrs. Phath T. is 42 years old, married to Mr. Heng Hy (on the right in the photo) and has four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one helps her parents with their businesses, one is attending the local school, while the youngest is five years old and not in school yet. Phath and her family live in Preaek Louk in Kandal province.

Phath and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they cultivate rice. Heng is also a fisherman. Because of the insufficient yield from their rice farm, Phath and her husband don’t have enough money to cultivate rice properly. So Phath would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline and to hire laborers to plow her farm for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline and to hire farm laborers

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, la socia produce y vende los quesos en el mercado de la ciudad de Cusco llamado Huancaro, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer queso.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department.

Gregoria is 49 years old, single, and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling cheese.  She makes and sells the cheese in the Huancaro market in the city of Cusco.  She works from 7:00 a.m until 4:00 p.m.  She gets her children ahead through this business.  She wants to expand her business of selling cheese.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make cheese.  She is very happy about the loan, and she pledges to make all of her payments.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make cheese

loans.name: Suzzy

texts.en: Suzzy E. is a widow who takes care of 7 dependants. She has completed her senior year of high school education. Suzzy sells "wakye" (rice and beans cooked together) at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. This dish is normally served with spaghetti, hot pepper and tomato sauce. Suzzy uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She is asking for the loan to purchase more rice, beans, and other food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Suzzy plans to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans and other food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah W. N. is a single lady. She is a mother of two children, aged ten years and six years.  She hopes to give them a good education to the university level. She owns a curio shop, known as Manyatta Curio Shop. She sells curios to local and international tourists. Her business is located at Kajiado and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has been in this business for the last six years and has managed to give employment to three people. She says that this business is profitable. The major challenge is seasonal because she depends on the tourists.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to pay rent and the license fee for her premises. She will add stock with the remainder of the money. She hopes to grow her business, purchase land and build rental houses in future. She describes herself as a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: Rent, license and curios

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Pacanga, que está ubicado en  la Provincia de Chepén, una zona que se encuentra situada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales desde hace quince años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general en su domicilio. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Dora se vale de los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad para solventar la economía de su familia.

Dora desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus tamales de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y aumentar sus ventas, lo cual le permitirá realizar también algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Dora is the mother of a family, and 46 years old. She lives with her two children in the agricultural Pacanga district, which is located in Chepén Province, a region that is situated more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked for fifteen years preparing and selling tamales. She makes her products at home and then offers them for sale to the general public from her home. The business has been well-received by her customers owing to the good seasonings she uses to prepare her food. Dora uses the income from this work to make ends meet for her family.

Dora wants to expand her business by purchasing enough tamale-making supplies so she can increase her production and her sales, which will also allow her to make some improvements to her home. For this reason, she thought it best to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles ($550) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making tamales and for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Lorena Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Lorena Julieta Resales tiene ya mas un año dedicándose a su negocio de abarrotes este es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar variedad de mecánica que le están solicitando sus clientes ya que para ella es muy importante satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así le sigan consumiendo en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su negocio, ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y desea darles el estudio necesario para su futuro.
texts.en:
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su negocio, ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y desea darles el estudio necesario para su futuro.

Lorena Julieta Resales has had her grocery business for over one year.  It is the source of income for her family.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting.  It is very important to her that she satisfy her customers’ needs.  That way they continue making purchases from her business.

She plans to pay for the loan with part of the income that she gets from her business.  She has three children who are her responsibility, and she wishes to give them the education that is needed for their future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 29 años, natural del distrito de Ayna, es una joven jovial, trabajadora y sin compromiso, vive en casa de sus padres y se esmera por prosperar en la vida por la cual trabaja con mucho ahínco. Justina es dueña de una imprenta, llamada “Multiservicios – imprenta San Francisco”, ubicada en la zona céntrica dentro del distrito de San Francisco. Donde hace trabajos de gigantografías, boletas, facturas, recibos por honorarios, volantes, sellos, entre otros, en sus labores cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador con conocimiento en diseño grafico quien esta encargado de realizar todo los trabajos encomendados por parte de la clientela. Justina viene promocionándose en este negocio hace 02 años y le va muy bien y cuenta con mayor demanda a comparación de  sus competidores. Los planes para el futuro de su negocio es comprar una fotocopiadora ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio en su puesto de ventas; pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar  papelería ya que tiene pedidos de afiches, publicidades y tarjetas matrimoniales. Este es su primer crédito de Justina con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a las socias de su banco comunal por permitirle integrarse al grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará papelería ya que tiene un compromiso por cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Justina is 29 years old and a native of the District of Ayna. She is a lively and hardworking young woman who has no family obligations. Justina lives at home with her parents and strives to achieve success in life by working hard. She owns a print shop called “Multiservicios – Imprenta San Francisco” located in the downtown area of the District of San Francisco. There she produces billboard posters, billing statements, invoices, receipts, leaflets, labels, and other types of printed documents. She has the help of one employee who is in charge of graphic design and fulfilling all of the requests submitted by the customer. Justina has been promoting her business for two years and has done very well. The demand for her services has increased in relation to her competitors. The future plans for her business include purchasing a photocopier since she has enough space in her sales location. At the moment, her greatest priority is buying paper because she has orders for posters, advertising leaflets, and wedding invitations.

This is her first loan with MFP. Justina feels this loan will be a great help with advanding her business. Therefore, she is willing to complete her payments on time. She is grateful that the other members of her Communal Bank allowed her to join the group. This loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy paper since she has pending orders that she has committed to fulfill for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase different types of paper.

loans.name: Betsy Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Betsy, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres ya son mayores de edad y una chica de 12 años que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos.

Ella es un gran ama de casa que además de atender muy bien el hogar también los tres últimos días de la semana se dedica a la venta de ceviches de pescado, en estos días instala en su casa un pequeño restaurante para que acudan sus clientes  a servirse este delicioso plato. Su hija le ayuda en la atención y nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que esto le ha servido para ayudar a su esposo cuando el no ha  tenido trabajo.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar, pescado chifles, colas y otros ingredientes para la preparación de este delicioso plato. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 14 años y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) community bank meet in Bajo de Montecristi, in Manabí province.  This is a small place which is surrounded by a lot of vegetation.  The locals work in different business activities such as selling products and working in factories.

Here we meet 50 year-old Betsy who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are already grown up and her youngest daughter is 12 years old and in school.  Two of her children still live with her.  Her husband makes bricks.

Betsy is a great housewife who, in addition to looking after her home very well, also spends the last three days of each week selling ceviches de pescado (raw fish marinated in citrus juice).  On these days she sets up a small restaurant in her home so that her customers can come and enjoy this delicious dish.  Her daughter helps her to serve her customers.  Betsy tells us that she has been in this business for several years and that it has enabled her to help her husband on occasions when he hasn't had work.

Betsy will use this loan to buy fish, plantain chips, colas and other ingredients for making her delicious dish.  She has been a member of her community bank for 14 years and she enjoys being a member because the loans have always helped her.

Betsy's goal is to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, plantain chips, colas and other ingredients

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eulalia, ella tiene 35 años de edad y la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 15, 7, 3 y la socia se encuentra esperando un bebe; la socia por el momento se encuentra vendiendo verduras en el mercado, la socia compra al por mayor de los proveedores las verduras y ella los limpia, lava las verduras una por una sacando la tierra de ellas y lleva a vender al mercado. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Eulalia, 35, is the member.  She’s married and has three children who are 15, 7 and 3 years of age.  She is expecting a baby.  For the moment she’s selling vegetables in the market.  She buys at wholesale from suppliers, cleans them and takes them to sell at the market.  She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables.

She is grateful and expresses that she will meet her repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kazinga Development Group

texts.en: Banard, 36, sells maize and beans to earn his living. This business, which he began two years ago, has, in a way, significantly enabled him support to his family of three kids and his wife. Banard lives and operates his business from Kihihi. He sells his foods in food markets in the district. It goes without saying that his business has not lasted so long but Banard says it's been worthwhile, especially in terms of bringing in some income for him. He says hard work is a principal factor he firmly believes in. Weekly, he says he makes profits totaling to 80,000 shillings. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more bags of beans and maize to resell. Banard is the one with the raised hand.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier, tiene la edad de 42  años, está casado, el  vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y en producción lo que pretende es generar este año una mejor cosecha. El quiere generar una  mejor plantación para este año y así obtenerle el máximo de ganancias para seguir adelante con sus metas y el bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Javier is 42 years old, married, and he lives with his 3 children and his wife. They are his greatest priority. He plans on purchasing products to help him maintain his coffee plantation. He has an already established and productive coffee plantation and he plans on improving the yield of his harvest this year. He wants to improve his plantation this year to increase his profits, to meet his goals, and to improve the wellbeing of the family. This is the first loan which he receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had previous loans through state banks but Fudecosur has granted him a loan with greater benefits and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Merlisa

texts.en:
Merlisa is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlisa has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Merlisa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en: Anhbayar is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, who is 5 years old, attends kindergarten. With the help of her husband she manages a clothing trading business at Narantuul, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business 6 years ago and is planning to expand it in the future. She is diligent woman who says, "I want to continue my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase summer clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme  âgé(e) de 47ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 03 enfants. Afi travaille comme revendeuse de produits alimentaires (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2003. Elle vend à toutes personnes. Elle achète les produits au marché d’Assiyéyé et au Grand Marché de Lomé. Afi a requis son deuxième cycle de crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 02 paniers de tomates fraiches, 02 bidons d’huile, 02 cartons de lait, 01 sac du sucre et des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
Afi is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 3 children. She has worked as a retailer of food products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2003. She buys her products at the Assiyéyé market and at the grand market of Lomé.

Afi has asked for a second loan from Wages in order to buy 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 barrels of oil, 2 boxes of milk, 1 bag of sugar, and food items.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 44 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 14.

Bernadeth has been engaged in farming for 8 years. She and her husband own and till land in Banga, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow at their farm. Bernadeth does her best to keep their farm productive because it is her family’s main source of income.

Bernadeth has requested a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha, 46 years old, is a banana seller. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, and their income is $2 per day. She has five children; three are studying, and the other two are working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $88 on food, $15 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy materials for repairing her house because it is not in good condition. In the future, she expects to send her children to study at least to finish high school.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Yawa. She is married and has four children who are 30, 25, 18 and 13 years old. For the past 15 years, Yawa has been selling cow skin to raise money to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Yawa serves mostly very poor people, as they cannot afford to buy meat but buy the cow skin because it is very cheap. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. Yawa has a good credit history and now needs a loan of Le 3,000,000. She needs a loan to buy more dried cow skin for her business. Yawa hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Yawa plans to build a house and educate her children very well. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more dried cow skin for her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 33 años es madre de familia, vive con su hijo en casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropa, accesorios y algunos productos de uso doméstico negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos 3 años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderia y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
33-year-old Isabel is a mother, and she lives with her son in their own home. Their house has electricity for light only, and is located in the district of Mórrope in the administrative division of Lambayeque. This area is characterized by farming, ranching and tourism.

Isabel sells clothing, accessories and some household products. For around three years, she has been conducting her business from her home. She offers the merchandise to customers from her store, and also delivers orders. Isabel is trying to increase the demand from her customers so she can earn a higher income to meet her family expenses.

As Isabel's business is becoming increasingly prosperous, it has become necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise and stock her store with innovative products, so that her client base continues to grow and she can repay her loan and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to offer to her clients

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 51-year-old married woman with five children: three sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a farmer and raises pigs. 
For the past ten years, Huong has supported her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells a large range of products from household items to personal use products. 
Huong would like a loan to buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: to buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ozuipa

texts.en:
Ozuipa is a resident of Ananievo. She is 41 and married to a driver. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and live separately with their families and the son has just graduated from school. Two years ago with an initial investment of 1,500 soms, Ozuipa purchased 10kg of meat and started to prepare pelmeni (a meat-filled boiled dumpling) at home. Selling pelmeni, she earns about 5,000 soms to meet the family needs. This profit made it possible to purchase a fridge for her home to improve their living conditions. With money received from the loan, Ozuipa wants to purchase a sheep to slaughter. In the future, she wants to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 50 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Celsa has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Celsa would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as canned goods, rice, shampoo and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: C4832 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old and is married with two children between the ages of nine and eleven. She is the leader of this group, which is called "Abizeranye." Jacqueline is pictured in the middle. 

Jacqueline has been in her business for about one year. Her business operates from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Jacqueline and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, this team will expand their business by purchasing more clothes. If successful, Jacqueline  and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn would allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they would continue to improve their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nenisa

texts.en: Nenisa is a 35-year-old, married woman who has four children, one is in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Nenisa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is married and has three children. He lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. For 10 years, Benson has been a farmer. He loves what he does although he faces some challenges such as climate change and inflation. Benson needs the loan to pay workers to dig and to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to pay workers to dig and to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3  filhos  ainda sem idade Escolar. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ningem. 

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo quando se juntou com o pai dos seus filhos, é negociante ha mais de 20 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( amendoim, arroz, oleo, açucar, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende investir mais no negocio para obter mais rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the district of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is unmarried and has three children, all of whom attend school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She left Chibuto for Maputo when she met her children's father. She's had a business selling staple goods for more than 20 years and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her income for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (peanuts, rice, oil, sugar, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to invest in her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, rice, oil, sugar, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26 year old business-lady.  She sells shoes and trousers to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years.  She started her business after getting enough capital from her car hire business. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business because she has been economically empowered and has been trained on business management skills.
Alice hopes to move to a bigger business premises in five years.  She needs a loan of 70, 000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes and trousers.

loans.use: To buy shoes and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs Ha is taking the loan out for her son, student Linh. Linh is attending the University for Electronics. The duration of his study is 4.5 years and it will be completed in 2013.  After graduation, he will become an information technology engineer. He hopes to find a job at a computer company. Currently, he wants to get a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay his tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel es una señora de 40 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.
Desde hace varios años que Rosibel se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó como intermediaria con mercadería ajena y poco a poco ha ido haciendo sus propias prendas. Pero en estos momentos, le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  
Actualmente Rosibel está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones) para  darle mantenimiento a dicho negocio y comprar más ropa para que haya un incremento, ya que la demanda es grande. Su meta es tener un local en un futuro, donde se pueda instalar bien con sus mercaderia y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Rosibel es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Fuente Agrícola, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 40, lives with her family in La Fuente, in Cartago province.  The main water run-off system in this area is the Reventazon River, which starts up in the Cuericí mountain.  Because of the fertility of its land, due to its volcanoes and floodplains, Cartago is a town where agriculture and livestock production are the main economic activities.

Rosibel has been selling clothing for a number of years.  She started out as an intermediary selling merchandise from others, and gradually she has been making her own garments.  But at this time, she lacks the money to make her business expand, which would benefit the neighbors in her community.  So Rosibel is requesting a small loan of 600,000 Costa Rican colones to invest in her business and buy more clothing, since the demand is strong.  Her goal is to have a store in the future that she could fill with merchandise. This would allow Rosibel and her family to have a better quality of life.

Rosibel is a member of the "Fuente Agricola" communal bank, one of the 150 such organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue to grow, both at the personal and economic level.  In addition, she expects to participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

loans.use: with her business selling clothing

loans.name: Zayniddin

texts.ru: Зайниддин мужчина 40 лет.Он родился и вырос в семье врача. Зайниддин женат и имеет 3-х детей. Зайниддин сотрудничает с МДО Арванд уже с 2014 года. Он имеет три голов крупнорогатого скота. Дополнительный доход Зайниддин получает от  дехканства и подрабатывает столяром. В дехканском хозяйстве имеет 1,0 гектар земли, из них 0,20 га винограда и 0,80 га для выращивания пшеницы. Зайниддин хочет увеличить поголовье скота, а также приобрести для них корм. Он заранее благодарен МДО Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Zayniddin is 40 years old.  He was born and grew up in the village of Nidzhani, located not far from the city of Istaravshan, in the Sughd region of Tajikistan.  His father worked as a doctor at the local dispensary in Nidzhani.  Zayniddin is married and the father of three children.  He has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2014.  He owns three head of cattle.  He makes an extra income working on a midsized peasant farm and also offering his services as a carpenter.  He owns one hectare of land from the peasant farm "Kushnazar Bobo" and grows grapes on 0.2 hectare and wheat on 0.8 hectare of land.  Zayniddin wants to increase his cattle headcount and also to buy animal feed.  He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle and livestock feed.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia was born in San Luis Potosi, but she has lived in Monterrey for 30 years with all her family. She moved to Monterrey looking for new and better oportunities. She started her business by only selling her children's used clothing to her families and friends. Now she is successfully selling used clothing and new clothing (since 1994) and has two stores in diferents markets open only Wednesday and Friday. She is requesting this loan to purchase clothing because the new season is coming and she wants to be prepared. She will purchase more inventory for her two stores. Cecilia hopes that at the end of the year her sales increase approximately by 30%.

loans.use: Cecilia needs a loan to buy clothing now, becuse the new season is coming and she wants to be prepared and will get inventory for her two stores.

loans.name: Faauluuluga

texts.en: Faauluuluga is a mother of three, living in the village of Siumu, doing a German bun business, and supplying them to Palalaua College in her village. She makes a 120 German buns a day, but that doesn't  satisfy the high of demand from the students every day. Her main goal is to hire 3 women in her village to help her provide a level of customer-friendly service that exceeds her clients’ expectations, and to supply as many German buns as needed by the clients, because she now realizes that she’s also getting orders from the families in her village. But to achieve her goal, she needs to budget her time wisely with her business and her children, with the help of her husband.

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour and cooking oil for her business, and expand her home for the business

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en: Tiana is a married mother of two from the Samoan village of Faatoia.  She runs a general store in this small village.  While her husband is employed, his earnings do not cover the expenses of their family.  Tiana opened a small store, and the income is a crucial supplement to the family finances.  Tiana has been able to use past loans to finance expanding the inventory for her store, and she will use these loan funds for a similar purpose.  Tiana is determined to provide for her family’s future, and thus makes a weekly deposit in her savings account.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Luis  Alonso

texts.es:
Hello my name is Luis Alonso, I’m a carpenter. I’ve had a carpenter’s workshop in downtown for several now. It generates an income to cover my family’s expenses and other obligations that I have with providers. I have 3 children and they all are in school. My biggest need is to purchase wood since I have a lot of clients that for lack of wood I haven’t been able to meet their needs, taking into account that for these works the wood has to be dry.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Luis alonso mi actividad principal es la carpintería (elaboración de muebles de madera), cuento con una carpintería en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demás compromisos con los proveedores, tengo 3 hijos y están en la escuela. mi mayor necesidad es la compra de madera ya que tengo muchos clientes y por falta de madera no me es posible atenderlos. tomando en cuenta que para estos trabajos la madera tiene que estar seca.

loans.use: Buy pine, cedar and mahogany wood.

loans.name: Lonia Margarita

texts.es:
Lonia Margarita S. R. lives in the Marcará district, Carhuaz Province, in Ancash Department. She is 36 years old. She became a widow 6 years ago and she has 3 children, to whom she must be both mother and father.

She sells chocho (which is a salad made with lupin beans, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and condiments) from the door of the house where she lives. Five years ago, she heard there was an institution that gave loans to women. She learned about how Manuela Ramos works and decided to become involved in the “Madres Marcarinas” Communal Bank.

The loan for S/. 1,500.00 (approximately $475.00) that she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients for her business. She says that the loans she has received in the past have helped her business a lot. It has grown, and thanks to it, she can educate her children, pay the rent for her house, and it allows her to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Lonia Margarita S. R. vive en el distrito de Marcarà, Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash. Tiene 36 años, desde hace 6 años enviudó y se quedó con 3 hijos, siendo para ellos padre y madre. Su actividad económica es la venta de chocho (es una ensalada elaborada a base de chocho, cebolla, tomate, lechuga y condimentos), vende en la puerta de la casa donde vive. Hace cinco años se enteró que había una institución que daba préstamos a las mujeres, se informó del funcionamiento de Manuela Ramos y decidió formar parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Marcarinas”. El préstamo solicitado por S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles (US$ 475.00) lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para su negocio. Ella manifiesta que los créditos le ha ayudado mucho en su negocio, ha crecido y gracias a ello puede educar a sus hijos, pagar el alquiler de su casa y le permite vivir mejor.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto is a small milk producer and a small potato, barley and grain farmer. He sells his products in La Paz and uses this income to support himself, his mother and his 15-year-old brother. Sixto lives in the community of Batallas in Caluyo, two hours from the capital city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to help increase his milk production. This is his second loan with IMPRO, where he has been a client since 2006 and whose evaluation has found him to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Sixto es productor de leche de vaca y pequeño agricultor de papa, cebada, quinua y chuño, los cuales son comercializados en la ciudad de La Paz y son la fuente de sus ingresos con los que mantiene a su madre y hermano de 15 años. Sixto vive en la Comunidad de Batallas - Caluyo (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito solicitado será destinado para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y la evaluación actualizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. Thun S., 51, is a mother of six children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works making Khmer noodles and sells them to the people in her community. With this activity, she is able to earn profits of around $1.50 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a farmer growing rice crops and various kinds of vegetables, making on average around $0.50/day. Two of her children are currently employed at a garment factory, while the others are unemployed or enrolled in school. Mrs. Thun S. is humbly requesting a loan amount of $1000 to purchase a car for one of her children to operate a taxi business. She is confident that this loan will enable her son to provide another source of income.

loans.use: To  purchase a car for one of her children to operate a taxi business.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu has run this business for 5 years. This 32-year-old woman is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory. She lives in Fuzuli town and is settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. She is single. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods to improve her business and get more income.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en: Sveta R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Sveta is 31 years old. She is single and operates a small beauty salon. She lives with her parents, brothers and sisters. She started her business because she needed to help out even more with the family's expenses. She wants to be a successful woman. She applied for a loan of $900 because she wants to purchase more merchandise and increase the number of customers by offering a greater variety of products.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa N. is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She has been the owner of a restaurant called Tantine de Fufu (Fufu Aunty) for 10 years. (Fufu is a local dish.) The restaurant is located downtown and welcomes many low-income customers. With the income from it, she covers over 80% of family expenses because of her husband's paltry and unsteady income. She is on her second loan, which is something she has always repaid. With the present loan, she is thinking of improving her restaurant's accommodations to meet customer needs and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Yawa N., mariée et mère de 04 enfants tous à l’école est propriétaire d’un restaurant Dénommé tantiD De fufu (Plat local) depuis 10 ans. Ce restaurant est situé au centre ville et accueille de nombreux clients à faibles revenus. Avec le revenu elle participe à plus de 80% des charges familiales du fait des revenus dérisoires et réguliers de son mari. Madame Yawa est à son deuxième crédit qu’elle a toujours payé .Avec le présent crédit elle pense améliorer la capacité d’accueil de son restaurant afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle et d’augmenter son revenu

loans.use: Fix up her restaurant's decor
